original: Ṛgveda
analyzed: ṛgveda
translated: Ṛg Veda

original: tvāṃ hy agne sadam it samanyavo devāso devam aratiṃ nyerira iti kratvā nyerire /
analyzed: tvām hi agne sadam id samanyavaḥ devāsaḥ devam aratim nyerire iti kratvā nyerire
translated: For you, O Agni, the gods, all of one mind, have placed as a god, as a priest, the immortal one whom the mortal ones worship, whom the mortal ones worship with thought.

original: amartyaṃ yajata martyeṣv ā devam ādevaṃ janata pracetasaṃ viśvam ādevaṃ janata pracetasam //
analyzed: amartyam yajata martyeṣu ā devam ā devam janata pracetasam viśvam ā devam janata pracetasam
translated: Worship the immortal god among mortals, generate the all-wise god, generate the all-wise god.

original: sa bhrātaraṃ varuṇam agna ā vavṛtsva devāṃ acchā sumatī yajñavanasaṃ jyeṣṭhaṃ yajñavanasam /
analyzed: sa bhrātaram varuṇam agne ā vavṛtsva devān acchā sumatī yajña vanasam jyeṣṭham yajña vanasam
translated: O Agni, turn to your brother Varuṇa, to the well-disposed god who delights in the sacrifice, to the eldest who delights in the sacrifice.

original: ṛtāvānam ādityaṃ carṣaṇīdhṛtaṃ rājānaṃ carṣaṇīdhṛtam //
analyzed: ṛtāvānam ādityam carṣaṇī dhṛtam rājānam carṣaṇī dhṛtam
translated: To the truthful Āditya, the supporter of men, to the king, the supporter of men.

original: sakhe sakhāyam abhy ā vavṛtsvāśuṃ na cakraṃ rathyeva raṃhyāsmabhyaṃ dasma raṃhyā /
analyzed: sakhe sakhāyam abhī ā vavṛtsva āśum na cakram rathyā iva raṃhyā asmabhyam dasma raṃhyā
translated: O friend, turn to your friend like a swift wheel to the chariot path, like a swift one to us, O wondrous one.

original: agne mṛḷīkaṃ varuṇe sacā vido marutsu viśvabhānuṣu /
analyzed: agne mṛḷīkam varuṇe sacā vidaḥ marutsu viśva bhānuṣu
translated: O Agni, be gracious to Varuṇa, the knower, among the Maruts who shine for all.

original: tokāya tuje śuśucāna śaṃ kṛdhy asmabhyaṃ dasma śaṃ kṛdhi //
analyzed: tokāya tuje śuśucāna śam kṛdhi asmabhyam dasma śam kṛdhi
translated: Be gracious to our offspring and our youth, be gracious to us, O wondrous one.

original: tvaṃ no agne varuṇasya vidvān devasya heḷo 'va yāsisīṣṭhāḥ /
analyzed: tvam naḥ agne varuṇasya vidvān devasya heḍaḥ vaḥ yāsisīṣṭhāḥ
translated: You, O Agni, who know Varuṇa's law, may you best carry us across the distress of the god.

original: yajiṣṭho vahnitamaḥ śośucāno viśvā dveṣāṃsi pra mumugdhy asmat //
analyzed: yajiṣṭhaḥ vahnitamaḥ śośucānaḥ viśvā dveṣāṃsi pra mumugdhi asmat
translated: As the best offerer, most purifying, shining, drive away from us all enmities.

original: sa tvaṃ no agne 'vamo bhavotī nediṣṭho asyā uṣaso vyuṣṭau /
analyzed: sa tvam naḥ agne vamaḥ bhava ūtī nediṣṭhaḥ asyāḥ uṣasaḥ vyuṣṭau
translated: So be thou, O Agni, our nearest friend, most near at the rising of this dawn.

original: ava yakṣva no varuṇaṃ rarāṇo vīhi mṛḷīkaṃ suhavo na edhi //
analyzed: ava yakṣva naḥ varuṇam rarāṇaḥ vīhi mṛḷīkam su havaḥ naḥ edhi
translated: Worship thou Varuṇa for us, granting (us his favour); come, be thou easy of access and prompt to hear.

original: asya śreṣṭhā subhagasya saṃdṛg devasya citratamā martyeṣu /
analyzed: asya śreṣṭhā subhagasya saṃdṛś devasya citratamā martyeṣu
translated: This is the most delightful sight of the most fortunate God among mortals.

original: śuci ghṛtaṃ na taptam aghnyāyā spārhā devasya maṃhaneva dhenoḥ //
analyzed: śuci ghṛtam na taptam aghnyāyāḥ spārhā devasya maṃhanā iva dhenoḥ
translated: Like pure heated ghee of a milch cow, the desirable God's (sight) is like a cow at the time of sacrifice.

original: trir asya tā paramā santi satyā spārhā devasya janimāny agneḥ /
analyzed: tris asya tā paramā santi satyā spārhā devasya janimāni agneḥ
translated: His three highest (sights) are true, the desirable births of the God Agni.

original: anante antaḥ parivīta āgāc chuciḥ śukro aryo rorucānaḥ //🔽sa dūto viśved abhi vaṣṭi sadmā hotā hiraṇyaratho raṃsujihvaḥ /
analyzed: anante antar parivītaḥ āgāt śuciḥ śukraḥ aryaḥ rorucānaḥ  sa dūtaḥ viśvā id abhi vaṣṭi sadmā hotā hiraṇya rathaḥ raṃsu jihvaḥ
translated: The endless one has come within the enclosed (altar), pure, bright, noble, shining.🔽He, the messenger, looks down upon all the seats, the priest, with a tongue that moves, with a golden chariot.

original: rohidaśvo vapuṣyo vibhāvā sadā raṇvaḥ pitumatīva saṃsat //🔽sa cetayan manuṣo yajñabandhuḥ pra tam mahyā raśanayā nayanti /
analyzed: rohit aśvaḥ vapuṣyaḥ vibhāvā sadā raṇvaḥ pitumatī iva saṃsad  sa cetayat manuṣaḥ yajña bandhuḥ pra tam mahyā raśanayā nayanti
translated: The ruddy-horsed, beautiful, shining one, always friendly like a well-attended assembly.🔽He, thinking, the friend of Manu in sacrifice, they lead him with a great rope.

original: sa kṣety asya duryāsu sādhan devo martasya sadhanitvam āpa //
analyzed: sa kṣeti asya duryāsu sādhan devaḥ martasya sa dhani tvam āpa
translated: He moves about, accomplishing his duties in his houses, the God comes to the mortal's wealth.

original: sa tū no agnir nayatu prajānann acchā ratnaṃ devabhaktaṃ yad asya /
analyzed: sa tu naḥ agniḥ nayatu prajānan acchā ratnam deva bhaktam yat asya
translated: May that Agni lead us on, the wise one, to the treasure that belongs to the gods.

original: dhiyā yad viśve amṛtā akṛṇvan dyauṣ pitā janitā satyam ukṣan //
analyzed: dhiyā yat viśve amṛtāḥ akṛṇvan dyauḥ pitā janitā satyam ukṣan
translated: When all the Immortals have made it by their wisdom, the Father Dyaus, the begetter, hath shed forth the truth.

original: sa jāyata prathamaḥ pastyāsu maho budhne rajaso asya yonau /
analyzed: sa jāyata prathamaḥ pastyāsu mahaḥ budhne rajasaḥ asya yonau
translated: He is born first in the houses, great in the depth of his own realm, in the region of the sky.

original: apād aśīrṣā guhamāno antāyoyuvāno vṛṣabhasya nīḷe //
analyzed: a pāt a śīrṣā guhamānaḥ anta ayoyuvānaḥ vṛṣabhasya nīḍe
translated: Footless, headless, he hath filled the ends, the young bull in the womb of the strong one.

original: pra śardha ārta prathamaṃ vipanyāṃ ṛtasya yonā vṛṣabhasya nīḷe /
analyzed: pra śardhaḥ ārta prathamam vipanyām ṛtasya yonā vṛṣabhasya nīḍe
translated: The first of the impetuous ones in the wood, in the region of the truth, in the womb of the strong one.

original: spārho yuvā vapuṣyo vibhāvā sapta priyāso 'janayanta vṛṣṇe //
analyzed: spārhaḥ yuvā vapuṣyaḥ vibhāvā sapta priyāsaḥ janayanta vṛṣṇe
translated: The desirable, the young, the more beautiful, the shining one, the seven dear ones have generated the strong one.

original: asmākam atra pitaro manuṣyā abhi pra sedur ṛtam āśuṣāṇāḥ /
analyzed: asmākam atra pitaraḥ manuṣyāḥ abhi pra seduḥ ṛtam āśuṣāṇāḥ
translated: Here our fathers, the men, have sat down, longing for the truth, hastening to the sacrifice.

original: aśmavrajāḥ sudughā vavre antar ud usrā ājann uṣaso huvānāḥ //🔽te marmṛjata dadṛvāṃso adriṃ tad eṣām anye abhito vi vocan /
analyzed: aśma vrajāḥ sudughāḥ vavre antar ud usrāḥ ājan uṣasaḥ huvānāḥ  te marmṛjata dadṛvāṃsaḥ adrim tat eṣām anye abhitas vi vocan
translated: The stone-enclosed, the well-milking, in the wood, the dawns have arisen, the dawns invited.🔽They have polished the stone, the seers, and others have proclaimed it on every side.

original: paśvayantrāso abhi kāram arcan vidanta jyotiś cakṛpanta dhībhiḥ //
analyzed: paśu ayantrāsaḥ abhi kāram arcan vidanta jyotiḥ cakṛpanta dhībhiḥ
translated: The singers, seeking cattle, have praised the deed, they have found the light, have looked with their thoughts.

original: te gavyatā manasā dṛdhram ubdhaṃ gā yemānam pari ṣantam adrim /
analyzed: te gavyatā manasā dṛdhram ubdham gāḥ yemānam pari santam adrim
translated: They, with a mind full of cattle, have loosened the firm-set, the stone that is to be worshipped, the cow-pen.

original: dṛḷhaṃ naro vacasā daivyena vrajaṃ gomantam uśijo vi vavruḥ //
analyzed: dṛḍham naraḥ vacasā daivyena vrajam gomantam uśijaḥ vi vavruḥ
translated: The wise men have opened the cow-pen with the divine word, the firm one.

original: te manvata prathamaṃ nāma dhenos triḥ sapta mātuḥ paramāṇi vindan /
analyzed: te manvata prathamam nāma dhenoḥ tris sapta mātuḥ paramāṇi vindan
translated: They first thought of the name of the Cow, they found the three and seven most excellent things of the Mother.

original: taj jānatīr abhy anūṣata vrā āvir bhuvad aruṇīr yaśasā goḥ //
analyzed: tat jānatīḥ abhī anūṣata vrāḥ āvis bhuvat aruṇīḥ yaśasā goḥ
translated: The herds have sung this after knowing it; the ruddy Cow has appeared with glory.

original: neśat tamo dudhitaṃ rocata dyaur ud devyā uṣaso bhānur arta /🔽ā sūryo bṛhatas tiṣṭhad ajrāṃ ṛju marteṣu vṛjinā ca paśyan //
analyzed: neśat tamaḥ dudhitam rocata dyauḥ ud devyāḥ uṣasaḥ bhānuḥ arta  ā sūryaḥ bṛhataḥ tiṣṭhat ajrān ṛju marteṣu vṛjinā ca paśyan
translated: The heaven has shone, the darkness has been dispelled; the light of the divine Dawn has been spread forth.🔽The Sun has risen from the lofty one, looking on the crooked and the straight among mortals.

original: ād it paścā bubudhānā vy akhyann ād id ratnaṃ dhārayanta dyubhaktam /
analyzed: āt id paścā bubudhānāḥ vi akhyan āt id ratnam dhārayanta dyu bhaktam
translated: They have awakened and spread out from the west; they have brought the treasure, the light-enjoyer.

original: viśve viśvāsu duryāsu devā mitra dhiye varuṇa satyam astu //🔽acchā voceya śuśucānam agniṃ hotāraṃ viśvabharasaṃ yajiṣṭham /
analyzed: viśve viśvāsu duryāsu devāḥ mitra dhiye varuṇa satyam astu  acchā voceya śuśucānam agnim hotāram viśva bharasam yajiṣṭham
translated: May the All-gods, in all the houses, O Mitra, O Varuṇa, be true to the thought.🔽I will call to you the shining Agni, the Hotar, the best worshipper of all,

original: śucy ūdho atṛṇan na gavām andho na pūtam pariṣiktam aṃśoḥ //
analyzed: śuci ūdhaḥ atṛṇat na gavām andhaḥ na pūtam pariṣiktam aṃśoḥ
translated: The pure-uddered one, who has not pierced the cow's womb, like the purified portion of the oblation.

original: viśveṣām aditir yajñiyānāṃ viśveṣām atithir mānuṣāṇām /
analyzed: viśveṣām aditiḥ yajñiyānām viśveṣām atithiḥ mānuṣāṇām
translated: He is the Aditi of all the worshipful, the guest of all human beings.

original: agnir devānām ava āvṛṇānaḥ sumṛḷīko bhavatu jātavedāḥ //
analyzed: agniḥ devānām avaḥ āvṛṇānaḥ su mṛḍīkaḥ bhavatu jātavedāḥ
translated: May Agni, the god, the all-encompassing, be well-disposed, the all-knower.

original: yo martyeṣv amṛta ṛtāvā devo deveṣv aratir nidhāyi /
analyzed: yaḥ martyeṣu amṛtaḥ ṛtāvā devaḥ deveṣu aratiḥ nidhāyi
translated: He who among mortals is the immortal, the truthful, the god among the gods, the guest, the established one,

original: hotā yajiṣṭho mahnā śucadhyai havyair agnir manuṣa īrayadhyai //🔽iha tvaṃ sūno sahaso no adya jāto jātāṃ ubhayāṃ antar agne /
analyzed: hotā yajiṣṭhaḥ mahnā śucadhyai havyaiḥ agniḥ manuṣaḥ īrayadhyai  iha tvam sūno sahasaḥ naḥ adya jātaḥ jātām ubhayān antar agne
translated: The Hotar, best at sacrifice, is to be worshipped with great honour; Agni is to be worshipped with oblations by men.🔽Here, O son of strength, be born today, O Agni, between the two born worlds.

original: dūta īyase yuyujāna ṛṣva ṛjumuṣkān vṛṣaṇaḥ śukrāṃś ca //
analyzed: dūtaḥ īyase yuyujānaḥ ṛṣvaḥ ṛju muṣkān vṛṣaṇaḥ śukrān ca
translated: As a swift envoy, yoking, you go to the straight-horned, strong, pure ones.

original: atyā vṛdhasnū rohitā ghṛtasnū ṛtasya manye manasā javiṣṭhā /
analyzed: atyā vṛdhasnū rohitā ghṛtasnū ṛtasya manye manasā javiṣṭhā
translated: The two red ones, swift as thought, smeared with ghee, I think are the swiftest in the mind of truth.

original: antar īyase aruṣā yujāno yuṣmāṃś ca devān viśa ā ca martān //
analyzed: antar īyase aruṣā yujānaḥ yuṣmān ca devān viśaḥ ā ca martān
translated: You go within, yoking the red ones, to you gods and to the people.

original: aryamaṇaṃ varuṇam mitram eṣām indrāviṣṇū maruto aśvinota /🔽svaśvo agne surathaḥ surādhā ed u vaha suhaviṣe janāya //
analyzed: aryamaṇam varuṇam mitram eṣām indrāviṣṇū marutaḥ aśvinā uta  su aśvaḥ agne su rathaḥ su rādhāḥ ā id u vaha su haviṣe janāya
translated: Aryaman, Varuna, Mitra, Indra-Vishnu, the Maruts, and the Ashvins are their (gods).🔽O Agni, with good horses, good chariot, good gifts, do you carry (us) to the people who offer good oblations.

original: gomāṃ agne 'vimāṃ aśvī yajño nṛvatsakhā sadam id apramṛṣyaḥ /
analyzed: gomān agne vimān aśvī yajñaḥ nṛvat sakhā sadam id apramṛṣyaḥ
translated: O Agni, this sacrifice, with cattle, sheep, and horses, a friend to men, is ever irresistible.

original: iḷāvāṃ eṣo asura prajāvān dīrgho rayiḥ pṛthubudhnaḥ sabhāvān //
analyzed: iḷāvān eṣaḥ asura prajāvān dīrghaḥ rayiḥ pṛthu budhnaḥ sabhāvān
translated: This, O Asura, is full of food, full of offspring, a long-lasting wealth, with a broad base, naturally so.

original: yas ta idhmaṃ jabharat siṣvidāno mūrdhānaṃ vā tatapate tvāyā /
analyzed: yaḥ te idhmam jabharat siṣvidānaḥ mūrdhānam vā tatapate tvāyā
translated: He who, rejoicing, has brought you fuel, or has heated your head for you,

original: bhuvas tasya svatavāṃḥ pāyur agne viśvasmāt sīm aghāyata uruṣya //
analyzed: bhuvaḥ tasya svatavān pāyuḥ agne viśvasmāt sīm aghāyataḥ uruṣya
translated: His protector, O Agni, is you, self-ruling, protect him from every sin.

original: yas te bharād anniyate cid annaṃ niśiṣan mandram atithim udīrat /
analyzed: yaḥ te bharāt anniyate cit annam niśiṣat mandram atithim udīrat
translated: He who, even when not pressed, brings thee food, the slow-moving guest at night,

original: ā devayur inadhate duroṇe tasmin rayir dhruvo astu dāsvān //
analyzed: ā devayuḥ inadhate duroṇe tasmin rayiḥ dhruvaḥ astu dāsvān
translated: The worshipper brings him into the house of the god; in him be firm and bountiful wealth.

original: yas tvā doṣā ya uṣasi praśaṃsāt priyaṃ vā tvā kṛṇavate haviṣmān /
analyzed: yaḥ tvā doṣā yaḥ uṣasi praśaṃsāt priyam vā tvā kṛṇavate haviṣmān
translated: He who praises thee in the evening or at dawn, or who, with oblation, makes thee dear,

original: aśvo na sve dama ā hemyāvān tam aṃhasaḥ pīparo dāśvāṃsam //
analyzed: aśvaḥ na sve dame ā hemyāvān tam aṃhasaḥ pīparaḥ dāśvāṃsam
translated: Like a horse in his own stall, the bountiful one, deliver him from misfortune.

original: yas tubhyam agne amṛtāya dāśad duvas tve kṛṇavate yatasruk /
analyzed: yaḥ tubhyam agne amṛtāya dāśat duvaḥ tve kṛṇavate yata sruc
translated: He who offers to thee, O immortal Agni, service, and who, with uplifted ladle, performs his duty to thee,

original: na sa rāyā śaśamāno vi yoṣan nainam aṃhaḥ pari varad aghāyoḥ //🔽yasya tvam agne adhvaraṃ jujoṣo devo martasya sudhitaṃ rarāṇaḥ /
analyzed: na sa rāyā śaśamānaḥ vi yoṣat na enam aṃhaḥ pari varat aghāyoḥ  yasya tvam agne adhvaram jujoṣaḥ devaḥ martasya sudhitam rarāṇaḥ
translated: He shall not be separated from wealth by striving; may the misfortune of the sinner pass him by.🔽Whose sacrifice, O Agni, thou acceptest, O god, bestowing favour on the mortal,

original: prīted asad dhotrā sā yaviṣṭhāsāma yasya vidhato vṛdhāsaḥ //
analyzed: prītā id asat hotrā sā yaviṣṭhā āsāma yasya vidhataḥ vṛdhāsaḥ
translated: May he be prosperous, O most youthful one, whose praises and whose songs of praise are acceptable to thee.

original: cittim acittiṃ cinavad vi vidvān pṛṣṭheva vītā vṛjinā ca martān /
analyzed: cittim acittim cinavat vi vidvān pṛṣṭhā iva vītā vṛjinā ca martān
translated: The wise one, knowing the mind and the thoughtless one, the mortal ones who are crooked like the back,

original: rāye ca naḥ svapatyāya deva ditiṃ ca rāsvāditim uruṣya //
analyzed: rāye ca naḥ su apatyāya deva ditim ca rāsvā aditim uruṣya
translated: And for our wealth and good rule, O god, grant us room and protection.

original: kaviṃ śaśāsuḥ kavayo 'dabdhā nidhārayanto duryāsv āyoḥ /
analyzed: kavim śaśāsuḥ kavayaḥ dabdhāḥ nidhārayantaḥ duryāsu āyoḥ
translated: The wise, the infallible ones have appointed the sage, placing him in the houses of the people.

original: atas tvaṃ dṛśyāṃ agna etān paḍbhiḥ paśyer adbhutāṃ arya evaiḥ //
analyzed: atas tvam dṛśyām agne etān paḍbhiḥ paśyeḥ adbhutām aryaḥ evaiḥ
translated: Therefore, O Agni, with these five eyes, visible and invisible, behold these wondrous things, O noble one.

original: tvam agne vāghate supraṇītiḥ sutasomāya vidhate yaviṣṭha /
analyzed: tvam agne vāghate su praṇītiḥ suta somāya vidhate yaviṣṭha
translated: O Agni, most youthful, you are well-directed to the sacrificer, to the one who offers Soma, to the one who has prepared the oblation.

original: ratnam bhara śaśamānāya ghṛṣve pṛthu ścandram avase carṣaṇiprāḥ //
analyzed: ratnam bhara śaśamānāya ghṛṣve pṛthu ścandram avase carṣaṇi prāḥ
translated: Bring the treasure, the bright one, to the one who desires it, the wide one, the radiant one, for the help of the people.

original: adhā ha yad vayam agne tvāyā paḍbhir hastebhiś cakṛmā tanūbhiḥ /
analyzed: adhā ha yat vayam agne tvāyā paḍbhiḥ hastebhiḥ cakṛma tanūbhiḥ
translated: Now, when we, O Agni, with you, with our five hands, with our bodies, have made (the sacrifice),

original: rathaṃ na kranto apasā bhurijor ṛtaṃ yemuḥ sudhya āśuṣāṇāḥ //
analyzed: ratham na krantaḥ apasā bhurijoḥ ṛtam yemuḥ sudhyaḥ āśuṣāṇāḥ
translated: Like a chariot, we have set it in motion on the two axles of the two worlds, striving for truth, eager for booty.

original: adhā mātur uṣasaḥ sapta viprā jāyemahi prathamā vedhaso nṝn /
analyzed: adhā mātuḥ uṣasaḥ sapta viprāḥ jāyemahi prathamāḥ vedhasaḥ nṝn
translated: Now, may we seven sages, the sons of the dawn, be born as the first creators of men.

original: divas putrā aṅgiraso bhavemādriṃ rujema dhaninaṃ śucantaḥ //
analyzed: divaḥ putrāḥ aṅgirasaḥ bhavema adrim rujema dhaninam śucantaḥ
translated: May we be the sons of heaven, the Angirases, shining, may we break the rich mountain.

original: adhā yathā naḥ pitaraḥ parāsaḥ pratnāso agna ṛtam āśuṣāṇāḥ /
analyzed: adhā yathā naḥ pitaraḥ parāsaḥ pratnāsaḥ agne ṛtam āśuṣāṇāḥ
translated: Now, just as our ancestors of old, O Agni, striving for truth,

original: śucīd ayan dīdhitim ukthaśāsaḥ kṣāmā bhindanto aruṇīr apa vran //
analyzed: śucī id ayan dīdhitim uktha śāsaḥ kṣāmā bhindantaḥ aruṇīḥ apa vran
translated: Have gone, purifying the light, the rule of the hymns, breaking the earth, they have opened the red (cows).

original: sukarmāṇaḥ suruco devayanto 'yo na devā janimā dhamantaḥ /
analyzed: su karmāṇaḥ su rucaḥ devayantaḥ yaḥ na devāḥ janimā dhamantaḥ
translated: The well-working, very radiant ones, who honor the gods, the gods, blowing on the birth of iron,

original: śucanto agniṃ vavṛdhanta indram ūrvaṃ gavyam pariṣadanto agman //
analyzed: śucantaḥ agnim vavṛdhantaḥ indram ūrvam gavyam pariṣadantaḥ agman
translated: Shining, have increased Agni, have increased Indra, having surrounded the wide pasture with cattle, have come (to it).

original: ā yūtheva kṣumati paśvo akhyad devānāṃ yaj janimānty ugra /🔽martānāṃ cid urvaśīr akṛpran vṛdhe cid arya uparasyāyoḥ //
analyzed: ā yūthā iva kṣumati paśvaḥ akhyat devānām yat janimānti ugra  martānām cit urvaśīḥ akṛpran vṛdhe cit aryaḥ uparasya āyoḥ
translated: He hath shone forth like a herd in the wide-spreading (sky), what time the Gods' most mighty generation.🔽And the Urvasîs of mortals have they made to move, even for the growth of the noble one's offspring.

original: akarma te svapaso abhūma ṛtam avasrann uṣaso vibhātīḥ /
analyzed: akarma te su apasaḥ abhūma ṛtam avasran uṣasaḥ vibhātīḥ
translated: We have become thy servants, O thou that art to be served: the Dawns have passed away, the holy ordinances, the shining ones.

original: anūnam agnim purudhā suścandraṃ devasya marmṛjataś cāru cakṣuḥ //
analyzed: anūnam agnim purudhā su ścandram devasya marmṛjataḥ cāru cakṣuḥ
translated: The perfect, many-formed, most lovely Agni, the God who polishes, whose eye is fair.

original: etā te agna ucathāni vedho 'vocāma kavaye tā juṣasva /🔽uc chocasva kṛṇuhi vasyaso no maho rāyaḥ puruvāra pra yandhi //
analyzed: etā te agne ucathāni vedhaḥ vocāma kavaye tā juṣasva  ud śocasva kṛṇuhi vasyasaḥ naḥ mahaḥ rāyaḥ puru vāra pra yandhi
translated: These hymns of thine, O thou who orderest, O thou who art wise, we have recited: accept them.🔽Shine forth, and make us richer still: send us great wealth, O thou who givest much.

original: ā vo rājānam adhvarasya rudraṃ hotāraṃ satyayajaṃ rodasyoḥ /
analyzed: ā vaḥ rājānam adhvarasya rudram hotāram satya yajam rodasyoḥ
translated: Make ye Rudra, your King of the sacrifice, the Priest of both worlds, the Priest whose worship never fails.

original: agnim purā tanayitnor acittād dhiraṇyarūpam avase kṛṇudhvam //🔽ayaṃ yoniś cakṛmā yaṃ vayaṃ te jāyeva patya uśatī suvāsāḥ /
analyzed: agnim purā tanayitnoḥ acittāt hiraṇya rūpam avase kṛṇudhvam  ayam yoniḥ cakṛma yam vayam te jāyā iva patye uśatī su vāsāḥ
translated: Make ye for shelter Agni, golden-hued, before the bolt of heaven is formed.🔽This Agni have we made our home, even as a loving wife her husband in his house.

original: arvācīnaḥ parivīto ni ṣīdemā u te svapāka pratīcīḥ //
analyzed: arvācīnaḥ parivītaḥ ni sīda imāḥ u te svapāka pratīcīḥ
translated: Sit down, surrounded, turned to us: these, O thou of good oblations, are for thee.

original: āśṛṇvate adṛpitāya manma nṛcakṣase sumṛḷīkāya vedhaḥ /
analyzed: āśṛṇvate a dṛpitāya manma nṛ cakṣase su mṛḷīkāya vedhaḥ
translated: To him who hearkens, who is never to be shaken, to him who looks on men, to him who is most gracious, O thou who orderest.

original: devāya śastim amṛtāya śaṃsa grāveva sotā madhuṣud yam īḷe //
analyzed: devāya śastim amṛtāya śaṃsa grāvā iva sotā madhuṣut yam īḍe
translated: To the God, to the Immortal, sing praise, as the presser to the vat I sing to him who purifies the meath.

original: tvaṃ cin naḥ śamyā agne asyā ṛtasya bodhy ṛtacit svādhīḥ /
analyzed: tvam cit naḥ śamyāḥ agne asyāḥ ṛtasya bodhi ṛta cit svādhīḥ
translated: Thou also, O Agni, art our ally in this holy rite: be thou the guardian of holy order, self-dependent.

original: kadā ta ukthā sadhamādyāni kadā bhavanti sakhyā gṛhe te //
analyzed: kadā te ukthā sadhamādyāni kadā bhavanti sakhyā gṛhe te
translated: When are thy praises, O thou who rejoicest in the feast, when are they in the house of thy friend?

original: kathā ha tad varuṇāya tvam agne kathā dive garhase kan na āgaḥ /
analyzed: kathā ha tat varuṇāya tvam agne kathā dive garhase kad naḥ āgaḥ
translated: How is it that thou, O Agni, art angry with Varuna? How with Dyaus? What is thy displeasure?

original: kathā mitrāya mīḷhuṣe pṛthivyai bravaḥ kad aryamṇe kad bhagāya //
analyzed: kathā mitrāya mīḍhuṣe pṛthivyai bravaḥ kad aryamṇe kad bhagāya
translated: How speakest thou to the bountiful Prithivī, to Mitra, to Aryaman, to Bhaga?

original: kad dhiṣṇyāsu vṛdhasāno agne kad vātāya pratavase śubhaṃye /
analyzed: kad dhiṣṇyāsu vṛdhasānaḥ agne kad vātāya pratavase śubhaṃye
translated: How to the all-sustaining Dhisanas, O Agni? How to the wind, the active, the auspicious?

original: parijmane nāsatyāya kṣe bravaḥ kad agne rudrāya nṛghne //
analyzed: parijmane nāsatyāya kṣe bravaḥ kad agne rudrāya nṛ ghne
translated: How to the far-going Nâsatyas? How to Rudra, O Agni, the slayer of men?

original: kathā mahe puṣṭimbharāya pūṣṇe kad rudrāya sumakhāya havirde /
analyzed: kathā mahe puṣṭimbharāya pūṣṇe kad rudrāya su makhāya haviḥ de
translated: How to the great Pûshan, the bearer of increase? How to Rudra, the giver of oblations, the well-wisher?

original: kad viṣṇava urugāyāya reto bravaḥ kad agne śarave bṛhatyai //
analyzed: kad viṣṇave urugāyāya retaḥ bravaḥ kad agne śarave bṛhatyai
translated: How to Vishnu, the far-goer, the seed? How to Agni, to the great, to Sarasvatî?

original: kathā śardhāya marutām ṛtāya kathā sūre bṛhate pṛcchyamānaḥ /
analyzed: kathā śardhāya marutām ṛtāya kathā sūre bṛhate pṛcchyamānaḥ
translated: How to the Maruts' host, to the righteous? How to the great Sûrya, when questioned?

original: prati bravo 'ditaye turāya sādhā divo jātavedaś cikitvān //
analyzed: prati bravaḥ ditaye turāya sādhā divaḥ jātavedaḥ cikitvān
translated: I answer to Aditi, the strong, the wise, the all-knower of heaven.

original: ṛtena ṛtaṃ niyatam īḷa ā gor āmā sacā madhumat pakvam agne /
analyzed: ṛtena ṛtam niyatam īḍe ā goḥ āmā sacā madhumat pakvam agne
translated: By truth the truth-ordained cow hath been brought to the raw and ripe sweet food, O Agni.

original: kṛṣṇā satī ruśatā dhāsinaiṣā jāmaryeṇa payasā pīpāya //
analyzed: kṛṣṇā satī ruśatā dhāsinā eṣā jāmaryeṇa payasā pīpāya
translated: This black one, though black, hath grown fat with the ruddy one's life-sap, in the immortal one.

original: ṛtena hi ṣmā vṛṣabhaś cid aktaḥ pumāṃ agniḥ payasā pṛṣṭhyena /🔽aspandamāno acarad vayodhā vṛṣā śukraṃ duduhe pṛśnir ūdhaḥ //
analyzed: ṛtena hi sma vṛṣabhaḥ cit aktaḥ pumān agniḥ payasā pṛṣṭhyena  a spandamānaḥ acarat vayodhāḥ vṛṣā śukram duduhe pṛśniḥ ūdhaḥ
translated: For by truth the bull, the male Agni, is anointed with the life-sap that makes the back strong.🔽The bird-like one, not moving, went along; the bull Dudubila milked the bright udder.

original: ṛtenādriṃ vy asan bhidantaḥ sam aṅgiraso navanta gobhiḥ /
analyzed: ṛtena adrim vi asan bhidantaḥ sam aṅgirasaḥ navanta gobhiḥ
translated: By truth the Angirases, splitting the rock, were gladdened with the streams of milk, with the cows.

original: śunaṃ naraḥ pari ṣadann uṣāsam āviḥ svar abhavaj jāte agnau //
analyzed: śunam naraḥ pari ṣadan uṣāsam āvis svar abhavat jāte agnau
translated: The men have sat down well at the dawn; the light became manifest when Agni was born.

original: ṛtena devīr amṛtā amṛktā arṇobhir āpo madhumadbhir agne /
analyzed: ṛtena devīḥ amṛtāḥ amṛktāḥ arṇobhiḥ āpaḥ madhumadbhiḥ agne
translated: By truth the immortal, faultless goddesses, the waters, O Agni, with their sweet streams.

original: vājī na sargeṣu prastubhānaḥ pra sadam it sravitave dadhanyuḥ //🔽mā kasya yakṣaṃ sadam id dhuro gā mā veśasya praminato māpeḥ /
analyzed: vājī na sargeṣu prastubhānaḥ pra sadam id sravitave dadhanyuḥ  mā kasya yakṣam sadam id dhuraḥ gāḥ mā veśasya praminataḥ mā āpeḥ
translated: The strong one, to be praised in the beginnings, should always be enriched for the flowing.🔽Do not, O Agni, ever bear the yoke for the sake of any one's worship, nor for the sake of a house's prosperity.

original: mā bhrātur agne anṛjor ṛṇaṃ ver mā sakhyur dakṣaṃ ripor bhujema //
analyzed: mā bhrātuḥ agne anṛjoḥ ṛṇam veḥ mā sakhyuḥ dakṣam ripoḥ bhujema
translated: Do not let us, O Agni, suffer the debt of an unrighteous brother, nor the treachery of a friend.

original: rakṣā ṇo agne tava rakṣaṇebhī rārakṣāṇaḥ sumakha prīṇānaḥ /
analyzed: rakṣa naḥ agne tava rakṣaṇebhiḥ rārakṣāṇaḥ su makha prīṇānaḥ
translated: Protect us, O Agni, with thy protections, protecting us, O thou of fair rites, being gratified.

original: prati ṣphura vi ruja vīḍv aṃho jahi rakṣo mahi cid vāvṛdhānam //
analyzed: prati sphura vi ruja vīḍu aṃhaḥ jahi rakṣaḥ mahi cit vāvṛdhānam
translated: Burst forth, rend asunder, crush affliction, slay the Raksas, though he be grown exceeding great.

original: ebhir bhava sumanā agne arkair imān spṛśa manmabhiḥ śūra vājān /
analyzed: ebhiḥ bhava sumanāḥ agne arkaiḥ imān spṛśa manmabhiḥ śūra vājān
translated: Be pleased with these hymns, O Agni, be pleased: touch with these thoughts, O hero, these our treasures.

original: uta brahmāṇy aṅgiro juṣasva saṃ te śastir devavātā jareta //
analyzed: uta brahmāṇi aṅgiraḥ juṣasva sam te śastiḥ deva vātā jareta
translated: And accept, O Angiras, the prayers: let the praise, O God-attended one, be glorified.

original: etā viśvā viduṣe tubhyaṃ vedho nīthāny agne niṇyā vacāṃsi /
analyzed: etā viśvā viduṣe tubhyam vedhaḥ nīthāni agne niṇyā vacāṃsi
translated: All these hymns, O wise one, these songs, O thou who knowest, O Agni, these my words,

original: nivacanā kavaye kāvyāny aśaṃsiṣam matibhir vipra ukthaiḥ //
analyzed: nivacanā kavaye kāvyāni aśaṃsiṣam matibhiḥ vipraḥ ukthaiḥ
translated: These my songs have I sung to the sage with my thoughts, with my hymns, O thou who art to be praised.

original: kṛṇuṣva pājaḥ prasitiṃ na pṛthvīṃ yāhi rājevāmavāṃ ibhena /
analyzed: kṛṇuṣva pājaḥ prasitim na pṛthvīm yāhi rājā iva amavān ibhena
translated: Make thee a broad path, a trench, go with thy steed as a king with his charioteer.

original: tṛṣvīm anu prasitiṃ drūṇāno 'stāsi vidhya rakṣasas tapiṣṭhaiḥ //
analyzed: tṛṣvīm anu prasitim drūṇānaḥ stāsi vidhya rakṣasaḥ tapiṣṭhaiḥ
translated: Drawing along the path that leads to the farthest goal, pierce the Raksases with thy most burning flames.

original: tava bhramāsa āśuyā patanty anu spṛśa dhṛṣatā śośucānaḥ /
analyzed: tava bhramāsaḥ āśuyā patanti anu spṛśa dhṛṣatā śośucānaḥ
translated: Thy flames fall with swiftness, touch with thy tongue, shining, O thou who art to be praised.

original: tapūṃṣy agne juhvā pataṅgān asaṃdito vi sṛja viṣvag ulkāḥ //
analyzed: tapūṃṣi agne juhvā pataṅgān a saṃditaḥ vi sṛja viṣvak ulkāḥ
translated: The sparks, O Agni, the flying insects, loose them, O thou who art not to be restrained, in all directions, the firebrands.

original: prati spaśo vi sṛja tūrṇitamo bhavā pāyur viśo asyā adabdhaḥ /
analyzed: prati spaśaḥ vi sṛja tūrṇitamaḥ bhava pāyuḥ viśaḥ asyāḥ adabdhaḥ
translated: Loose the spies, O thou who art most swift to act: be thou the unfailing guardian of this people.

original: yo no dūre aghaśaṃso yo anty agne mākiṣ ṭe vyathir ā dadharṣīt //
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ dūre agha śaṃsaḥ yaḥ anti agne mākir te vyathiḥ ā dadharṣīt
translated: Let not the mischief of him who is afar, O Agni, or who is nigh, prevail against thee.

original: ud agne tiṣṭha praty ā tanuṣva ny amitrāṃ oṣatāt tigmahete /🔽yo no arātiṃ samidhāna cakre nīcā taṃ dhakṣy atasaṃ na śuṣkam //
analyzed: ud agne tiṣṭha prati ā tanuṣva ni amitrān oṣatāt tigma hete  yaḥ naḥ arātim samidhāna cakre nīcā tam dhakṣi atasam na śuṣkam
translated: Rise up, O Agni, extend thyself forth, and cast down our enemies, O thou of sharp flame.🔽Burn him down, O Agni, who hath wrought us evil, as a dry tree is burnt with fire.

original: ūrdhvo bhava prati vidhyādhy asmad āviṣ kṛṇuṣva daivyāny agne /
analyzed: ūrdhvaḥ bhava prati vidhya adhi asmat āviḥ kṛṇuṣva daivyāni agne
translated: Rise up, pierce through our enemies, O Agni, and show forth thy heavenly powers.

original: ava sthirā tanuhi yātujūnāṃ jāmim ajāmim pra mṛṇīhi śatrūn //
analyzed: ava sthirā tanuhi jāmim ajāmim pra mṛṇīhi śatrūn
translated: Destroy the firm foundations of the Yātudhānas, and crush the kinsman and the stranger.

original: sa te jānāti sumatiṃ yaviṣṭha ya īvate brahmaṇe gātum airat /
analyzed: sa te jānāti sumatim yaviṣṭha yaḥ īvate brahmaṇe gātum airat
translated: He, O most youthful God, who hath known thy favour, and hath brought to the worshipper the way,

original: viśvāny asmai sudināni rāyo dyumnāny aryo vi duro abhi dyaut //🔽sed agne astu subhagaḥ sudānur yas tvā nityena haviṣā ya ukthaiḥ /
analyzed: viśvāni asmai su dināni rāyaḥ dyumnāni aryaḥ vi duraḥ abhi dyaut  sa id agne astu subhagaḥ sudānuḥ yaḥ tvā nityena haviṣā yaḥ ukthaiḥ
translated: To him all fair days, all riches, all glories, and all doors of light have been opened.🔽Happy and bountiful, O Agni, let him be who with perpetual oblation and with hymns

original: piprīṣati sva āyuṣi duroṇe viśved asmai sudinā sāsad iṣṭiḥ //
analyzed: piprīṣati sve āyuṣi duroṇe viśvā id asmai su dinā sā asat iṣṭiḥ
translated: Delights thee in his own abode, in his own life: to him all fair days and all his wishes come.

original: arcāmi te sumatiṃ ghoṣy arvāk saṃ te vāvātā jaratām iyaṃ gīḥ /
analyzed: arcāmi te sumatim ghoṣi arvāk sam te vāvātā jaratām iyam gīḥ
translated: I praise thy favour, O Agni, I proclaim it: let this hymn of ours be acceptable to thee.

original: svaśvās tvā surathā marjayemāsme kṣatrāṇi dhārayer anu dyūn //
analyzed: su aśvāḥ tvā su rathāḥ marjayema asme kṣatrāṇi dhārayeḥ anu dyūn
translated: With good horses and good chariots may we serve thee: in our dwellings mayst thou keep the sway for many a day.

original: iha tvā bhūry ā cared upa tman doṣāvastar dīdivāṃsam anu dyūn /
analyzed: iha tvā bhūri ā caret upa tman doṣā vastar dīdivāṃsam anu dyūn
translated: Here may he come to thee in many a place, O thou who layest the dust, shining for many a day.

original: krīḷantas tvā sumanasaḥ sapemābhi dyumnā tasthivāṃso janānām //
analyzed: krīḍantaḥ tvā sumanasaḥ sapema abhi dyumnā tasthivāṃsaḥ janānām
translated: May we, rejoicing, serve thee with a glad heart, with the glories of the people standing by.

original: yas tvā svaśvaḥ suhiraṇyo agna upayāti vasumatā rathena /
analyzed: yaḥ tvā su aśvaḥ su hiraṇyaḥ agne upayāti vasumatā rathena
translated: He, O Agni, who approaches thee with a good horse, with good gold, with a car full of wealth,

original: tasya trātā bhavasi tasya sakhā yas ta ātithyam ānuṣag jujoṣat //🔽maho rujāmi bandhutā vacobhis tan mā pitur gotamād anv iyāya /
analyzed: tasya trātā bhavasi tasya sakhā yaḥ te ātithyam ānuṣak jujoṣat  mahaḥ rujāmi bandhu tā vacobhiḥ tat mā pituḥ gotamāt anu iyāya
translated: Thou art his protector, thou art his friend, who duly offers thee hospitality.🔽I proclaim with words the great kinship; this I have received from my father Gotama.

original: tvaṃ no asya vacasaś cikiddhi hotar yaviṣṭha sukrato damūnāḥ //
analyzed: tvam naḥ asya vacasaḥ cikiddhi hotar yaviṣṭha su krato damūnāḥ
translated: Do thou, O Hotar, O youngest, O most wise, O friend of the house, regard this speech of ours.

original: asvapnajas taraṇayaḥ suśevā atandrāso 'vṛkā aśramiṣṭhāḥ /
analyzed: a svapnajaḥ taraṇayaḥ su śevāḥ atandrāsaḥ vṛkāḥ aśramiṣṭhāḥ
translated: The watchful ones, the good, the very gracious, the sleepless, the harmless, the most diligent,

original: te pāyavaḥ sadhryañco niṣadyāgne tava naḥ pāntv amūra //
analyzed: te pāyavaḥ sadhryañcaḥ niṣadya agne tava naḥ pāntu amūra
translated: These, O Agni, the companions, sitting together, protect us, O thou that art free from error.

original: ye pāyavo māmateyaṃ te agne paśyanto andhaṃ duritād arakṣan /
analyzed: ye pāyavaḥ māmateyam te agne paśyantaḥ andham duritāt arakṣan
translated: Those, O Agni, who, watching, have protected the blind one from evil, the companions of Māmateya,

original: rarakṣa tān sukṛto viśvavedā dipsanta id ripavo nāha debhuḥ //
analyzed: rarakṣa tān su kṛtaḥ viśva vedāḥ dipsantaḥ id ripavaḥ na aha debhuḥ
translated: The doer of good, the all-knowing one, has protected them; the enemies have not obtained them, as the gods (obtain) the immortal.

original: tvayā vayaṃ sadhanyas tvotās tava praṇīty aśyāma vājān /
analyzed: tvayā vayam sadhanyaḥ tvotāḥ tava praṇītī aśyāma vājān
translated: By thee, O rich one, may we be rich; urged on by thee, may we win strength.

original: ubhā śaṃsā sūdaya satyatāte 'nuṣṭhuyā kṛṇuhy ahrayāṇa //
analyzed: ubhā śaṃsā sūdaya satyatāte nuṣṭhuyā kṛṇuhi ahrayāṇa
translated: Make both sides agree, O thou of true counsel; with the hymn make them roar.

original: ayā te agne samidhā vidhema prati stomaṃ śasyamānaṃ gṛbhāya /
analyzed: ayā te agne samidhā vidhema prati stomam śasyamānam gṛbhāya
translated: We will kindle thee, O Agni, with this fuel: accept the praise-song as it is being sung.

original: dahāśaso rakṣasaḥ pāhy asmān druho nido mitramaho avadyāt //
analyzed: daha aśasaḥ rakṣasaḥ pāhi asmān druhaḥ nidaḥ mitra mahas avadyāt
translated: Burn up the Raksases, O thou of burning flame, protect us from the slanderer, O thou who hast friends for thine own.

original: vaiśvānarāya mīḷhuṣe sajoṣāḥ kathā dāśemāgnaye bṛhad bhāḥ /
analyzed: vaiśvānarāya mīḍhuṣe sajoṣāḥ kathā dāśema agnaye bṛhat bhās
translated: In unison, to the rain-bestowing Vaisvānara Agni, what offering shall we present, O Agni, of great light?

original: anūnena bṛhatā vakṣathenopa stabhāyad upamin na rodhaḥ //
analyzed: anūnena bṛhatā vakṣathena upa stabhāyat upamin na rodhaḥ
translated: With a full, great, and firm breast, O thou who art measured, support the obstruction.

original: mā nindata ya imām mahyaṃ rātiṃ devo dadau martyāya svadhāvān /
analyzed: mā nindata yaḥ imām mahyam rātim devaḥ dadau martyāya svadhāvān
translated: Do not blame him who has given me this gift, the self-existent god to the mortal.

original: pākāya gṛtso amṛto vicetā vaiśvānaro nṛtamo yahvo agniḥ //
analyzed: pākāya gṛtsaḥ amṛtaḥ vicetāḥ vaiśvānaraḥ nṛtamaḥ yahvaḥ agniḥ
translated: For cooking, the strong, immortal, wise Vaisvānara Agni, the best of men, the young.

original: sāma dvibarhā mahi tigmabhṛṣṭiḥ sahasraretā vṛṣabhas tuviṣmān /🔽padaṃ na gor apagūḷhaṃ vividvān agnir mahyam pred u vocan manīṣām //
analyzed: sāma dvibarhāḥ mahi tigma bhṛṣṭiḥ sahasra retāḥ vṛṣabhaḥ tuviṣmān  padam na goḥ apagūḍham vividvān agniḥ mahyam pra id u vocat manīṣām
translated: The two-fold hymn, the sharp-edged one, of a thousand seed-parts, the strong bull,🔽The one who knows the hidden foot of the cow, Agni has declared to me his thought.

original: pra tāṃ agnir babhasat tigmajambhas tapiṣṭhena śociṣā yaḥ surādhāḥ /
analyzed: pra tām agniḥ babhasat tigma jambhaḥ tapiṣṭhena śociṣā yaḥ su rādhāḥ
translated: May Agni, with his sharp-jawed, most burning flame, the one who bestows good things, consume that (evil).

original: pra ye minanti varuṇasya dhāma priyā mitrasya cetato dhruvāṇi //
analyzed: pra ye minanti varuṇasya dhāma priyā mitrasya cetataḥ dhruvāṇi
translated: Those who transgress the law of Varuṇa, the dear, firm thoughts of Mitra,

original: abhrātaro na yoṣaṇo vyantaḥ patiripo na janayo durevāḥ /
analyzed: a bhrātaraḥ na yoṣaṇaḥ vyantaḥ pati ripaḥ na janayaḥ durevāḥ
translated: The brothers who are not brothers, the wives who are not wives, the husbands who are not husbands, the homes that are not homes,

original: pāpāsaḥ santo anṛtā asatyā idam padam ajanatā gabhīram //
analyzed: pāpāsaḥ santaḥ anṛtāḥ asatyāḥ idam padam ajanatā gabhīram
translated: The sinful, the false, the untrue have produced this deep place.

original: idam me agne kiyate pāvakāminate gurum bhāraṃ na manma /
analyzed: idam me agne kiyate pāva kāminate gurum bhāram na manma
translated: This, O Agni, is my great burden, which I bring to you, O purifier, as a thought.

original: bṛhad dadhātha dhṛṣatā gabhīraṃ yahvam pṛṣṭham prayasā saptadhātu //
analyzed: bṛhat dadhātha dhṛṣatā gabhīram yahvam pṛṣṭham prayasā sapta dhātu
translated: You have placed the lofty, the deep, the mighty back, with your power, in seven ways.

original: tam in nv eva samanā samānam abhi kratvā punatī dhītir aśyāḥ /
analyzed: tam id nu eva samanā samānam abhi kratvā punatī dhītiḥ aśyāḥ
translated: This, indeed, is the common, the equal, which the purifying thought should reach by wisdom.

original: sasasya carmann adhi cāru pṛśner agre rupa ārupitaṃ jabāru //
analyzed: sasasya carman adhi cāru pṛśneḥ agre rupaḥ ārupitam jabāru
translated: On the skin of the plant, on the beautiful back of the prickly plant, the first form was placed, the swift one.

original: pravācyaṃ vacasaḥ kim me asya guhā hitam upa niṇig vadanti /
analyzed: pravācyam vacasaḥ kim me asya guhā hitam upa niṇih vadanti
translated: What is to be proclaimed of my speech? They speak secretly, as if hidden.

original: yad usriyāṇām apa vār iva vran pāti priyaṃ rupo agram padaṃ veḥ //
analyzed: yat usriyāṇām apa vār iva vran pāti priyam rupaḥ agram padam veḥ
translated: What, like water from cows, has been poured out of the udders, he guards the dear first step of the bird.

original: idam u tyan mahi mahām anīkaṃ yad usriyā sacata pūrvyaṃ gauḥ /
analyzed: idam u tyad mahi mahām anīkam yat usriyā sacata pūrvyam gauḥ
translated: This, indeed, is that great, mighty host, which the ancient cow, the udders, follows.

original: ṛtasya pade adhi dīdyānaṃ guhā raghuṣyad raghuyad viveda //🔽adha dyutānaḥ pitroḥ sacāsāmanuta guhyaṃ cāru pṛśneḥ /
analyzed: ṛtasya pade adhi dīdyānam guhā raghuṣyat raghuyat viveda  adha dyutānaḥ pitroḥ sacā āsām anuta guhyam cāru pṛśneḥ
translated: Shining on the place of truth, he has discovered the swift-moving, swiftly-moving one hidden in the cave.🔽Then, shining, he attends the parents, remembering the beautiful secret of the prickly one.

original: mātuṣ pade parame anti ṣad gor vṛṣṇaḥ śociṣaḥ prayatasya jihvā //
analyzed: mātuṣ pade parame anti sat goḥ vṛṣṇaḥ śociṣaḥ prayatasya jihvā
translated: Sitting in the highest place of the mother, the tongue of the strong, flaming, consecrated bull.

original: ṛtaṃ voce namasā pṛcchyamānas tavāśasā jātavedo yadīdam /
analyzed: ṛtam voce namasā pṛcchyamānaḥ tava āśasā jātavedaḥ yadi idam
translated: I speak the truth, asked with reverence, O Jātavedas, if this is your wish.

original: tvam asya kṣayasi yad dha viśvaṃ divi yad u draviṇaṃ yat pṛthivyām //
analyzed: tvam asya kṣayasi yat ha viśvam divi yat u draviṇam yat pṛthivyām
translated: You are the abode of all this wealth, whatever there is in the sky or on earth.

original: kiṃ no asya draviṇaṃ kad dha ratnaṃ vi no voco jātavedaś cikitvān /
analyzed: kim naḥ asya draviṇam kad ha ratnam vi naḥ vocaḥ jātavedaḥ cikitvān
translated: What wealth of his, what treasure is there? Tell us, O Jātavedas, you who know.

original: guhādhvanaḥ paramaṃ yan no asya reku padaṃ na nidānā aganma //🔽kā maryādā vayunā kad dha vāmam acchā gamema raghavo na vājam /
analyzed: guhā adhvanaḥ paramam yat naḥ asya reku padam na nidānāḥ aganma  kā maryādā vayunā kad ha vāmam acchā gamema raghavaḥ na vājam
translated: We have not found the highest path of this one who goes in secret, nor the place of his feet, nor his abode.🔽What is the boundary, what the good thing? May we go to it as the swift ones to their prize.

original: kadā no devīr amṛtasya patnīḥ sūro varṇena tatanann uṣāsaḥ //
analyzed: kadā naḥ devīḥ amṛtasya patnīḥ sūraḥ varṇena tatanan uṣāsaḥ
translated: When will the goddesses, the wives of immortality, the dawns, spread out their forms like the sun?

original: anireṇa vacasā phalgvena pratītyena kṛdhunātṛpāsaḥ /
analyzed: anireṇa vacasā phalgvena pratītyena kṛdhunā atṛpāsaḥ
translated: With a word that is indistinct, faint, deceptive, and greedy, the unsatisfied ones.

original: adhā te agne kim ihā vadanty anāyudhāsa āsatā sacantām //🔽asya śriye samidhānasya vṛṣṇo vasor anīkaṃ dama ā ruroca /
analyzed: adhā te agne kim iha ā vadanti an āyudhāsaḥ āsata sacantām  asya śriye samidhānasya vṛṣṇaḥ vasoḥ anīkam dame ā ruroca
translated: Now, O Agni, what do they say here? Let them sit down here, let them be united, unarmed.🔽The face of that Vasu, the kindled one, the powerful one, shines in the house for his glory.

original: ruśad vasānaḥ sudṛśīkarūpaḥ kṣitir na rāyā puruvāro adyaut //
analyzed: ruśat vasānaḥ sudṛśīka rūpaḥ kṣitiḥ na rāyā puru vāraḥ adyaut
translated: Wearing a red garment, of beautiful form, the giver of much, the supporter, shines like wealth.

original: ūrdhva ū ṣu ṇo adhvarasya hotar agne tiṣṭha devatātā yajīyān /
analyzed: ūrdhvaḥ u su naḥ adhvarasya hotar agne tiṣṭha devatātā yajīyān
translated: O Hotar, stand up high for us at the sacrifice, O Agni, most worthy of worship among the gods.

original: tvaṃ hi viśvam abhy asi manma pra vedhasaś cit tirasi manīṣām //🔽amūro hotā ny asādi vikṣv agnir mandro vidatheṣu pracetāḥ /
analyzed: tvam hi viśvam abhī asi manma pra vedhasaḥ cit tirasi manīṣām  amūraḥ hotā ni asādi vikṣu agniḥ mandraḥ vidatheṣu pracetāḥ
translated: For thou art all the world, thou surpassest even the thought of the wise.🔽The unerring priest hath sat down in the houses, Agni the gladdener, the wise one in the sacrifices.

original: ūrdhvam bhānuṃ savitevāśren meteva dhūmaṃ stabhāyad upa dyām //
analyzed: ūrdhvam bhānum savitā iva aśret metā iva dhūmam stabhāyat upa dyām
translated: He hath raised his light like Savitar, like a ship, and like a cloud hath he stayed his smoke up to the sky.

original: yatā sujūrṇī rātinī ghṛtācī pradakṣiṇid devatātim urāṇaḥ /
analyzed: yatā su jūrṇī rātinī ghṛtācī pradakṣiṇit devatātim urāṇaḥ
translated: The well-ordered, the offering one, the one who brings the ghee, ascending the path of the gods, going round.

original: ud u svarur navajā nākraḥ paśvo anakti sudhitaḥ sumekaḥ //🔽stīrṇe barhiṣi samidhāne agnā ūrdhvo adhvaryur jujuṣāṇo asthāt /🔽pary agniḥ paśupā na hotā triviṣṭy eti pradiva urāṇaḥ //
analyzed: ud u svaruḥ nava jāḥ na akraḥ paśvaḥ anakti sudhitaḥ sumekaḥ  stīrṇe barhiṣi samidhāne agnau ūrdhvaḥ adhvaryuḥ jujuṣāṇaḥ asthāt  pari agniḥ paśu pāḥ na hotā tri viṣṭī eti pradivaḥ urāṇaḥ
translated: The Svara, like a new-born calf, the well-placed, the well-ordered one, anoints the sky with smoke, like a cloud.🔽On the strewn grass, with the fire kindled, the Adhvaryu, accepting, hath stood up, erect.🔽Agni, the herdsman, the priest, hath gone round, the one in the three worlds, ascending the sky.

original: pari tmanā mitadrur eti hotāgnir mandro madhuvacā ṛtāvā /
analyzed: pari tmanā mitadruḥ eti hotā agniḥ mandraḥ madhu vacāḥ ṛtāvā
translated: The priest, Agni, the sweet-voiced, the truthful one, goes around by his own will, the one with measured speed.

original: dravanty asya vājino na śokā bhayante viśvā bhuvanā yad abhrāṭ //
analyzed: dravanti asya vājinaḥ na śokāḥ bhayante viśvā bhuvanā yat abhrāṭ
translated: His swift ones flow, like his flames, all beings tremble when he shines.

original: bhadrā te agne svanīka saṃdṛg ghorasya sato viṣuṇasya cāruḥ /
analyzed: bhadrā te agne su anīka saṃdṛś ghorasya sataḥ viṣuṇasya cāruḥ
translated: Auspicious is thy appearance, O Agni, O thou of fair face, of the terrible one, of the one with a sharp point, the beautiful one.

original: na yat te śocis tamasā varanta na dhvasmānas tanvī repa ā dhuḥ //
analyzed: na yat te śociḥ tamasā varanta na dhvasmānaḥ tanvī repaḥ ā dhuḥ
translated: Not thy flame, O dark one, do they restrain, not the smoke, the thin one, do they lead away.

original: na yasya sātur janitor avāri na mātarāpitarā nū cid iṣṭau /
analyzed: na yasya sātuḥ janitoḥ avāri na mātarā pitarā nu cit iṣṭau
translated: Whose mother and father, when born, were not his helpers, nor his brothers and sisters in his need.

original: adhā mitro na sudhitaḥ pāvako 'gnir dīdāya mānuṣīṣu vikṣu //
analyzed: adhā mitraḥ na sudhitaḥ pāvakaḥ gniḥ dīdāya mānuṣīṣu vikṣu
translated: Now, like a well-disposed, purifying friend, Agni shines in the human habitations.

original: dvir yam pañca jījanan saṃvasānāḥ svasāro agnim mānuṣīṣu vikṣu /
analyzed: dvis yam pañca jījanan saṃvasānāḥ svasāraḥ agnim mānuṣīṣu vikṣu
translated: Whom the five sisters, united, have generated twice, Agni, in the human habitations.

original: uṣarbudham atharyo na dantaṃ śukraṃ svāsam paraśuṃ na tigmam //🔽tava tye agne harito ghṛtasnā rohitāsa ṛjvañcaḥ svañcaḥ /
analyzed: uṣarbudham atharyaḥ na dantam śukram svāsam paraśum na tigmam  tava tye agne haritaḥ ghṛta snāḥ rohitāsaḥ ṛjvañcaḥ svañcaḥ
translated: The dawn-knowing, old-teethed one, the bright, self-luminous one, the sharp axe.🔽Those tawny, ghee-anointed, red, straight-flying, self-moving

original: aruṣāso vṛṣaṇa ṛjumuṣkā ā devatātim ahvanta dasmāḥ //
analyzed: aruṣāsaḥ vṛṣaṇaḥ ṛju muṣkāḥ ā devatātim ahvanta dasmāḥ
translated: red, strong, straight-tusked, fearful ones have invited Agni to the assembly of the gods.

original: ye ha tye te sahamānā ayāsas tveṣāso agne arcayaś caranti /
analyzed: ye ha tye te sahamānāḥ ayāsaḥ tveṣāsaḥ agne arcayaḥ caranti
translated: Those who are those conquering, untiring, brilliant, moving flames of yours, O Agni,

original: śyenāso na duvasanāso arthaṃ tuviṣvaṇaso mārutaṃ na śardhaḥ //🔽akāri brahma samidhāna tubhyaṃ śaṃsāty ukthaṃ yajate vy ū dhāḥ /
analyzed: śyenāsaḥ na duvasanāsaḥ artham tuviṣvaṇasaḥ mārutam na śardhaḥ  akāri brahma samidhāna tubhyam śaṃsāti uktham yajate vi ū dhāḥ
translated: like hawks, eager to serve, of great strength, like the Marut host.🔽The prayer has been made for you, O kindled one; the praise-song is proclaimed; the sacrificer spreads out the oblations.

original: hotāram agnim manuṣo ni ṣedur namasyanta uśijaḥ śaṃsam āyoḥ //
analyzed: hotāram agnim manuṣaḥ ni ṣeduḥ namasyantaḥ uśijaḥ śaṃsam āyoḥ
translated: The wise ones, worshipping, have seated Agni as the Hotar, to be revered by men, at the sacrifice of the living one.

original: ayam iha prathamo dhāyi dhātṛbhir hotā yajiṣṭho adhvareṣv īḍyaḥ /
analyzed: ayam iha prathamaḥ dhāyi dhātṛbhiḥ hotā yajiṣṭhaḥ adhvareṣu īḍyaḥ
translated: This one was first established here by the creators, the Hotar, most worthy of sacrifice, to be worshipped at the sacrifices.

original: yam apnavāno bhṛgavo virurucur vaneṣu citraṃ vibhvaṃ viśeviśe //
analyzed: yam apnavānaḥ bhṛgavaḥ virurucuḥ vaneṣu citram vibhvam viśeviśe
translated: Whom Apnavana and the Bhrigus have made to shine forth, wondrous, all-pervading, in every house.

original: agne kadā ta ānuṣag bhuvad devasya cetanam /
analyzed: agne kadā te ānuṣak bhuvat devasya cetanam
translated: O Agni, when will the divine thought of you, who are to be worshipped,

original: adhā hi tvā jagṛbhrire martāso vikṣv īḍyam //
analyzed: adhā hi tvā jagṛbhrire martāsaḥ vikṣu īḍyam
translated: come to us? For now indeed they have grasped you, mortals, to be worshipped in all places.

original: ṛtāvānaṃ vicetasam paśyanto dyām iva stṛbhiḥ /🔽viśveṣām adhvarāṇāṃ haskartāraṃ damedame //🔽āśuṃ dūtaṃ vivasvato viśvā yaś carṣaṇīr abhi /
analyzed: ṛtāvānam vicetasam paśyantaḥ dyām iva stṛbhiḥ  viśveṣām adhvarāṇām haskartāram damedame  āśum dūtam vivasvataḥ viśvāḥ yaḥ carṣaṇīḥ abhi
translated: Beholding you, O truthful one, of far-reaching thought, like the sky with the stars,🔽the impeller of all sacrifices, in every house.🔽The swift messenger of Vivasvat, who is over all men,

original: ā jabhruḥ ketum āyavo bhṛgavāṇaṃ viśeviśe //
analyzed: ā jabhruḥ ketum āyavaḥ bhṛgavāṇam viśeviśe
translated: they have made the banner of the living, the son of Bhrigu, in every house.

original: tam īṃ hotāram ānuṣak cikitvāṃsaṃ ni ṣedire /
analyzed: tam īm hotāram ānuṣak cikitvāṃsam ni sedire
translated: They have seated him, the priest, who is to be worshipped, the all-knowing one,

original: raṇvam pāvakaśociṣaṃ yajiṣṭhaṃ sapta dhāmabhiḥ //
analyzed: raṇvam pāvaka śociṣam yajiṣṭham sapta dhāmabhiḥ
translated: the cheerful one, whose radiance is purifying, the most worthy of worship, with the seven flames.

original: taṃ śaśvatīṣu mātṛṣu vana ā vītam aśritam /
analyzed: tam śaśvatīṣu mātṛṣu vane ā vītam aśritam
translated: Him who is placed in the woods, in the eternal mothers,

original: citraṃ santaṃ guhā hitaṃ suvedaṃ kūcidarthinam //
analyzed: citram santam guhā hitam su vedam kūcid arthinam
translated: the wondrous one, hidden in the cave, easy to find, who moves when sought.

original: sasasya yad viyutā sasminn ūdhann ṛtasya dhāman raṇayanta devāḥ /
analyzed: sasasya yat viyutā sasmin ūdhan ṛtasya dhāman raṇayanta devāḥ
translated: When the two, united, rejoice in him, in the udder of the sacrifice, in the abode of truth, the gods.

original: mahāṃ agnir namasā rātahavyo ver adhvarāya sadam id ṛtāvā //
analyzed: mahān agniḥ namasā rāta havyaḥ veḥ adhvarāya sadam id ṛtāvā
translated: The great Agni, worshipped with homage, who brings oblations, is ever true to the sacrifice.

original: ver adhvarasya dūtyāni vidvān ubhe antā rodasī saṃcikitvān /
analyzed: veḥ adhvarasya dūtyāni vidvān ubhe antar rodasī saṃcikitvān
translated: Knowing the duties of the sacrifice, looking on both ends of the two worlds,

original: dūta īyase pradiva urāṇo viduṣṭaro diva ārodhanāni //
analyzed: dūtaḥ īyase pradivaḥ urāṇaḥ viduṣṭaraḥ divaḥ ārodhanāni
translated: Thou goest as a messenger, flying through the air, with thy path well-known, through the openings of the sky.

original: kṛṣṇaṃ ta ema ruśataḥ puro bhāś cariṣṇv arcir vapuṣām id ekam /
analyzed: kṛṣṇam te ema ruśataḥ puras bhās cariṣṇu arciḥ vapuṣām id ekam
translated: That one dark, tawny, and red, with a moving flame, is the light of the radiant ones.

original: yad apravītā dadhate ha garbhaṃ sadyaś cij jāto bhavasīd u dūtaḥ //
analyzed: yat a pravītāḥ dadhate ha garbham sadyas cit jātaḥ bhavasi id u dūtaḥ
translated: When the unwedded women conceive a child, thou art immediately born and become a messenger.

original: sadyo jātasya dadṛśānam ojo yad asya vāto anuvāti śociḥ /🔽vṛṇakti tigmām ataseṣu jihvāṃ sthirā cid annā dayate vi jambhaiḥ //🔽tṛṣu yad annā tṛṣuṇā vavakṣa tṛṣuṃ dūtaṃ kṛṇute yahvo agniḥ /
analyzed: sadyas jātasya dadṛśānam ojaḥ yat asya vātaḥ anuvāti śociḥ  vṛṇakti tigmām ataseṣu jihvām sthirā cit annā dayate vi jambhaiḥ  tṛṣu yat annā tṛṣuṇā vavakṣa tṛṣum dūtam kṛṇute yahvaḥ agniḥ
translated: The might of him who is born immediately is seen, when the wind blows on his flame.🔽He sharpens his tongue on the flints, and with his teeth he breaks even solid food.🔽When he is hungry, he grows by hunger; the young Agni makes hunger his messenger.

original: vātasya meḷiṃ sacate nijūrvann āśuṃ na vājayate hinve arvā //
analyzed: vātasya mā iḷim sacate nijūrvan āśum na vājayate hinve arvā
translated: He follows the wind's course, shaking; he urges the swift one on, I urge the near one.

original: dūtaṃ vo viśvavedasaṃ havyavāham amartyam /
analyzed: dūtam vaḥ viśva vedasam havya vāham amartyam
translated: To you the messenger, the knower of all, the bearer of oblations, the immortal,

original: yajiṣṭham ṛñjase girā //
analyzed: yajiṣṭham ṛñjase girā
translated: The best sacrificer, I go with a song.

original: sa hi vedā vasudhitim mahāṃ ārodhanaṃ divaḥ /
analyzed: sa hi vedā vasu dhitim mahān ārodhanam divaḥ
translated: For he knows the great treasure of wealth, the covering of the sky,

original: sa devāṃ eha vakṣati //
analyzed: sa devān ā iha vakṣati
translated: He will bring the gods hither.

original: sa veda deva ānamaṃ devāṃ ṛtāyate dame /
analyzed: sa veda devaḥ ānamam devān ṛtāyate dame
translated: He, the god, knows the bending of the gods, who are bent on truth in the house.

original: dāti priyāṇi cid vasu //
analyzed: dāti priyāṇi cit vasu
translated: He gives even dear treasures.

original: sa hotā sed u dūtyaṃ cikitvāṃ antar īyate /
analyzed: sa hotā sa id u dūtyam cikitvān antar īyate
translated: That priest, the wise one, goes within as a messenger.

original: vidvāṃ ārodhanaṃ divaḥ //
analyzed: vidvān ārodhanam divaḥ
translated: The wise one, the covering of the sky.

original: te syāma ye agnaye dadāśur havyadātibhiḥ /
analyzed: te syāma ye agnaye dadāśuḥ havya dātibhiḥ
translated: May we be they who have offered to Agni with oblations,

original: ya īm puṣyanta indhate //
analyzed: yaḥ īm puṣyantaḥ indhate
translated: Who cherish and kindle him.

original: te rāyā te suvīryaiḥ sasavāṃso vi śṛṇvire /
analyzed: te rāyā te su vīryaiḥ sasavāṃsaḥ vi śṛṇvire
translated: They, with wealth and good heroism, are widely renowned, those who are united,

original: ye agnā dadhire duvaḥ //🔽asme rāyo divedive saṃ carantu puruspṛhaḥ /
analyzed: ye agnā dadhire duvaḥ  asme rāyaḥ dive dive sam carantu puruspṛhaḥ
translated: Who have established Agni as their guest.🔽May riches come to us day by day, much desired,

original: asme vājāsa īratām //
analyzed: asme vājāsaḥ īratām
translated: May the powers of strength be exerted for us.

original: sa vipraś carṣaṇīnāṃ śavasā mānuṣāṇām /
analyzed: sa vipraḥ carṣaṇīnām śavasā mānuṣāṇām
translated: He is the sage of the people, by the strength of men,

original: ati kṣipreva vidhyati //
analyzed: ati kṣipra iva vidhyati
translated: He pierces quickly as with an arrow.

original: agne mṛḷa mahāṃ asi ya īm ā devayuṃ janam /
analyzed: agne mṛḍa mahān asi yaḥ īm ā devayum janam
translated: O Agni, be gracious, for thou art great, who goest to the people who honour the gods,

original: iyetha barhir āsadam //
analyzed: iyetha barhiḥ āsadam
translated: To sit on the strew.

original: sa mānuṣīṣu dūḷabho vikṣu prāvīr amartyaḥ /🔽dūto viśveṣām bhuvat //
analyzed: sa mānuṣīṣu dūḍabhaḥ vikṣu prāvīḥ amartyaḥ  dūtaḥ viśveṣām bhuvat
translated: He, the immortal one, is invoked among the human dwellings,🔽The messenger of all that exists.

original: sa sadma pari ṇīyate hotā mandro diviṣṭiṣu /
analyzed: sa sadma pari ṇīyate hotā mandraḥ diviṣṭiṣu
translated: He is led around the house, the delightful priest at the sacrifices in heaven,

original: uta potā ni ṣīdati //
analyzed: uta potā ni sīdati
translated: And also sits as the offerer.

original: uta gnā agnir adhvara uto gṛhapatir dame /
analyzed: uta gnāḥ agniḥ adhvare uta u gṛhapatiḥ dame
translated: Agni is the guest in the houses of the women, the lord of the house in the house,

original: uta brahmā ni ṣīdati //
analyzed: uta brahmā ni sīdati
translated: And also sits as the Brahman priest.

original: veṣi hy adhvarīyatām upavaktā janānām /
analyzed: veṣi hi adhvarīyatām upavaktā janānām
translated: For thou art worthy to be the Adhvaryu priest, the Udgātṛ priest of the people,

original: havyā ca mānuṣāṇām //
analyzed: havyā ca mānuṣāṇām
translated: And the oblations of men.

original: veṣīd v asya dūtyaṃ yasya jujoṣo adhvaram /
analyzed: veṣi id u asya dūtyam yasya jujoṣaḥ adhvaram
translated: Thou art worthy to be his messenger, whose sacrifice thou dost approve,

original: havyam martasya voḷhave //
analyzed: havyam martasya voḷhave
translated: To carry our oblations to the gods.

original: asmākaṃ joṣy adhvaram asmākaṃ yajñam aṅgiraḥ /
analyzed: asmākam joṣi adhvaram asmākam yajñam aṅgiraḥ
translated: O Angiras, accept our sacrifice, our worship, O thou of mighty power.

original: asmākaṃ śṛṇudhī havam //
analyzed: asmākam śṛṇudhi havam
translated: Listen to our call.

original: pari te dūḷabho ratho 'smāṃ aśnotu viśvataḥ /
analyzed: pari te dūḍabhaḥ rathaḥ smām aśnotu viśvatas
translated: May thy car, O Agni, the Dûrvha-bearer, come to us from every side,

original: yena rakṣasi dāśuṣaḥ //
analyzed: yena rakṣasi dāśuṣaḥ
translated: Wherewith thou protectest the worshipper.

original: agne tam adyāśvaṃ na stomaiḥ kratuṃ na bhadraṃ hṛdispṛśam /
analyzed: agne tam adya aśvam na stomaiḥ kratum na bhadram hṛdispṛśam
translated: O Agni, with our hymns this day, as with a horse, I glorify that rite, that bliss which touches the heart,

original: ṛdhyāmā ta ohaiḥ //
analyzed: ṛdhyāma te ohaiḥ
translated: May we prosper through thy favours.

original: adhā hy agne krator bhadrasya dakṣasya sādhoḥ /
analyzed: adhā hi agne kratoḥ bhadrasya dakṣasya sādhoḥ
translated: For thou, O Agni, art the impeller of the good, the righteous, the powerful, the true,

original: rathīr ṛtasya bṛhato babhūtha //🔽ebhir no arkair bhavā no arvāṅ svar ṇa jyotiḥ /🔽agne viśvebhiḥ sumanā anīkaiḥ //
analyzed: rathīḥ ṛtasya bṛhataḥ babhūtha  ebhiḥ naḥ arkaiḥ bhava naḥ arvāṅ svar na jyotiḥ  agne viśvebhiḥ sumanāḥ anīkaiḥ
translated: The charioteer of great holy order.🔽With these our hymns be thou propitious to us, O Agni, the light of heaven.🔽With all thy faces, O thou of every form.

original: ābhiṣ ṭe adya gīrbhir gṛṇanto 'gne dāśema /
analyzed: ābhiḥ te adya gīrbhiḥ gṛṇantaḥ gne dāśema
translated: With these our songs, O Agni, we will serve thee this day,

original: pra te divo na stanayanti śuṣmāḥ //🔽tava svādiṣṭhāgne saṃdṛṣṭir idā cid ahna idā cid aktoḥ /
analyzed: pra te divaḥ na stanayanti śuṣmāḥ  tava svādiṣṭhā agne saṃdṛṣṭiḥ idā cit ahnaḥ idā cit aktoḥ
translated: Thy powers roar like the clouds of heaven.🔽O Agni, most delightful to look on, even now by day, even now by night,

original: śriye rukmo na rocata upāke //
analyzed: śriye rukmaḥ na rocate upāke
translated: Thy light shines like a golden ornament.

original: ghṛtaṃ na pūtaṃ tanūr arepāḥ śuci hiraṇyam /
analyzed: ghṛtam na pūtam tanūḥ arepāḥ śuci hiraṇyam
translated: Like pure ghee, thy body is unstained, pure is the gold,

original: tat te rukmo na rocata svadhāvaḥ //
analyzed: tat te rukmaḥ na rocata svadhāvas
translated: That light shines for thee, O thou of natural radiance.

original: kṛtaṃ cid dhi ṣmā sanemi dveṣo 'gna inoṣi martāt /
analyzed: kṛtam cit hi sma sanemi dveṣaḥ gne inoṣi martāt
translated: Even now we will overcome the hatred that hath been wrought, O Agni, thou sendest the mortal away,

original: itthā yajamānād ṛtāvaḥ //
analyzed: itthā yajamānāt ṛtāvaḥ
translated: Thus, the truthful ones from the sacrificer.

original: śivā naḥ sakhyā santu bhrātrāgne deveṣu yuṣme /
analyzed: śivā naḥ sakhyā santu bhrātrā agne deveṣu yuṣme
translated: Be auspicious to us as friends, O Agni, among the gods, you who are our brother.

original: sā no nābhiḥ sadane sasminn ūdhan //
analyzed: sā naḥ nābhiḥ sadane sasmin ūdhan
translated: Be that navel, that udder, in this our home.

original: bhadraṃ te agne sahasinn anīkam upāka ā rocate sūryasya /
analyzed: bhadram te agne sahasin anīkam upāke ā rocate sūryasya
translated: Auspicious is thy face, O Agni, the powerful, as it shines forth in the morning, like the sun.

original: ruśad dṛśe dadṛśe naktayā cid arūkṣitaṃ dṛśa ā rūpe annam //
analyzed: ruśat dṛśe dadṛśe naktayā cit arūkṣitam dṛśe ā rūpe annam
translated: It is seen even by night, to be seen by all, the food that is not dried up, in its own form.

original: vi ṣāhy agne gṛṇate manīṣāṃ khaṃ vepasā tuvijāta stavānaḥ /
analyzed: vi sāhi agne gṛṇate manīṣām kham vepasā tuvi jāta stavānaḥ
translated: Go forth, O Agni, to the singer's thought, to be praised, O mighty one, with trembling,

original: viśvebhir yad vāvanaḥ śukra devais tan no rāsva sumaho bhūri manma //
analyzed: viśvebhiḥ yat vāvanaḥ śukra devaiḥ tat naḥ rāsva su mahas bhūri manma
translated: When thou art worshipped by all the bright gods, O god, grant us that, O great one, much thought.🔽From thee, O Agni, the wise ones, from thee the thoughts,

original: tvad agne kāvyā tvan manīṣās tvad ukthā jāyante rādhyāni /
analyzed: tvat agne kāvyā tvat manīṣāḥ tvat ukthā jāyante rādhyāni
translated: From thee the hymns are born, the desirable ones.

original: tvad eti draviṇaṃ vīrapeśā itthādhiye dāśuṣe martyāya //
analyzed: tvat eti draviṇam vīra peśāḥ itthā dhiye dāśuṣe martyāya
translated: From thee the wealth goes to the mortal worshipper, to the one who offers, to the one who praises, O Agni, the one who desires heroes.

original: tvad vājī vājambharo vihāyā abhiṣṭikṛj jāyate satyaśuṣmaḥ /🔽tvad rayir devajūto mayobhus tvad āśur jūjuvāṃ agne arvā //
analyzed: tvat vājī vājambharaḥ vihāyāḥ abhiṣṭi kṛt jāyate satya śuṣmaḥ  tvat rayiḥ deva jūtaḥ mayobhuḥ tvat āśuḥ jūjuvān agne arvā
translated: From thee the strong one, the bearer of strength, goes forth, the one who brings help, born with true strength.🔽From thee the wealth, inspired by the gods, the blissful one, from thee the swift one, the one who speaks well, O Agni, the one who comes.

original: tvām agne prathamaṃ devayanto devam martā amṛta mandrajihvam /
analyzed: tvām agne prathamam devayantaḥ devam martāḥ amṛta mandra jihvam
translated: You, O Agni, the mortal ones who long for the gods, the immortal one, the one with a pleasant tongue, the god,

original: dveṣoyutam ā vivāsanti dhībhir damūnasaṃ gṛhapatim amūram //
analyzed: dveṣaḥ yutam ā vivāsanti dhībhiḥ damūnasam gṛha patim amūram
translated: They with their thoughts invite the guileless one, the lord of the house, the friend, united with hate.

original: āre asmad amatim āre aṃha āre viśvāṃ durmatiṃ yan nipāsi /
analyzed: āre asmat amatim āre aṃhaḥ āre viśvām durmatim yat nipāsi
translated: Drive thou away from us want, drive away wrath, drive away all evil thought that we have cherished.

original: doṣā śivaḥ sahasaḥ sūno agne yaṃ deva ā cit sacase svasti //
analyzed: doṣā śivaḥ sahasaḥ sūno agne yam devaḥ ā cit sacase svasti
translated: Be thou propitious, O son of strength, O Agni, whom thou, O God, dost follow for our welfare.

original: yas tvām agna inadhate yatasruk tris te annaṃ kṛṇavat sasminn ahan /
analyzed: yaḥ tvām agne inadhate yata sruc tris te annam kṛṇavat sasmin ahan
translated: He who, O Agni, kindles thee, with uplifted ladle, may he thrice a day prepare thy food.

original: sa su dyumnair abhy astu prasakṣat tava kratvā jātavedaś cikitvān //
analyzed: sa su dyumnaiḥ abhī astu prasakṣat tava kratvā jātavedaḥ cikitvān
translated: May he be prosperous with his glories, may he, O all-knowing Jâtavedas, through thy wisdom, be victorious.

original: idhmaṃ yas te jabharac chaśramāṇo maho agne anīkam ā saparyan /
analyzed: idhmam yaḥ te jabharat śaśramāṇaḥ mahaḥ agne anīkam ā saparyan
translated: He who, bearing fuel, hath served thee, O Agni, hath worshipped thy great form.

original: sa idhānaḥ prati doṣām uṣāsam puṣyan rayiṃ sacate ghnann amitrān //
analyzed: saḥ idhānaḥ prati doṣām uṣāsam puṣyan rayim sacate ghnan amitrān
translated: Kindled, he winneth the morning and the evening, and, increasing his wealth, he slayeth his foes.

original: agnir īśe bṛhataḥ kṣatriyasyāgnir vājasya paramasya rāyaḥ /
analyzed: agniḥ īśe bṛhataḥ kṣatriyasya agniḥ vājasya paramasya rāyaḥ
translated: Agni is the lord of the great dominion, Agni of the highest treasure and of strength.

original: dadhāti ratnaṃ vidhate yaviṣṭho vy ānuṣaṅ martyāya svadhāvān //
analyzed: dadhāti ratnam vidhate yaviṣṭhaḥ vi ānuṣak martyāya svadhāvān
translated: He bestoweth wealth on the worshipper, O youngest, the self-dependent one, on the mortal who followeth the law.

original: yac cid dhi te puruṣatrā yaviṣṭhācittibhiś cakṛmā kac cid āgaḥ /
analyzed: yat cit hi te puruṣatrā yaviṣṭha acittibhiḥ cakṛma kad cit āgaḥ
translated: If, O thou most youthful, we have in any way offended against thee, O thou who lovest the people, in our thoughts, in our deeds,

original: kṛdhī ṣv asmāṃ aditer anāgān vy enāṃsi śiśratho viṣvag agne //
analyzed: kṛdhi su asmān aditeḥ anāgān vi enāṃsi śiśrathaḥ viṣvak agne
translated: Make us, O Aditi, free from sin, and drive away on every side our sins, O Agni.

original: mahaś cid agna enaso abhīka ūrvād devānām uta martyānām /
analyzed: mahaḥ cit agne enasaḥ abhīke ūrvāt devānām uta martyānām
translated: Even from great sin, O Agni, do thou, O thou who art to be feared, deliver us,

original: mā te sakhāyaḥ sadam id riṣāma yacchā tokāya tanayāya śaṃ yoḥ //
analyzed: mā te sakhāyaḥ sadam id riṣāma yaccha tokāya tanayāya śam yoḥ
translated: From the sin of the gods and of men. Let not thy friends ever be injured. Grant welfare to our offspring and to our children.

original: yathā ha tyad vasavo gauryaṃ cit padi ṣitām amuñcatā yajatrāḥ /
analyzed: yathā ha tyad vasavaḥ gauryam cit padi sitām amuñcata yajatrāḥ
translated: Even as ye, O Vasus, the holy ones, have set free the cow that was bound in the fetters,

original: evo ṣv asman muñcatā vy aṃhaḥ pra tāry agne prataraṃ na āyuḥ //
analyzed: eva u su asmat muñcata vi aṃhaḥ pra tāri agne prataram naḥ āyuḥ
translated: Even so do ye deliver us from this woe. Do thou, O Agni, give us a path to long life.

original: praty agnir uṣasām agram akhyad vibhātīnāṃ sumanā ratnadheyam /
analyzed: prati agniḥ uṣasām agram akhyat vibhātīnām sumanāḥ ratna dheyam
translated: Agni hath shown the front of the shining Dawns, the well-disposed giver of treasure.

original: yātam aśvinā sukṛto duroṇam ut sūryo jyotiṣā deva eti //
analyzed: yātam aśvinā su kṛtaḥ duroṇam ud sūryaḥ jyotiṣā devaḥ eti
translated: Come, O ye Asvins, to the house of the righteous. The god Sûrya goeth up with his light.

original: ūrdhvam bhānuṃ savitā devo aśred drapsaṃ davidhvad gaviṣo na satvā /
analyzed: ūrdhvam bhānum savitā devaḥ aśret drapsam davidhvat gaviṣaḥ na satvā
translated: Savitar, the god, hath raised his light on high, the drop, the strong one, like a bull that bellows.

original: anu vrataṃ varuṇo yanti mitro yat sūryaṃ divy ārohayanti //
analyzed: anu vratam varuṇaḥ yanti mitraḥ yat sūryam divi ārohayanti
translated: The Vow of Mitra and Varuṇa they follow, when they cause Sûrya to ascend the heaven.

original: yaṃ sīm akṛṇvan tamase vipṛce dhruvakṣemā anavasyanto artham /
analyzed: yam sīm akṛṇvan tamase vipṛce dhruva kṣemāḥ an avasyantaḥ artham
translated: Him whom they have made to shine through the darkness, the firm-seated, the unfailing, the prosperous,

original: taṃ sūryaṃ haritaḥ sapta yahvī spaśaṃ viśvasya jagato vahanti //
analyzed: tam sūryam haritaḥ sapta yahvī spaśam viśvasya jagataḥ vahanti
translated: That Sûrya, the seven strong tawny ones bear along the path of all the world.

original: vahiṣṭhebhir viharan yāsi tantum avavyayann asitaṃ deva vasma /
analyzed: vahiṣṭhebhiḥ viharan yāsi tantum avavyayan asitam deva vasma
translated: With the most excellent, spreading out thy thread, thou goest, O god, removing the dark garment.

original: davidhvato raśmayaḥ sūryasya carmevāvādhus tamo apsv antaḥ //
analyzed: davidhvataḥ raśmayaḥ sūryasya carma iva avādhuḥ tamaḥ apsu antar
translated: The rays of the sun, in two directions, have driven away the darkness, as if with a shield, from the waters below.

original: anāyato anibaddhaḥ kathāyaṃ nyaṅṅ uttāno 'va padyate na /
analyzed: an āyataḥ a nibaddhaḥ kathā ayam nyaṅ uttānaḥ padyate na
translated: This one, not stretched, not bound, how does he go, lying on his back, not falling down?

original: kayā yāti svadhayā ko dadarśa diva skambhaḥ samṛtaḥ pāti nākam //
analyzed: kayā yāti svadhayā kaḥ dadarśa divaḥ skambhaḥ samṛtaḥ pāti nākam
translated: By what path does he go by his own nature? Who has seen the pillar of heaven, established in the sky?

original: praty agnir uṣaso jātavedā akhyad devo rocamānā mahobhiḥ /
analyzed: prati agniḥ uṣasaḥ jātavedāḥ akhyat devaḥ rocamānāḥ mahobhiḥ
translated: Agni, the all-knowing god, has announced the dawns, the shining ones, with his great powers.

original: ā nāsatyorugāyā rathenemaṃ yajñam upa no yātam accha //🔽ūrdhvaṃ ketuṃ savitā devo aśrej jyotir viśvasmai bhuvanāya kṛṇvan /
analyzed: ā nāsatyā uru gāyā rathena imam yajñam upa naḥ yātam accha  ūrdhvam ketum savitā devaḥ aśret jyotiḥ viśvasmai bhuvanāya kṛṇvan
translated: Come to this sacrifice of ours on the swift-moving chariot of the two Nāsatyas.🔽Savitar, the god, has raised up the lofty banner, creating light for all the worlds.

original: āprā dyāvāpṛthivī antarikṣaṃ vi sūryo raśmibhiś cekitānaḥ //
analyzed: āprāḥ dyāvāpṛthivī antarikṣam vi sūryaḥ raśmibhiḥ cekitānaḥ
translated: The sun, with his rays, has filled heaven, earth, and the atmosphere, and is shining.

original: āvahanty aruṇīr jyotiṣāgān mahī citrā raśmibhiś cekitānā /
analyzed: āvahantī aruṇīḥ jyotiṣā āgāt mahī citrā raśmibhiḥ cekitānā
translated: The red ones bring the light, the great and wonderful one, shining with rays.

original: prabodhayantī suvitāya devy uṣā īyate suyujā rathena //
analyzed: prabodhayantī suvitāya devī uṣāḥ īyate su yujā rathena
translated: The goddess Ushas, waking (us) for prosperity, moves along with her well-yoked chariot.

original: ā vāṃ vahiṣṭhā iha te vahantu rathā aśvāsa uṣaso vyuṣṭau /
analyzed: ā vām vahiṣṭhāḥ iha te vahantu rathāḥ aśvāsaḥ uṣasaḥ vyuṣṭau
translated: Here let your best-drawn chariots, your horses, bring you at dawn, O Ushas.

original: ime hi vām madhupeyāya somā asmin yajñe vṛṣaṇā mādayethām //
analyzed: ime hi vām madhu peyāya somāḥ asmin yajñe vṛṣaṇā mādayethām
translated: For these Soma juices are to be drunk by you two, O mighty ones, rejoice in this sacrifice.

original: anāyato anibaddhaḥ kathāyaṃ nyaṅṅ uttāno 'va padyate na /
analyzed: an āyataḥ a nibaddhaḥ kathā ayam nyaṅ uttānaḥ padyate na
translated: Unrestrained, unbound, this speech falls down, turned back, on the speaker.

original: kayā yāti svadhayā ko dadarśa diva skambhaḥ samṛtaḥ pāti nākam //
analyzed: kayā yāti svadhayā kaḥ dadarśa divaḥ skambhaḥ samṛtaḥ pāti nākam
translated: By what path does it go? Who has seen it? The pillar of heaven, established, guards the vault.

original: agnir hotā no adhvare vājī san pari ṇīyate /
analyzed: agniḥ hotā naḥ adhvare vājī san pari ṇīyate
translated: Agni, the priest, is led around as a strong horse in our sacrifice.

original: devo deveṣu yajñiyaḥ //
analyzed: devaḥ deveṣu yajñiyaḥ
translated: The god among the gods, worthy of sacrifice.

original: pari triviṣṭy adhvaraṃ yāty agnī rathīr iva /
analyzed: pari tri viṣṭī adhvaram yāti agniḥ rathīḥ iva
translated: Agni goes around the threefold sacrifice like a charioteer.

original: ā deveṣu prayo dadhat //
analyzed: ā deveṣu prayaḥ dadhat
translated: Placing the offering among the gods.

original: pari vājapatiḥ kavir agnir havyāny akramīt /
analyzed: pari vāja patiḥ kaviḥ agniḥ havyāni akramīt
translated: The wise Agni, the lord of strength, has gone around the offerings.

original: dadhad ratnāni dāśuṣe //
analyzed: dadhat ratnāni dāśuṣe
translated: Placing treasures for the worshipper.

original: ayaṃ yaḥ sṛñjaye puro daivavāte samidhyate /
analyzed: ayam yaḥ sṛñjaye puras daivavāte samidhyate
translated: This Agni who is kindled in front of the Sṛñjayas, in the house of the god-invoking (sacrificer),

original: dyumāṃ amitradambhanaḥ //
analyzed: dyumān amitra dambhanaḥ
translated: The glorious one, the subduer of enemies.

original: asya ghā vīra īvato 'gner īśīta martyaḥ /
analyzed: asya gha vīraḥ īvataḥ gneḥ īśīta martyaḥ
translated: Let no mortal man provoke the anger of this Agni, the strong one,

original: tigmajambhasya mīḷhuṣaḥ //
analyzed: tigma jambhasya mīḷhuṣaḥ
translated: The one with sharp teeth, the greedy one.

original: tam arvantaṃ na sānasim aruṣaṃ na divaḥ śiśum /
analyzed: tam arvantam na sānasim aruṣam na divaḥ śiśum
translated: Him, like a swift horse, the ruddy one, the child of the sky,

original: marmṛjyante divedive //
analyzed: marmṛjyante dive dive
translated: They adorn day by day.

original: bodhad yan mā haribhyāṃ kumāraḥ sāhadevyaḥ /
analyzed: bodhat yat mā haribhyām kumāraḥ sāhadevyaḥ
translated: When the young boy of Sāhadevī has awakened me with his two bay horses,

original: acchā na hūta ud aram //
analyzed: acchā na hūtaḥ ud aram
translated: I have come to the invocation, to the height.

original: uta tyā yajatā harī kumārāt sāhadevyāt /
analyzed: uta tyā yajatā harī kumārāt sāhadevyāt
translated: And your two tawny horses, which you yoke for the young boy of Sāhadevī,

original: prayatā sadya ā dade //
analyzed: prayatā sadyas ā dade
translated: I have taken away immediately.

original: eṣa vāṃ devāv aśvinā kumāraḥ sāhadevyaḥ /
analyzed: eṣa vām devau aśvinā kumāraḥ sāhadevyaḥ
translated: This prince of yours, O gods, the son of Sahadeva,

original: dīrghāyur astu somakaḥ //
analyzed: dīrgha āyuḥ astu somakaḥ
translated: May Soma be long-lived.

original: taṃ yuvaṃ devāv aśvinā kumāraṃ sāhadevyam /
analyzed: tam yuvam devau aśvinā kumāram sāhadevyam
translated: You two gods, O Asvins, this prince, the son of Sahadeva,

original: dīrghāyuṣaṃ kṛṇotana //
analyzed: dīrgha āyuṣam kṛṇotana
translated: Make him long-lived.

original: ā satyo yātu maghavāṃ ṛjīṣī dravantv asya haraya upa naḥ /
analyzed: ā satyaḥ yātu maghavān ṛjīṣī dravantu asya harayaḥ upa naḥ
translated: May the true, bountiful, impetuous one come to us. Let his tawny horses hasten to us.

original: tasmā id andhaḥ suṣumā sudakṣam ihābhipitvaṃ karate gṛṇānaḥ //🔽ava sya śūrādhvano nānte 'smin no adya savane mandadhyai /
analyzed: tasmai id andhaḥ suṣuma su dakṣam iha abhipitvam karate gṛṇānaḥ  ava sya śūra adhvanaḥ na ante smin naḥ adya savane mandadhyai
translated: To him, the swift, the well-formed, the skillful one, I offer this praise, singing here for his protection.🔽At the end of his heroic journey, may he rejoice in this libation of ours today.

original: śaṃsāty uktham uśaneva vedhāś cikituṣe asuryāya manma //
analyzed: śaṃsāti uktham uśanā iva vedhāḥ cikituṣe asuryāya manma
translated: He praises the hymn like a wise one, a thought for the discerning, the divine one.

original: kavir na niṇyaṃ vidathāni sādhan vṛṣā yat sekaṃ vipipāno arcāt /
analyzed: kaviḥ na niṇyam vidathāni sādhan vṛṣā yat sekam vipipānaḥ arcāt
translated: The bull, the sage, accomplishing the rites, the seat, when he praises the sprinkling,

original: diva itthā jījanat sapta kārūn ahnā cic cakrur vayunā gṛṇantaḥ //
analyzed: divaḥ itthā jījanat sapta kārūn ahnā cit cakruḥ vayunā gṛṇantaḥ
translated: Here from the sky he generated the seven priests. Even in one day they performed the rites, singing.

original: svar yad vedi sudṛśīkam arkair mahi jyotī rurucur yad dha vastoḥ /
analyzed: svar yat vedi sudṛśīkam arkaiḥ mahi jyotiḥ rurucuḥ yat ha vastoḥ
translated: The heaven, the altar, the well-seen one with the rays, the great light shines forth, as it were, from the east.

original: andhā tamāṃsi dudhitā vicakṣe nṛbhyaś cakāra nṛtamo abhiṣṭau //
analyzed: andhā tamāṃsi dudhitā vicakṣe nṛbhyaḥ cakāra nṛtamaḥ abhiṣṭau
translated: He has dispelled the blinding darkness, the hidden one, and has made the best of men visible to men.

original: vavakṣa indro amitam ṛjīṣy ubhe ā paprau rodasī mahitvā /
analyzed: vavakṣa indraḥ amitam ṛjīṣī ubhe ā paprau rodasī mahitvā
translated: Indra, the mighty one, has grown immeasurably, he has filled both worlds with his greatness.

original: ataś cid asya mahimā vi recy abhi yo viśvā bhuvanā babhūva //🔽viśvāni śakro naryāṇi vidvān apo rireca sakhibhir nikāmaiḥ /
analyzed: atas cit asya mahimā vi reci abhi yaḥ viśvā bhuvanā babhūva  viśvāni śakraḥ naryāṇi vidvān apaḥ rireca sakhibhiḥ nikāmaiḥ
translated: Therefore his greatness is spread out, he who has become all existing things.🔽Shakra, knowing all manly deeds, has sent forth the waters with his dear friends.

original: aśmānaṃ cid ye bibhidur vacobhir vrajaṃ gomantam uśijo vi vavruḥ //🔽apo vṛtraṃ vavrivāṃsam parāhan prāvat te vajram pṛthivī sacetāḥ /
analyzed: aśmānam cit ye bibhiduḥ vacobhiḥ vrajam gomantam uśijaḥ vi vavruḥ  apaḥ vṛtram vavrivāṃsam parāhan prāvat te vajram pṛthivī sacetāḥ
translated: Even the stone have they cleft with their words; the eager ones have opened the stall full of cattle.🔽He has smitten away the water-loving Vrtra; the earth with her heart has welcomed thy thunderbolt.

original: prārṇāṃsi samudriyāṇy ainoḥ patir bhavañ chavasā śūra dhṛṣṇo //
analyzed: pra arṇāṃsi samudriyāṇi ainoḥ patiḥ bhavam śavasā śūra dhṛṣṇo
translated: Thou hast brought hither the ocean's depths, O hero, O mighty one, O bold one, becoming the lord.

original: apo yad adrim puruhūta dardar āvir bhuvat saramā pūrvyaṃ te /
analyzed: apa u yat adrim puruhūta dardar āvis bhuvat saramā pūrvyam te
translated: When thou, O much-invoked one, hast burst the water-cloud, Saramā hath appeared as thy forerunner.

original: sa no netā vājam ā darṣi bhūriṃ gotrā rujann aṅgirobhir gṛṇānaḥ //
analyzed: sa naḥ netā vājam ā darṣi bhūrim gotrā rujan aṅgirobhiḥ gṛṇānaḥ
translated: Be thou our leader to abundant booty, praised with the Angirases, O thou who breakest the stalls.

original: acchā kaviṃ nṛmaṇo gā abhiṣṭau svarṣātā maghavan nādhamānam /🔽ūtibhis tam iṣaṇo dyumnahūtau ni māyāvān abrahmā dasyur arta //🔽ā dasyughnā manasā yāhy astam bhuvat te kutsaḥ sakhye nikāmaḥ /
analyzed: acchā kavim nṛmaṇaḥ gāḥ abhiṣṭau svarṣātā maghavan nādhamānam  ūtibhiḥ tam iṣaṇaḥ dyumna hūtau ni māyāvān abrahmā dasyuḥ arta  ā dasyu ghnā manasā yāhi astam bhuvat te kutsaḥ sakhye nikāmaḥ
translated: Come to the sage, the gladdener of men, to the worshipper, O bountiful one.🔽With thy help, O thou who art invoked to glory, crush the deceitful, the godless Dasyu.🔽Come to the house in thy spirit, O thou who slayest the Dasyus; Kutsa hath been thy dear friend in friendship.

original: sve yonau ni ṣadataṃ sarūpā vi vāṃ cikitsad ṛtacid dha nārī //
analyzed: sve yonau ni sadatam sarūpā vi vām cikitsat ṛta cit ha nārī
translated: Sit in your own form in your own birthplace; the woman who knows the truth shall look on you two.

original: yāsi kutsena saratham avasyus todo vātasya haryor īśānaḥ /
analyzed: yāsi kutsena sa ratham avasyuḥ todaḥ vātasya haryoḥ īśānaḥ
translated: When thou goest with Kutsa to the chariot, the impeller, lord of the tawny one's speed.

original: ṛjrā vājaṃ na gadhyaṃ yuyūṣan kavir yad ahan pāryāya bhūṣāt //
analyzed: ṛjrā vājam na gadhyam yuyūṣan kaviḥ yat ahan pāryāya bhūṣāt
translated: The two swift ones would urge on the booty not to be overcome, when the sage was ready to strike.
