original: kutsāya śuṣṇam aśuṣaṃ ni barhīḥ prapitve ahnaḥ kuyavaṃ sahasrā /
analyzed: kutsāya śuṣṇam aśuṣam ni barhīḥ prapitve ahnaḥ kuyavam sahasrā
translated: For Kutsa thou didst cast down the dry, the parching Sushna, in the evening of the day, the thousand (enemies).

original: sadyo dasyūn pra mṛṇa kutsyena pra sūraś cakraṃ vṛhatād abhīke //
analyzed: sadyas dasyūn pra mṛṇa kutsyena pra sūraḥ cakram vṛhatāt abhīke
translated: Slay the Dasyus at once with the Kutsa-worthy (weapon), and let the sun roll his wheel in front.

original: tvam piprum mṛgayaṃ śūśuvāṃsam ṛjiśvane vaidathināya randhīḥ /
analyzed: tvam piprum mṛgayam śūśuvāṃsam ṛjiśvane vaidathināya randhīḥ
translated: Thou didst give to Ṛjiśvan, to the son of Vedadât, the boasting Pipru, to be slain.

original: pañcāśat kṛṣṇā ni vapaḥ sahasrātkaṃ na puro jarimā vi dardaḥ //
analyzed: pañcāśat kṛṣṇāḥ ni vapaḥ sahasrā atkam na puraḥ jarimā vi dardar
translated: Thou didst tear asunder the five hundred black (enemies), the thousand, the fortress, with thy bolt.

original: sūra upāke tanvaṃ dadhāno vi yat te cety amṛtasya varpaḥ /
analyzed: sūraḥ upāke tanvam dadhānaḥ vi yat te ceti amṛtasya varpaḥ
translated: The sun, setting his body in the near (sky), when thy form, O immortal one, is seen.

original: mṛgo na hastī taviṣīm uṣāṇaḥ siṃho na bhīma āyudhāni bibhrat //
analyzed: mṛgaḥ na hastī taviṣīm uṣāṇaḥ siṃhaḥ na bhīmaḥ āyudhāni bibhrat
translated: Shining with his own light, like a mighty elephant, like a terrible lion bearing his weapons.

original: indraṃ kāmā vasūyanto agman svarmīḷhe na savane cakānāḥ /
analyzed: indram kāmāḥ vasūyantaḥ agman svarmīḍhe na savane cakānāḥ
translated: The desires have come to Indra, longing for wealth, shining in the heaven, in the libation.

original: śravasyavaḥ śaśamānāsa ukthair oko na raṇvā sudṛśīva puṣṭiḥ //
analyzed: śravasyavaḥ śaśamānāsaḥ ukthaiḥ okaḥ na raṇvā sudṛśī iva puṣṭiḥ
translated: The seekers of glory, striving with their lauds, like a pleasant home, like prosperity, O good seer.

original: tam id va indraṃ suhavaṃ huvema yas tā cakāra naryā purūṇi /
analyzed: tam id vaḥ indram su havam huvema yaḥ tā cakāra naryā purūṇi
translated: To him, to Indra, we will call, who is easily invoked, who hath done these manly deeds in abundance.

original: yo māvate jaritre gadhyaṃ cin makṣū vājam bharati spārharādhāḥ //🔽tigmā yad antar aśaniḥ patāti kasmiñ cic chūra muhuke janānām /
analyzed: yaḥ māvate jaritre gadhyam cit makṣū vājam bharati spārha rādhāḥ  tigmā yat antar aśaniḥ patāti kasmin cit śūra muhuke janānām
translated: Who brings to the worshipper who lauds him, even to the poor man, booty to be seized.🔽When the sharp thunderbolt falls within some man of the people, O hero, in his house,

original: ghorā yad arya samṛtir bhavāty adha smā nas tanvo bodhi gopāḥ //
analyzed: ghorā yat arya samṛtiḥ bhavāti adha smā naḥ tanvaḥ bodhi gopāḥ
translated: When the terrible destruction of the foe comes, then be thou the guardian of our bodies.

original: bhuvo 'vitā vāmadevasya dhīnām bhuvaḥ sakhāvṛko vājasātau /
analyzed: bhuvaḥ vitā vāmadevasya dhīnām bhuvaḥ sakhā avṛkaḥ vājasātau
translated: Be thou the protector of Vamadeva's thoughts, be thou the friend, O Vrka, in the winning of strength.

original: tvām anu pramatim ā jaganmoruśaṃso jaritre viśvadha syāḥ //
analyzed: tvām anu pramatim ā jaganma uru śaṃsaḥ jaritre viśvadha syāḥ
translated: Follow thou the thought of the singer, be thou in every way the bestower of great bliss.

original: ebhir nṛbhir indra tvāyubhiṣ ṭvā maghavadbhir maghavan viśva ājau /
analyzed: ebhiḥ nṛbhiḥ indra tvāyubhiḥ tvā maghavadbhiḥ maghavan viśvaḥ ājau
translated: With these men, O Indra, who are thy friends, with these wealthy ones, O Maghavan, in every battle,

original: dyāvo na dyumnair abhi santo aryaḥ kṣapo madema śaradaś ca pūrvīḥ //
analyzed: dyāvaḥ na dyumnaiḥ abhi santaḥ aryaḥ kṣapaḥ madema śaradaḥ ca pūrvīḥ
translated: May we, with their glory, surpass the Dyaus, and rejoice in many autumns.

original: eved indrāya vṛṣabhāya vṛṣṇe brahmākarma bhṛgavo na ratham /
analyzed: eva id indrāya vṛṣabhāya vṛṣṇe brahma akarma bhṛgavaḥ na ratham
translated: Even this prayer for the strong, the bull, Indra, the Bhr̥igus have made like a chariot.

original: nū cid yathā naḥ sakhyā viyoṣad asan na ugro 'vitā tanūpāḥ //
analyzed: nu cit yathā naḥ sakhyā viyoṣat asat naḥ ugraḥ vitā tanū pāḥ
translated: Let not his friendship with us be changed, let him be a strong protector of our bodies.

original: nū ṣṭuta indra nū gṛṇāna iṣaṃ jaritre nadyo na pīpeḥ /
analyzed: nu stutaḥ indra nu gṛṇānaḥ iṣam jaritre nadyaḥ na pīpeḥ
translated: Now, O Indra, praised and extolled, do thou, as a river for the singer, give food.

original: akāri te harivo brahma navyaṃ dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ //
analyzed: akāri te harivas brahma navyam dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ
translated: For thee, O lord of bays, we have made a new prayer; may we be, with our thoughts, charioteers, ever-victorious.

original: tvam mahāṃ indra tubhyaṃ ha kṣā anu kṣatram maṃhanā manyata dyauḥ /
analyzed: tvam mahān indra tubhyam ha kṣā anu kṣatram maṃhanā manyata dyauḥ
translated: Thou art great, O Indra; to thee the regions, to thy sway, O Thunderer, the heaven bows.

original: tvaṃ vṛtraṃ śavasā jaghanvān sṛjaḥ sindhūṃr ahinā jagrasānān //
analyzed: tvam vṛtram śavasā jaghanvān sṛjaḥ sindhūṃr ahinā jagrasānān
translated: Thou, slaying Vritra with might, hast loosed the rivers which the dragon held imprisoned.

original: tava tviṣo janiman rejata dyau rejad bhūmir bhiyasā svasya manyoḥ /🔽ṛghāyanta subhvaḥ parvatāsa ārdan dhanvāni sarayanta āpaḥ //
analyzed: tava tviṣaḥ janiman rejata dyauḥ rejat bhūmiḥ bhiyasā svasya manyoḥ  ṛghāyanta su bhvaḥ parvatāsaḥ ārdan dhanvāni sarayantaḥ āpaḥ
translated: Thy flames, O Manyu, at thy birth, have shaken heaven, have shaken the earth with fear of thine own self.🔽The mighty mountains have bent down, the floods have flowed, the waters have flowed on, the deserts have been broken up.

original: bhinad giriṃ śavasā vajram iṣṇann āviṣkṛṇvānaḥ sahasāna ojaḥ /🔽vadhīd vṛtraṃ vajreṇa mandasānaḥ sarann āpo javasā hatavṛṣṇīḥ //
analyzed: bhinat girim śavasā vajram iṣṇan āviṣkṛṇvānaḥ sahasānaḥ ojaḥ  vadhīt vṛtram vajreṇa mandasānaḥ saran āpaḥ javasā hata vṛṣṇīḥ
translated: He cleft the mountain with his might, hurling his thunderbolt, revealing, conquering, his strength.🔽He slew Vritra with his bolt, rejoicing, the waters flowed, the bull was slain, and flowed.

original: suvīras te janitā manyata dyaur indrasya kartā svapastamo bhūt /
analyzed: su vīraḥ te janitā manyata dyauḥ indrasya kartā su apastamaḥ bhūt
translated: Thy father, O Indra, the good hero, hath been thought of by heaven, hath been the maker of Indra, most bountiful.

original: ya īṃ jajāna svaryaṃ suvajram anapacyutaṃ sadaso na bhūma //
analyzed: yaḥ īm jajāna svaryam su vajram an apacyutam sadasaḥ na bhūma
translated: He who hath generated him, the heavenly, the well-wounded, not to be shaken from his seat as from the earth.

original: ya eka ic cyāvayati pra bhūmā rājā kṛṣṭīnām puruhūta indraḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ ekaḥ id cyāvayati pra bhūmā rājā kṛṣṭīnām puruhūtaḥ indraḥ
translated: He who alone, as king of men, much invoked, Indra, moveth the people to the great place.

original: satyam enam anu viśve madanti rātiṃ devasya gṛṇato maghonaḥ //
analyzed: satyam enam anu viśve madanti rātim devasya gṛṇataḥ maghonaḥ
translated: All rejoice in him as true, the gifts of the bounteous God, the singer's gifts.

original: satrā somā abhavann asya viśve satrā madāso bṛhato madiṣṭhāḥ /
analyzed: satrā somāḥ abhavan asya viśve satrā madāsaḥ bṛhataḥ madiṣṭhāḥ
translated: Ever have all the Soma juices been his, ever the gladdening draughts of thee the mighty one.

original: satrābhavo vasupatir vasūnāṃ datre viśvā adhithā indra kṛṣṭīḥ //
analyzed: satrā bhavaḥ vasu patiḥ vasūnām datre viśvāḥ adhithāḥ indra kṛṣṭīḥ
translated: The Lord of wealth, the possessor of all treasures, the supporter of all things, the bestower of all boons, O Indra, the subduer of all foes.

original: tvam adha prathamaṃ jāyamāno 'me viśvā adhithā indra kṛṣṭīḥ /
analyzed: tvam adha prathamam jāyamānaḥ me viśvāḥ adhithāḥ indra kṛṣṭīḥ
translated: Thou, O Indra, at thy birth didst subdue all the people, and didst slay the dragon lying across the path.

original: tvam prati pravata āśayānam ahiṃ vajreṇa maghavan vi vṛścaḥ //🔽satrāhaṇaṃ dādhṛṣiṃ tumram indram mahām apāraṃ vṛṣabhaṃ suvajram /
analyzed: tvam prati pravataḥ āśayānam ahim vajreṇa maghavan vi vṛścaḥ  satrāhaṇam dādhṛṣim tumram indram mahām apāram vṛṣabham su vajram
translated: With thy thunderbolt, O Maghavan, thou didst cleave the dragon lying across the path.🔽The ever-victorious, daring, mighty Indra, the great, boundless, bull with the good thunderbolt,

original: hantā yo vṛtraṃ sanitota vājaṃ dātā maghāni maghavā surādhāḥ //
analyzed: hantā yaḥ vṛtram sanitā uta vājam dātā maghāni maghavā su rādhāḥ
translated: The slayer of Vrtra, the winner of booty, the bountiful Maghavan, the giver of great gifts.

original: ayaṃ vṛtaś cātayate samīcīr ya ājiṣu maghavā śṛṇva ekaḥ /
analyzed: ayam vṛtaḥ cātayate samīcīḥ yaḥ ājiṣu maghavā śṛṇve ekaḥ
translated: He, the sole hero, the bountiful one, is praised in the battles, he who drives away the enemies.

original: ayaṃ vājam bharati yaṃ sanoty asya priyāsaḥ sakhye syāma //
analyzed: ayam vājam bharati yam sanoti asya priyāsaḥ sakhye syāma
translated: He bears the booty which he wins; may we be dear to him and to his friends.

original: ayaṃ śṛṇve adha jayann uta ghnann ayam uta pra kṛṇute yudhā gāḥ /
analyzed: ayam śṛṇve adha jayan uta ghnan ayam uta pra kṛṇute yudhā gāḥ
translated: He is praised when he conquers and slays; he alone wins the cattle in the battles.

original: yadā satyaṃ kṛṇute manyum indro viśvaṃ dṛḷham bhayata ejad asmāt //🔽sam indro gā ajayat saṃ hiraṇyā sam aśviyā maghavā yo ha pūrvīḥ /
analyzed: yadā satyam kṛṇute manyum indraḥ viśvam dṛḍham bhayate ejat asmāt  sam indraḥ gāḥ ajayat sam hiraṇyā sam aśviyā maghavā yaḥ ha pūrvīḥ
translated: When Indra makes his mind firm and true, all that is firm and strong trembles for fear of him.🔽Indra has won the kine, the gold, and the horses, the bountiful one who possesses many treasures.

original: ebhir nṛbhir nṛtamo asya śākai rāyo vibhaktā sambharaś ca vasvaḥ //
analyzed: ebhiḥ nṛbhiḥ nṛtamaḥ asya śākaiḥ rāyaḥ vibhaktā sambharaḥ ca vasvaḥ
translated: With these men, the best of men, with his friends, he distributes wealth and treasure.

original: kiyat svid indro adhy eti mātuḥ kiyat pitur janitur yo jajāna /
analyzed: kiyat svid indraḥ adhi eti mātuḥ kiyat pituḥ janituḥ yaḥ jajāna
translated: How far does Indra go to his mother, how far to his father, the begetter who begat him?

original: yo asya śuṣmam muhukair iyarti vāto na jūta stanayadbhir abhraiḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ asya śuṣmam muhukais iyarti vātaḥ na jūta stanayadbhiḥ abhraiḥ
translated: He who with his swift (steeds) hurls forth his strength, like a wind urged on by thundering clouds.

original: kṣiyantaṃ tvam akṣiyantaṃ kṛṇotīyarti reṇum maghavā samoham /
analyzed: kṣiyantam tvam a kṣiyantam kṛṇoti iyarti reṇum maghavā sa moham
translated: Thou makest him who is weak strong, the bountiful one hurls the dust together.

original: vibhañjanur aśanimāṃ iva dyaur uta stotāram maghavā vasau dhāt //
analyzed: vibhañjanuḥ aśanimān iva dyauḥ uta stotāram maghavā vasau dhāt
translated: May the bountiful one place the praiser in prosperity, like the sky that breaks open and is full of lightning.

original: ayaṃ cakram iṣaṇat sūryasya ny etaśaṃ rīramat sasṛmāṇam /
analyzed: ayam cakram iṣaṇat sūryasya ni etaśam rīramat sasṛmāṇam
translated: This wheel of the sun has rolled on, the star has moved along with the moving (sun).

original: ā kṛṣṇa īṃ juhurāṇo jigharti tvaco budhne rajaso asya yonau //
analyzed: ā kṛṣṇaḥ īm juhurāṇaḥ jigharti tvacaḥ budhne rajasaḥ asya yonau
translated: The dark one licks it, eager, at the edge of the skin, in the womb of this air.

original: asiknyāṃ yajamāno na hotā //
analyzed: asiknyām yajamānaḥ na hotā
translated: The sacrificer is like a priest on the Asicni (altar).

original: gavyanta indraṃ sakhyāya viprā aśvāyanto vṛṣaṇaṃ vājayantaḥ /
analyzed: gavyantaḥ indram sakhyāya viprāḥ aśvāyantaḥ vṛṣaṇam vājayantaḥ
translated: The sages, longing for cattle, the strong one for the horse, the young men for the young woman,

original: janīyanto janidām akṣitotim ā cyāvayāmo 'vate na kośam //
analyzed: janīyantaḥ jani dām a kṣita ūtim ā cyāvayāmaḥ vate na kośam
translated: we urge the imperishable one who gives birth to offspring, like a vessel, to our help.

original: trātā no bodhi dadṛśāna āpir abhikhyātā marḍitā somyānām /
analyzed: trātā naḥ bodhi dadṛśānaḥ āpiḥ abhikhyātā marḍitā somyānām
translated: Be our protector, be thou seen, be thou a guardian, be thou the most famous of those who are to be praised by the Soma-pressers.

original: sakhā pitā pitṛtamaḥ pitṝṇāṃ kartem u lokam uśate vayodhāḥ //
analyzed: sakhā pitā pitṛtamaḥ pitṝṇām kartā īm u lokam uśate vayodhāḥ
translated: Be a friend, a father, the best of fathers to the fathers, make that world, O thou who givest life, for him who longs for it.

original: sakhīyatām avitā bodhi sakhā gṛṇāna indra stuvate vayo dhāḥ /
analyzed: sakhīyatām avitā bodhi sakhā gṛṇānaḥ indra stuvate vayaḥ dhāḥ
translated: Be thou the friend of those who call on thee, O Friend, give life to him who sings and lauds thee.

original: vayaṃ hy ā te cakṛmā sabādha ābhiḥ śamībhir mahayanta indra //
analyzed: vayam hi ā te cakṛma sabādhaḥ ābhiḥ śamībhiḥ mahayantaḥ indra
translated: For we have made thee, O Indra, our sole protector with these oblations, exalting thee.

original: stuta indro maghavā yad dha vṛtrā bhūrīṇy eko apratīni hanti /
analyzed: stutaḥ indraḥ maghavā yat ha vṛtrā bhūrīṇi ekaḥ apratīni hanti
translated: When Indra, the bountiful, slays many a Vr̥itra, alone, unconquerable deeds,

original: asya priyo jaritā yasya śarman nakir devā vārayante na martāḥ //
analyzed: asya priyaḥ jaritā yasya śarman nakir devāḥ vārayante na martāḥ
translated: The dear praiser of him whose protection is so great, neither gods nor men can ward off.

original: evā na indro maghavā virapśī karat satyā carṣaṇīdhṛd anarvā /
analyzed: eva naḥ indraḥ maghavā virapśī karat satyā carṣaṇī dhṛt anarvā
translated: So may Indra, the bountiful, the mighty, the unresisted, the supporter of men, make our words true.

original: tvaṃ rājā januṣāṃ dhehy asme adhi śravo māhinaṃ yaj jaritre //
analyzed: tvam rājā januṣām dhehi asme adhi śravaḥ māhinam yat jaritre
translated: Thou, O King, give us in our race high glory, which the singer may win.

original: nū ṣṭuta indra nū gṛṇāna iṣaṃ jaritre nadyo na pīpeḥ /
analyzed: nu stutaḥ indra nu gṛṇānaḥ iṣam jaritre nadyaḥ na pīpeḥ
translated: Now, Indra, praised and lauded, give food to the singer, as the rivers give water.

original: akāri te harivo brahma navyaṃ dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ //
analyzed: akāri te harivas brahma navyam dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ
translated: We will be, O thou who givest steeds, thy faithful worshippers with our thought, ever ready.

original: ayam panthā anuvittaḥ purāṇo yato devā udajāyanta viśve /
analyzed: ayam panthāḥ anuvittaḥ purāṇaḥ yatas devāḥ udajāyanta viśve
translated: This is the ancient path, the known, by which all the gods were born.

original: ataś cid ā janiṣīṣṭa pravṛddho mā mātaram amuyā pattave kaḥ //
analyzed: atas cit ā janiṣīṣṭa pravṛddhaḥ mā mātaram amuyā pattave kaḥ
translated: From thence let him be born, the mighty one, let him not, for the sake of his mother, go to the world of the living.

original: nāham ato nir ayā durgahaitat tiraścatā pārśvān nir gamāṇi /
analyzed: na aham atas niḥ ayā durgahā etat tiraścatā pārśvāt niḥ gamāni
translated: I will not go out from here by this difficult way, I will go out from the sides, transversely.

original: bahūni me akṛtā kartvāni yudhyai tvena saṃ tvena pṛcchai //
analyzed: bahūni me a kṛtā kartvāni yudhyai tvena sam tvena pṛcchai
translated: I have many things to do, to fight with you, to question you.

original: parāyatīm mātaram anv acaṣṭa na nānu gāny anu nū gamāni /
analyzed: parāyatīm mātaram anu acaṣṭa na nā anu gāni anu nu gamāni
translated: He saw his mother going away, he did not follow her, nor did he go himself.

original: tvaṣṭur gṛhe apibat somam indraḥ śatadhanyaṃ camvoḥ sutasya //
analyzed: tvaṣṭuḥ gṛhe apibat somam indraḥ śata dhanyam camvoḥ sutasya
translated: In Tvastr's house Indra drank the Soma, the hundred-fold pressed juice, from the wooden cups.

original: kiṃ sa ṛdhak kṛṇavad yaṃ sahasram māso jabhāra śaradaś ca pūrvīḥ /
analyzed: kim saḥ ṛdhak kṛṇavat yam sahasram māsaḥ jabhāra śaradaḥ ca pūrvīḥ
translated: What did he do more than that for whom a thousand months and many autumns brought him up?

original: nahī nv asya pratimānam asty antar jāteṣūta ye janitvāḥ //
analyzed: nahi nu asya pratimānam asti antar jāteṣu uta ye janitvāḥ
translated: For he has no measure, no limit, among the born, among those who were born before him.

original: avadyam iva manyamānā guhākar indram mātā vīryeṇā nyṛṣṭam /
analyzed: avadyam iva manyamānā guhā akaḥ indram mātā vīryeṇa ā nyṛṣṭam
translated: Considering him as a fault, his mother hid Indra, who was born strong.

original: athod asthāt svayam atkaṃ vasāna ā rodasī apṛṇāj jāyamānaḥ //
analyzed: atha ud asthāt svayam atkam vasānaḥ ā rodasī apṛṇāt jāyamānaḥ
translated: Then he rose up, clothed in his own garment, and at birth filled the two world-halves.

original: etā arṣanty alalābhavantīr ṛtāvarīr iva saṃkrośamānāḥ /
analyzed: etāḥ arṣanti alalābhavantīḥ ṛtāvarīḥ iva saṃkrośamānāḥ
translated: These flow along, becoming more and more beautiful, crying out like the truthful ones.

original: etā vi pṛccha kim idam bhananti kam āpo adrim paridhiṃ rujanti //
analyzed: etāḥ vi pṛccha kim idam bhananti kam āpaḥ adrim paridhim rujanti
translated: Ask them, what is this that they are crying out? What waters are they making the mountain their boundary?

original: kim u ṣvid asmai nivido bhanantendrasyāvadyaṃ didhiṣanta āpaḥ /
analyzed: kim u svid asmai nividaḥ bhananta indrasya avadyam didhiṣante āpaḥ
translated: What indeed is this that they are making the waters, the waters, the fault of Indra?

original: mamaitān putro mahatā vadhena vṛtraṃ jaghanvāṃ asṛjad vi sindhūn //
analyzed: mama etān putraḥ mahatā vadhena vṛtram jaghanvān asṛjat vi sindhūn
translated: My son, with a great blow, having slain Vritra, let loose the rivers.

original: mamac cana tvā yuvatiḥ parāsa mamac cana tvā kuṣavā jagāra /
analyzed: mamat cana tvā yuvatiḥ parāsa mamat cana tvā kuṣavā jagāra
translated: And a young woman has carried thee away, and a wasting disease has seized upon thee.

original: mamac cid āpaḥ śiśave mamṛḍyur mamac cid indraḥ sahasod atiṣṭhat //
analyzed: mamat cit āpaḥ śiśave mamṛḍyuḥ mamat cit indraḥ sahasā ud atiṣṭhat
translated: The waters have been kind to the child, and Indra has risen up through strength.

original: mamac cana te maghavan vyaṃso nivividhvāṃ apa hanū jaghāna /
analyzed: mamat cana te maghavan vyaṃsaḥ nivividhvām apa hanū jaghāna
translated: O Maghavan, thy bolt hath smitten down the jaws of the one who hath a crooked nose.

original: adhā nividdha uttaro babhūvāñ chiro dāsasya sam piṇag vadhena //
analyzed: adhā nividdhaḥ uttaraḥ babhūvām śiraḥ dāsasya sam piṇak vadhena
translated: Now the upper one hath been smitten down, and the head of the Dāsa hath been crushed with a blow.

original: gṛṣṭiḥ sasūva sthaviraṃ tavāgām anādhṛṣyaṃ vṛṣabhaṃ tumram indram /
analyzed: gṛṣṭiḥ sasūva sthaviram tavāgām anādhṛṣyam vṛṣabham tumram indram
translated: The cow hath calved the strong, the ancient one, thee, O Indra, the irresistible, the mighty one.

original: arīḷhaṃ vatsaṃ carathāya mātā svayaṃ gātuṃ tanva icchamānam //
analyzed: a rīḍham vatsam carathāya mātā svayam gātum tanve icchamānam
translated: The mother hath let loose the calf to wander about, seeking of itself the way to its own body.

original: uta mātā mahiṣam anv avenad amī tvā jahati putra devāḥ /
analyzed: uta mātā mahiṣam anu avenat amī tvā jahati putra devāḥ
translated: And the mother hath followed the buffalo: the gods, O son, have forsaken thee.

original: athābravīd vṛtram indro haniṣyan sakhe viṣṇo vitaraṃ vi kramasva //🔽kas te mātaraṃ vidhavām acakrac chayuṃ kas tvām ajighāṃsac carantam /
analyzed: athā bravīt vṛtram indraḥ haniṣyan sakhe viṣṇo vitaram vi kramasva  kaḥ te mātaram vidhavām acakrat śayum kaḥ tvām ajighāṃsat carantam
translated: Then Indra, about to slay Vṛtra, said: 'O friend Viṣṇu, step widely apart.'🔽Who hath made thy mother a widow? Who hath sought to slay thee as thou wanderest?

original: kas te devo adhi mārḍīka āsīd yat prākṣiṇāḥ pitaram pādagṛhya //
analyzed: kaḥ te devaḥ adhi mārḍīke āsīt yat prākṣiṇāḥ pitaram pādagṛhya
translated: Who hath been thy god of mercy, when thou hast dragged thy father by the foot and hast gone away?

original: avartyā śuna āntrāṇi pece na deveṣu vivide marḍitāram /
analyzed: avartyā śunaḥ āntrāṇi pece na deveṣu vivide marḍitāram
translated: I have cooked the entrails of the dog, turning them round and round: I have found no comforter among the gods.

original: apaśyaṃ jāyām amahīyamānām adhā me śyeno madhv ā jabhāra //
analyzed: apaśyam jāyām a mahīyamānām adhā me śyenaḥ madhu ā jabhāra
translated: I saw my wife, not on the earth, but exalted; then the falcon brought me the sweet (Soma).

original: evā tvām indra vajrinn atra viśve devāsaḥ suhavāsa ūmāḥ /
analyzed: eva tvām indra vajrin atra viśve devāsaḥ su havāsaḥ ūmāḥ
translated: Thus, O Indra, O wielder of the thunderbolt, here the All-gods, the most delightful, the terrible,

original: mahām ubhe rodasī vṛddham ṛṣvaṃ nir ekam id vṛṇate vṛtrahatye //
analyzed: mahām ubhe rodasī vṛddham ṛṣvam niḥ ekam id vṛṇate vṛtra hatye
translated: The great, both worlds, the aged, the lofty, choose thee alone for the slaying of Vritra.

original: avāsṛjanta jivrayo na devā bhuvaḥ samrāḷ indra satyayoniḥ /
analyzed: avāsṛjanta jivrayaḥ na devāḥ bhuvaḥ samrāj indra satya yoniḥ
translated: The gods have let loose the streams, O Indra, the true-born lord of the earth.

original: ahann ahim pariśayānam arṇaḥ pra vartanīr arado viśvadhenāḥ //
analyzed: ahan ahim pariśayānam arṇaḥ pra vartanīḥ aradaḥ viśvadhenāḥ
translated: Thou hast slain the serpent lying around the waters; thou hast opened the ways for all to travel.

original: atṛpṇuvantaṃ viyatam abudhyam abudhyamānaṃ suṣupāṇam indra /
analyzed: a tṛpṇuvantam viyatam a budhyam a budhyamānam suṣupāṇam indra
translated: The greedy, the extended, the unknowing, the unknowing one sleeping soundly, O Indra,

original: sapta prati pravata āśayānam ahiṃ vajreṇa vi riṇā aparvan //🔽akṣodayac chavasā kṣāma budhnaṃ vār ṇa vātas taviṣībhir indraḥ /
analyzed: sapta prati pravataḥ āśayānam ahim vajreṇa vi riṇāḥ aparvan  akṣodayat śavasā kṣāma budhnam vār na vātaḥ taviṣībhiḥ indraḥ
translated: The serpent lying in seven deep abysses, thou hast pierced with thy thunderbolt without joints.🔽With might he has stirred the bottom of the earth; the wind with its powers, O Indra.

original: dṛḷhāny aubhnād uśamāna ojo 'vābhinat kakubhaḥ parvatānām //
analyzed: dṛḍhāni aubhnāt uśamānaḥ ojaḥ vā abhinat kakubhaḥ parvatānām
translated: He has burst asunder the firm (mountains) with his will, he has broken the peaks of the mountains.

original: abhi pra dadrur janayo na garbhaṃ rathā iva pra yayuḥ sākam adrayaḥ /
analyzed: abhi pra dadruḥ janayaḥ na garbham rathāḥ iva pra yayuḥ sākam adrayaḥ
translated: They have run forth to him as women to a child; the mountains have gone forth together like chariots.

original: atarpayo visṛta ubja ūrmīn tvaṃ vṛtāṃ ariṇā indra sindhūn //
analyzed: atarpayaḥ visṛte ubje ūrmīn tvam vṛtām ariṇāḥ indra sindhūn
translated: Thou hast satisfied the streams that have spread out, the waves, O Indra, thou hast crossed the enclosed rivers.

original: tvam mahīm avaniṃ viśvadhenāṃ turvītaye vayyāya kṣarantīm /
analyzed: tvam mahīm avanim viśvadhenām turvītaye vayyāya kṣarantīm
translated: Thou madest the earth, the all-supporting ground, to flow for Turvitha and Vya, the mighty.

original: aramayo namasaijad arṇaḥ sutaraṇāṃ akṛṇor indra sindhūn //🔽prāgruvo nabhanvo na vakvā dhvasrā apinvad yuvatīr ṛtajñāḥ /🔽dhanvāny ajrāṃ apṛṇak tṛṣāṇāṃ adhog indra staryo daṃsupatnīḥ //
analyzed: aramayaḥ namasā ejat arṇaḥ su taraṇām akṛṇoḥ indra sindhūn  prāgruvaḥ nabhanvaḥ na vakvāḥ dhvasrāḥ apinvat yuvatīḥ ṛta jñāḥ  dhanvāni ajrām apṛṇak tṛṣāṇām adhok indra staryaḥ daṃsu patnīḥ
translated: Thou madest the rivers easy to ford, O Indra, the water-floods that were hard to cross.🔽The young, the truth-knowing, the swift, the deep, the crooked, thou didst fill with milk, O Indra, the young, the truth-knowing, the swift, the deep, the crooked.🔽Thou didst fill the thirsty deserts with water, and didst bring down, O Indra, the mares with young.

original: pūrvīr uṣasaḥ śaradaś ca gūrtā vṛtraṃ jaghanvāṃ asṛjad vi sindhūn /
analyzed: pūrvīḥ uṣasaḥ śaradaḥ ca gūrtāḥ vṛtram jaghanvān asṛjat vi sindhūn
translated: Many dawns and autumns have passed since thou didst slay Vritra and didst let loose the rivers.

original: pariṣṭhitā atṛṇad badbadhānāḥ sīrā indraḥ sravitave pṛthivyā //
analyzed: pariṣṭhitāḥ atṛṇat badbadhānāḥ sīrāḥ indraḥ sravitave pṛthivyā
translated: Thou didst rend asunder the firmly-bound, the obstructed, the streams, O Indra, for the flowing forth of the earth.

original: vamrībhiḥ putram agruvo adānaṃ niveśanād dhariva ā jabhartha /
analyzed: vamrībhiḥ putram agruvaḥ adānam niveśanāt harivas ā jabhartha
translated: Thou didst give the son of Vamri, the crooked one, the son of Hari, from his dwelling, the unmoving one.

original: vy andho akhyad ahim ādadāno nir bhūd ukhacchit sam aranta parva //🔽pra te pūrvāṇi karaṇāni viprāvidvāṃ āha viduṣe karāṃsi /🔽yathāyathā vṛṣṇyāni svagūrtāpāṃsi rājan naryāviveṣīḥ //
analyzed: vi andhaḥ akhyat ahim ādadānaḥ niḥ bhūt ukha chid sam aranta parva  pra te pūrvāṇi karaṇāni vipra avidvān āha viduṣe karāṃsi  yathā yathā vṛṣṇyāni sva gūrta apāṃsi rājan
translated: The blind one, seizing the serpent, cried out; the one with the cut-off head moved, the joints of the serpent moved.

original: nū ṣṭuta indra nū gṛṇāna iṣaṃ jaritre nadyo na pīpeḥ /
analyzed: nu stutaḥ indra nu gṛṇānaḥ iṣam jaritre nadyaḥ na pīpeḥ
translated: The earlier deeds of thee, O Indra, the wise one, the learned one, the learned one, the wise one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned one, the learned

original: akāri te harivo brahma navyaṃ dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ //
analyzed: akāri te harivas brahma navyam dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ
translated: We will be, O Lord of Bay Horses, your constant worshippers, with our prayer, with our new praise.

original: ā na indro dūrād ā na āsād abhiṣṭikṛd avase yāsad ugraḥ /
analyzed: ā naḥ indraḥ dūrāt ā naḥ āsāt abhiṣṭi kṛt avase yāsat ugraḥ
translated: May Indra come to us from far away, may he come near to help us, the terrible one.

original: ojiṣṭhebhir nṛpatir vajrabāhuḥ saṃge samatsu turvaṇiḥ pṛtanyūn //
analyzed: ojiṣṭhebhiḥ nṛpatiḥ vajra bāhuḥ saṃge samatsu turvaṇiḥ pṛtanyūn
translated: With his mightiest powers, the lord of men, with arms of thunder, may he, the victor, crush the enemies in the battles.

original: ā na indro haribhir yātv acchārvācīno 'vase rādhase ca /
analyzed: ā naḥ indraḥ haribhiḥ yātu acchā arvācīnaḥ vase rādhase ca
translated: May Indra come to us with his bay horses, from afar, from near, to help and to give gifts.

original: tiṣṭhāti vajrī maghavā virapśīmaṃ yajñam anu no vājasātau //
analyzed: tiṣṭhāti vajrī maghavā virapśī imam yajñam anu naḥ vājasātau
translated: The wielder of the thunderbolt, the bountiful one, the powerful one, may he stand by this sacrifice of ours in the battle for booty.

original: imaṃ yajñaṃ tvam asmākam indra puro dadhat saniṣyasi kratuṃ naḥ /
analyzed: imam yajñam tvam asmākam indra puras dadhat saniṣyasi kratum naḥ
translated: O Indra, you who place this sacrifice of ours in the forefront, you will grant us strength.

original: śvaghnīva vajrin sanaye dhanānāṃ tvayā vayam arya ājiṃ jayema //
analyzed: śvaghnī iva vajrin sanaye dhanānām tvayā vayam aryaḥ ājim jayema
translated: Like a swift mare, O wielder of the thunderbolt, for the winning of riches, through you may we, O noble one, win the prize.

original: uśann u ṣu ṇaḥ sumanā upāke somasya nu suṣutasya svadhāvaḥ /
analyzed: uśan u su naḥ sumanāḥ upāke somasya nu suṣutasya svadhāvas
translated: O you who are eager, well-disposed, and near, O you who are self-existent, of the well-pressed Soma,

original: pā indra pratibhṛtasya madhvaḥ sam andhasā mamadaḥ pṛṣṭhyena //
analyzed: pāḥ indra pratibhṛtasya madhvaḥ sam andhasā mamadaḥ pṛṣṭhyena
translated: O Indra, rejoice in the offered, the poured-out sweetness, with the juice that is to be pressed.

original: vi yo rarapśa ṛṣibhir navebhir vṛkṣo na pakvaḥ sṛṇyo na jetā /
analyzed: vi yaḥ rarapśe ṛṣibhiḥ navebhiḥ vṛkṣaḥ na pakvaḥ sṛṇyaḥ na jetā
translated: He who is praised by the new sages, like a ripe tree, like a victorious plant,

original: maryo na yoṣām abhi manyamāno 'cchā vivakmi puruhūtam indram //
analyzed: maryaḥ na yoṣām abhi manyamānā cha ā vivakmi puruhūtam indram
translated: Like a young man who is in love with a woman, I go forth to invoke the much-invoked Indra.

original: girir na yaḥ svatavāṃ ṛṣva indraḥ sanād eva sahase jāta ugraḥ /
analyzed: giriḥ na yaḥ svatavān ṛṣvaḥ indraḥ sanāt eva sahase jātaḥ ugraḥ
translated: He is a mountain, he who is self-strong, lofty, Indra, from birth mighty for conquest.

original: ādartā vajraṃ sthaviraṃ na bhīma udneva kośaṃ vasunā nyṛṣṭam //
analyzed: ādartā vajram sthaviram na bhīmaḥ udnā iva kośam vasunā nyṛṣṭam
translated: He hath filled the firm, terrible thunderbolt, as a skin with fat, with wealth well-filled.

original: na yasya vartā januṣā nv asti na rādhasa āmarītā maghasya /🔽udvāvṛṣāṇas taviṣīva ugrāsmabhyaṃ daddhi puruhūta rāyaḥ //🔽īkṣe rāyaḥ kṣayasya carṣaṇīnām uta vrajam apavartāsi gonām /
analyzed: na yasya vartā januṣā nu asti na rādhasaḥ āmarītā maghasya  udvāvṛṣāṇaḥ taviṣīvas ugra asmabhyam daddhi puruhūta rāyaḥ  īkṣe rāyaḥ kṣayasya carṣaṇīnām uta vrajam apavartāsi gonām
translated: He who from birth hath no companion, nor hath his bounty any end in time,🔽Sending forth rain, as it were, strong and mighty, give thou us riches, O thou who art invoked by many.🔽I look on the abode of wealth of men, and on the fold of kine thou turnest hither.

original: śikṣānaraḥ samitheṣu prahāvān vasvo rāśim abhinetāsi bhūrim //
analyzed: śikṣā naraḥ samitheṣu prahāvān vasvaḥ rāśim abhinetāsi bhūrim
translated: Train men to battle, O thou of great might, thou leadest to us a great store of riches.

original: kayā tac chṛṇve śacyā śaciṣṭho yayā kṛṇoti muhu kā cid ṛṣvaḥ /
analyzed: kayā tat śṛṇve śacyā śaciṣṭhaḥ yayā kṛṇoti muhu kā cit ṛṣvaḥ
translated: By what, most powerful, do I hear that deed whereby thou dost make some man great and strong?

original: puru dāśuṣe vicayiṣṭho aṃho 'thā dadhāti draviṇaṃ jaritre //
analyzed: puru dāśuṣe vicayiṣṭhaḥ aṃhaḥ thā dadhāti draviṇam jaritre
translated: Most bountiful to the worshipper, thou removest sorrow, and bestowest wealth on the singer.

original: mā no mardhīr ā bharā daddhi tan naḥ pra dāśuṣe dātave bhūri yat te /
analyzed: mā naḥ mardhīḥ ā bhara ā daddhi tat naḥ pra dāśuṣe dātave bhūri yat te
translated: Do not thou perish, bring, bestow that on us, to the worshipper to give, O thou who givest much,

original: navye deṣṇe śaste asmin ta ukthe pra bravāma vayam indra stuvantaḥ //
analyzed: navye deṣṇe śaste asmin te ukthe pra bravāma vayam indra stuvantaḥ
translated: That which is to be given in the new gift, in this hymn that is praised, we will proclaim to thee, O Indra, we who sing thy praise.

original: nū ṣṭuta indra nū gṛṇāna iṣaṃ jaritre nadyo na pīpeḥ /
analyzed: nu stutaḥ indra nu gṛṇānaḥ iṣam jaritre nadyaḥ na pīpeḥ
translated: Now, Indra, praised and lauded, do thou grant food to the singer, as rivers grant (it).

original: akāri te harivo brahma navyaṃ dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ //
analyzed: akāri te harivas brahma navyam dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ
translated: We will be the charioteers who always possess (wealth), O you who possess tawny horses, through our devotion, we have made new prayer to you.

original: ā yātv indro 'vasa upa na iha stutaḥ sadhamād astu śūraḥ /
analyzed: ā yātu indraḥ vase upa naḥ iha stutaḥ sadhamād astu śūraḥ
translated: May Indra come to us for our protection. May the hero be present here, praised in the assembly.

original: vāvṛdhānas taviṣīr yasya pūrvīr dyaur na kṣatram abhibhūti puṣyāt //
analyzed: vāvṛdhānaḥ taviṣīḥ yasya pūrvīḥ dyauḥ na kṣatram abhibhūti puṣyāt
translated: May his great powers, which have increased, be honored like the sky, the sovereignty which surpasses (all).

original: tasyed iha stavatha vṛṣṇyāni tuvidyumnasya tuvirādhaso nṝn /
analyzed: tasya id iha stavatha vṛṣṇyāni tuvi dyumnasya tuvi rādhasaḥ nṝn
translated: Here you must praise his manly powers, of him who has great splendor and great strength, of the men.

original: yasya kratur vidathyo na samrāṭ sāhvān tarutro abhy asti kṛṣṭīḥ //
analyzed: yasya kratuḥ vidathyaḥ na samrāj sāhvān tarutraḥ abhī asti kṛṣṭīḥ
translated: Whose will, like an emperor in the assemblies, the victorious, the protector, approaches the people.

original: ā yātv indro diva ā pṛthivyā makṣū samudrād uta vā purīṣāt /
analyzed: ā yātu indraḥ divaḥ ā pṛthivyāḥ makṣū samudrāt uta vā purīṣāt
translated: May Indra come to us from the sky, from the earth, quickly from the ocean or from the dust.

original: svarṇarād avase no marutvān parāvato vā sadanād ṛtasya //
analyzed: svarṇarāt avase naḥ marutvān parāvataḥ vā sadanāt ṛtasya
translated: From the golden one, with the Maruts, for our help, from the distant abode of truth.

original: sthūrasya rāyo bṛhato ya īśe tam u ṣṭavāma vidatheṣv indram /
analyzed: sthūrasya rāyaḥ bṛhataḥ yaḥ īśe tam u stavāma vidatheṣu indram
translated: We must praise him, Indra, who rules over the great and firm wealth in the assemblies.

original: yo vāyunā jayati gomatīṣu pra dhṛṣṇuyā nayati vasyo accha //
analyzed: yaḥ vāyunā jayati gomatīṣu pra dhṛṣṇuyā nayati vasyaḥ accha
translated: He who conquers with the wind in the cow-rich (regions), leads by his daring to better things.

original: upa yo namo namasi stabhāyann iyarti vācaṃ janayan yajadhyai /
analyzed: upa yaḥ namaḥ namasi stabhāyan iyarti vācam janayan yajadhyai
translated: He who, supporting himself with homage and reverence, moves his voice forward, begetting (it), to worship.

original: ṛñjasānaḥ puruvāra ukthair endraṃ kṛṇvīta sadaneṣu hotā //
analyzed: ṛñjasānaḥ puru vāraḥ ukthaiḥ ā indram kṛṇvīta sadaneṣu hotā
translated: The priest, longing (for favor), with many boons, should make Indra act in the assemblies with hymns.

original: dhiṣā yadi dhiṣaṇyantaḥ saraṇyān sadanto adrim auśijasya gohe /🔽ā duroṣāḥ pāstyasya hotā yo no mahān saṃvaraṇeṣu vahniḥ //
analyzed: dhiṣā yadi dhiṣaṇyantaḥ saraṇyān sadantaḥ adrim auśijasya gohe  ā duroṣāḥ pāstyasya hotā yaḥ naḥ mahān saṃvaraṇeṣu vahniḥ
translated: If, as they who are to be worshipped by the people, the people who sit by the altar, have sat by the stone in the house of Auśija,🔽The irresistible, the priest of Pāṣtya, who is our great fire in the gatherings.

original: satrā yad īm bhārvarasya vṛṣṇaḥ siṣakti śuṣma stuvate bharāya /
analyzed: satrā yat īm bhārvarasya vṛṣṇaḥ siṣakti śuṣma stuvate bharāya
translated: When he, for the sake of the Bharbara's son, the mighty one, flows forth to the praiser for support,

original: guhā yad īm auśijasya gohe pra yad dhiye prāyase madāya //🔽vi yad varāṃsi parvatasya vṛṇve payobhir jinve apāṃ javāṃsi /
analyzed: guhā yat īm auśijasya gohe pra yat dhiye prāyase madāya  vi yat varāṃsi parvatasya vṛṇve payobhiḥ jinve apām javāṃsi
translated: When he, in the house of Auśija, is hidden, when he is urged for the sake of the impulse, for the sake of joy.🔽When I choose the best parts of the mountain, I quicken the swiftnesses of the waters with the juices.

original: vidad gaurasya gavayasya gohe yadī vājāya sudhyo vahanti //
analyzed: vidat gaurasya gavayasya gohe yadī vājāya sudhyaḥ vahanti
translated: When they, for the sake of the bull, the cow, the buffalo, carry (the Soma) for the sake of strength, for the sake of good purification.

original: bhadrā te hastā sukṛtota pāṇī prayantārā stuvate rādha indra /
analyzed: bhadrā te hastā su kṛtā uta pāṇī prayantārā stuvate rādhaḥ indra
translated: Auspicious are thy hands, well-fashioned are thy arms, the supporters, for the praiser, O Indra, for the gift.

original: kā te niṣattiḥ kim u no mamatsi kiṃ nodud u harṣase dātavā u //
analyzed: kā te niṣattiḥ kim u na u mamatsi kim na udud u harṣase dātavai u
translated: What is thy hindrance? What dost thou envy of ours? Why dost thou not rejoice in giving to us?

original: evā vasva indraḥ satyaḥ samrāḍ ḍhantā vṛtraṃ varivaḥ pūrave kaḥ /
analyzed: eva vasvaḥ indraḥ satyaḥ samrāj ḍhantā vṛtram varivaḥ pūrave kaḥ
translated: Thus is Indra, the true universal lord, the possessor of wealth, the breaker of Vṛtra, the bestower of room for Pūru.

original: puruṣṭuta kratvā naḥ śagdhi rāyo bhakṣīya te 'vaso daivyasya //
analyzed: puruṣṭuta kratvā naḥ śagdhi rāyaḥ bhakṣīya te vaso daivyasya
translated: O much-praised one, help us by thy wisdom. May I enjoy thy divine favour.

original: nū ṣṭuta indra nū gṛṇāna iṣaṃ jaritre nadyo na pīpeḥ /
analyzed: nu stutaḥ indra nu gṛṇānaḥ iṣam jaritre nadyaḥ na pīpeḥ
translated: Now, O Indra, praised and lauded, do thou, as the rivers to the ocean, supply food for the singer.

original: akāri te harivo brahma navyaṃ dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ //
analyzed: akāri te harivas brahma navyam dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ
translated: We will be your charioteers, O lord of bays, with our thoughts, if we offer you new praise.

original: yan na indro jujuṣe yac ca vaṣṭi tan no mahān karati śuṣmy ā cit /
analyzed: yat naḥ indraḥ jujuṣe yat ca vaṣṭi tat naḥ mahān karati śuṣmī ā cit
translated: Whatever Indra approves and accepts, that the great one does for us, even if it is difficult.

original: brahma stomam maghavā somam ukthā yo aśmānaṃ śavasā bibhrad eti //
analyzed: brahma stomam maghavā somam ukthā yaḥ aśmānam śavasā bibhrat eti
translated: Maghavan, with his Brahman, praise, Soma, and hymns, he who comes bearing the stone with his strength.

original: vṛṣā vṛṣandhiṃ caturaśrim asyann ugro bāhubhyāṃ nṛtamaḥ śacīvān /
analyzed: vṛṣā vṛṣandhim catur aśrim asyan ugraḥ bāhubhyām nṛtamaḥ śacīvān
translated: The bull, drawing the four-cornered bow, the strong one with his arms, the best of men, the powerful one,

original: śriye paruṣṇīm uṣamāṇa ūrṇāṃ yasyāḥ parvāṇi sakhyāya vivye //
analyzed: śriye paruṣṇīm uṣamāṇaḥ ūrṇām yasyāḥ parvāṇi sakhyāya vivye
translated: shining on the river Parushni, the woolen garment, whose joints he has separated for friendship.

original: yo devo devatamo jāyamāno maho vājebhir mahadbhiś ca śuṣmaiḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ devaḥ devatamaḥ jāyamānaḥ mahaḥ vājebhiḥ mahadbhiḥ ca śuṣmaiḥ
translated: The god, the most divine, being born, with great strength and great powers in the great contest,

original: dadhāno vajram bāhvor uśantaṃ dyām amena rejayat pra bhūma //🔽viśvā rodhāṃsi pravataś ca pūrvīr dyaur ṛṣvāj janiman rejata kṣāḥ /
analyzed: dadhānaḥ vajram bāhvoḥ uśantam dyām amena rejayat pra bhūma  viśvā rodhāṃsi pravataḥ ca pūrvīḥ dyauḥ ṛṣvāt janiman rejata kṣāḥ
translated: holding the burning thunderbolt in his arms, he has made the sky tremble with his might.🔽All the barriers and many ancient paths, the heights have trembled at the birth of the lofty sky.

original: ā mātarā bharati śuṣmy ā gor nṛvat parijman nonuvanta vātāḥ //
analyzed: ā mātarā bharati śuṣmī ā goḥ nṛvat parijman nonuvanta vātāḥ
translated: The strong one supports the two mothers, the cow, the winds have followed him, O you who move among men.

original: tā tū ta indra mahato mahāni viśveṣv it savaneṣu pravācyā /
analyzed: tā tu te indra mahataḥ mahāni viśveṣu id savaneṣu pravācyā
translated: Those great deeds of yours, O Indra, are to be proclaimed at all the Soma feasts,

original: yac chūra dhṛṣṇo dhṛṣatā dadhṛṣvān ahiṃ vajreṇa śavasāviveṣīḥ //
analyzed: yat śūra dhṛṣṇo dhṛṣatā dadhṛṣvān ahim vajreṇa śavasā aviveṣīḥ
translated: O hero, O bold one, when you boldly struck the dragon with your thunderbolt and strength.

original: tā tū te satyā tuvinṛmṇa viśvā pra dhenavaḥ sisrate vṛṣṇa ūdhnaḥ /🔽adhā ha tvad vṛṣamaṇo bhiyānāḥ pra sindhavo javasā cakramanta //
analyzed: tā tu te satyā tuvi nṛmṇa viśvā pra dhenavaḥ sisrate vṛṣṇaḥ ūdhnaḥ  adhā ha tvat vṛṣamaṇaḥ bhiyānāḥ pra sindhavaḥ javasā cakramanta
translated: And these, O thou of true prowess, all thy milch-kine, O Bull, pour forth their milk for thee.🔽And now, through fear of thee, O mighty one, the rivers flow with rapid current.

original: atrāha te harivas tā u devīr avobhir indra stavanta svasāraḥ /
analyzed: atra aha te harivas tāḥ u devīḥ avobhiḥ indra stavanta svasāraḥ
translated: Here, O thou of tawny steeds, the Goddesses, thy sisters, O Indra, with their voices praise thee,

original: yat sīm anu pra muco badbadhānā dīrghām anu prasitiṃ syandayadhyai //🔽pipīḷe aṃśur madyo na sindhur ā tvā śamī śaśamānasya śaktiḥ /
analyzed: yat sīm anu pra mucaḥ badbadhānāḥ dīrghām anu prasitim syanda yadhyai  pipīḍe aṃśuḥ madyaḥ na sindhuḥ ā tvā śamī śaśamānasya śaktiḥ
translated: When, after thy loose reins, they are to be guided along the long path of thy rapid course.🔽The stalk is pressed like a stream of strong drink: the prayer of him who strives to win thee is effectual.🔽The flame of him who is to be pitied by the two young maidens shines forth for us.

original: asmadryak chuśucānasya yamyā āśur na raśmiṃ tuvyojasaṃ goḥ //🔽asme varṣiṣṭhā kṛṇuhi jyeṣṭhā nṛmṇāni satrā sahure sahāṃsi /
analyzed: asmadryak śuśucānasya yamyāḥ āśuḥ na raśmim tuvi ojasam goḥ  asme varṣiṣṭhā kṛṇuhi jyeṣṭhā nṛmṇāni satrā sahure sahāṃsi
translated: The swift one, like the rein of a cow, is to be drawn violently.🔽Make us the most prosperous, the most powerful, the most manly, the most victorious, O mighty one, for ever.

original: asmabhyaṃ vṛtrā suhanāni randhi jahi vadhar vanuṣo martyasya //
analyzed: asmabhyam vṛtrā su hanāni randhi jahi vadhar vanuṣaḥ martyasya
translated: Give us the means of overcoming foes: destroy the weapon of the man who injures us.

original: asmākam it su śṛṇuhi tvam indrāsmabhyaṃ citrāṃ upa māhi vājān /
analyzed: asmākam id su śṛṇuhi tvam indra asmabhyam citrān upa māhi vājān
translated: Listen to us, O Indra, listen to our songs: give us, O Indra, various kinds of strength.

original: asmabhyaṃ viśvā iṣaṇaḥ purandhīr asmākaṃ su maghavan bodhi godāḥ //
analyzed: asmabhyam viśvāḥ iṣaṇaḥ purandhīḥ asmākam su maghavan bodhi go dāḥ
translated: Give us all kinds of food, O thou of great wisdom: be thou, O bountiful one, the giver of cattle to us.

original: nū ṣṭuta indra nū gṛṇāna iṣaṃ jaritre nadyo na pīpeḥ /
analyzed: nu stutaḥ indra nu gṛṇānaḥ iṣam jaritre nadyaḥ na pīpeḥ
translated: Now, Indra, praised and glorified, give food to the singer, as the streams give water.

original: akāri te harivo brahma navyaṃ dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ //
analyzed: akāri te harivas brahma navyam dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ
translated: We will be, O Lord of bays, your charioteers, ever-victorious, with our thoughts, with our prayers.

original: kathā mahām avṛdhat kasya hotur yajñaṃ juṣāṇo abhi somam ūdhaḥ /
analyzed: kathā mahām avṛdhat kasya hotuḥ yajñam juṣāṇaḥ abhi somam ūdhaḥ
translated: How did he grow great? Whose Hotar did he favour, the Soma-bearer, the sacrifice?

original: pibann uśāno juṣamāṇo andho vavakṣa ṛṣvaḥ śucate dhanāya //🔽ko asya vīraḥ sadhamādam āpa sam ānaṃśa sumatibhiḥ ko asya /
analyzed: piban uśānaḥ juṣamāṇaḥ andhaḥ vavakṣa ṛṣvaḥ śucate dhanāya  kaḥ asya vīraḥ sadhamādam āpa sam ānaṃśa sumatibhiḥ kaḥ asya
translated: Drinking, rejoicing, delighted, the swift one has grown for glory and wealth.🔽Who is his hero who has attained his feast? Who has shared his favour with his good thoughts?

original: kad asya citraṃ cikite kad ūtī vṛdhe bhuvac chaśamānasya yajyoḥ //
analyzed: kad asya citram cikite kad ūtī vṛdhe bhuvat śaśamānasya yajyoḥ
translated: Who has seen his wondrous help? Who has prospered, the worshipper who strives?

original: kathā śṛṇoti hūyamānam indraḥ kathā śṛṇvann avasām asya veda /🔽kā asya pūrvīr upamātayo ha kathainam āhuḥ papuriṃ jaritre //
analyzed: kathā śṛṇoti hūyamānam indraḥ kathā śṛṇvan avasām asya veda  kāḥ asya pūrvīḥ upamātayaḥ ha kathā enam āhuḥ papurim jaritre
translated: How does Indra hear when he is called? How, hearing, does he know his worshipper?🔽What are his many ancient ways? How do they call him the bountiful one to the singer?

original: kathā sabādhaḥ śaśamāno asya naśad abhi draviṇaṃ dīdhyānaḥ /
analyzed: kathā sabādhaḥ śaśamānaḥ asya naśat abhi draviṇam dīdhyānaḥ
translated: How, striving, seeking, thinking of his wealth, will he obtain his favour?

original: devo bhuvan navedā ma ṛtānāṃ namo jagṛbhvāṃ abhi yaj jujoṣat //
analyzed: devaḥ bhuvat navedāḥ me ṛtānām namaḥ jagṛbhvām abhi yat jujoṣat
translated: He has become a god, knowing the truths. He has grasped the homage which he approves.

original: kathā kad asyā uṣaso vyuṣṭau devo martasya sakhyaṃ jujoṣa /
analyzed: kathā kad asyāḥ uṣasaḥ vyuṣṭau devaḥ martasya sakhyam jujoṣa
translated: How at the rising of this dawn does the god approve the friendship of the mortal?

original: kathā kad asya sakhyaṃ sakhibhyo ye asmin kāmaṃ suyujaṃ tatasre //
analyzed: kathā kad asya sakhyam sakhibhyaḥ ye asmin kāmam su yujam tatasre
translated: How does he approve his friendship with his friends who have bestowed on him their well-yoked desire?

original: kim ād amatraṃ sakhyaṃ sakhibhyaḥ kadā nu te bhrātram pra bravāma /
analyzed: kim āt amatram sakhyam sakhibhyaḥ kadā nu te bhrātram pra bravāma
translated: What is the measureless friendship, O friend, that we may proclaim to our friends? When will we proclaim your brotherhood?

original: śriye sudṛśo vapur asya sargāḥ svar ṇa citratamam iṣa ā goḥ //🔽druhaṃ jighāṃsan dhvarasam anindrāṃ tetikte tigmā tujase anīkā /
analyzed: śriye sudṛśaḥ vapuḥ asya sargāḥ svar na citratamam iṣaḥ ā goḥ  druham jighāṃsan dhvarasam an indrām tetikte tigmā tujase anīkā
translated: For glory, his well-seen form, his creations, his food is most wonderfully variegated like gold.🔽Desiring to kill the wicked, the powerless, he sharpened his fierce forms against the indistinct.

original: ṛṇā cid yatra ṛṇayā na ugro dūre ajñātā uṣaso babādhe //
analyzed: ṛṇā cit yatra ṛṇayāḥ naḥ ugraḥ dūre ajñātāḥ uṣasaḥ babādhe
translated: Where the fierce one, with debt, with interest, far away, unknown, destroyed the dawns.

original: ṛtasya hi śurudhaḥ santi pūrvīr ṛtasya dhītir vṛjināni hanti /
analyzed: ṛtasya hi śurudhaḥ santi pūrvīḥ ṛtasya dhītiḥ vṛjināni hanti
translated: For the truths have many ancient treasures; the thought of truth destroys the wicked.

original: ṛtasya śloko badhirā tatarda karṇā budhānaḥ śucamāna āyoḥ //
analyzed: ṛtasya ślokaḥ badhirā tatarda karṇā budhānaḥ śucamānaḥ āyoḥ
translated: The verse of truth pierced the deaf; the wise one, purifying, opened the ears of the living.

original: ṛtasya dṛḷhā dharuṇāni santi purūṇi candrā vapuṣe vapūṃṣi /🔽ṛtena dīrgham iṣaṇanta pṛkṣa ṛtena gāva ṛtam ā viveśuḥ //
analyzed: ṛtasya dṛḍhā dharuṇāni santi purūṇi candrā vapuṣe vapūṃṣi  ṛtena dīrgham iṣaṇanta pṛkṣaḥ ṛtena gāvaḥ ṛtam ā viveśuḥ
translated: The firm supports of truth are many; the forms for beauty have many bright forms.🔽By truth they extend the food far away; by truth the cows have entered the truth.

original: ṛtaṃ yemāna ṛtam id vanoty ṛtasya śuṣmas turayā u gavyuḥ /🔽ṛtāya pṛthvī bahule gabhīre ṛtāya dhenū parame duhāte //
analyzed: ṛtam yemānaḥ ṛtam id vanoti ṛtasya śuṣmaḥ tura yāḥ u gavyuḥ  ṛtāya pṛthvī bahule gabhīre ṛtāya dhenū parame duhāte
translated: Truth supports; truth indeed nourishes; the strength of truth is swift and wins the cattle.🔽For truth, the vast, deep earth; for truth the two supreme milch-cows yield milk.

original: nū ṣṭuta indra nū gṛṇāna iṣaṃ jaritre nadyo na pīpeḥ /
analyzed: nu stutaḥ indra nu gṛṇānaḥ iṣam jaritre nadyaḥ na pīpeḥ
translated: Now praise Indra, now sing, as a singer you must provide food for the singer, as rivers provide water.

original: akāri te harivo brahma navyaṃ dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ //
analyzed: akāri te harivas brahma navyam dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ
translated: We will be, O Lord of bays, your constant charioteers, if we bring you new prayer.

original: kā suṣṭutiḥ śavasaḥ sūnum indram arvācīnaṃ rādhasa ā vavartat /
analyzed: kā suṣṭutiḥ śavasaḥ sūnum indram arvācīnam rādhasaḥ ā vavartat
translated: What is the best praise for Indra, the Son of Strength, to turn him to us with his bounty?

original: dadir hi vīro gṛṇate vasūni sa gopatir niṣṣidhāṃ no janāsaḥ //
analyzed: dadiḥ hi vīraḥ gṛṇate vasūni sa go patiḥ niṣṣidhām naḥ janāsaḥ
translated: For the hero gives treasures to the singer; he, the lord of the cows, is our protector from the people.

original: sa vṛtrahatye havyaḥ sa īḍyaḥ sa suṣṭuta indraḥ satyarādhāḥ /
analyzed: sa vṛtra hatye havyaḥ saḥ īḍyaḥ sa suṣṭutaḥ indraḥ satya rādhāḥ
translated: He is to be offered to in the slaying of Vrtra, he is to be praised, that Indra whose gifts are true.

original: sa yāmann ā maghavā martyāya brahmaṇyate suṣvaye varivo dhāt //🔽tam in naro vi hvayante samīke ririkvāṃsas tanvaḥ kṛṇvata trām /🔽mitho yat tyāgam ubhayāso agman naras tokasya tanayasya sātau //
analyzed: sa yāman ā maghavā martyāya brahmaṇyate suṣvaye varivaḥ dhāt  tam id naraḥ vi hvayante samīke ririkvāṃsaḥ tanvaḥ kṛṇvata trām  mithas yat tyāgam ubhayāsaḥ agman naraḥ tokasya tanayasya sātau
translated: May the bountiful one grant protection to the mortal who worships with prayer and good cheer on his way.🔽The men call him forth in the battle, trembling for their bodies, making him their protector.🔽When they have come together from different quarters, the men, for the sake of offspring and progeny.

original: kratūyanti kṣitayo yoga ugrāśuṣāṇāso mitho arṇasātau /🔽saṃ yad viśo 'vavṛtranta yudhmā ād in nema indrayante abhīke //
analyzed: kratūyanti kṣitayaḥ yoge ugra āśuṣāṇāsaḥ mithas arṇa sātau  sam yat viśaḥ vavṛtranta yudhmāḥ āt id neme indrayante abhīke
translated: The plans of the strong ones are hastened, the fierce ones, in the mutual struggle for water.🔽When the warlike people have gathered together, then they strive for Indra's favor in the battle.

original: ād id dha nema indriyaṃ yajanta ād it paktiḥ puroḷāśaṃ riricyāt /
analyzed: āt id ha neme indriyam yajante āt id paktiḥ puroḷāśam riricyāt
translated: They worship Indra's power, then the cake offering should be spread out.

original: ād it somo vi papṛcyād asuṣvīn ād ij jujoṣa vṛṣabhaṃ yajadhyai //
analyzed: āt id somaḥ vi papṛcyāt a suṣvīn āt id jujoṣa vṛṣabham yajadhyai
translated: Then Soma should be pressed for the sluggish ones, then he delights in sacrificing to the bull.

original: kṛṇoty asmai varivo ya itthendrāya somam uśate sunoti /
analyzed: kṛṇoti asmai varivaḥ yaḥ itthā indrāya somam uśate sunoti
translated: He who presses Soma for Indra, who delights in it, makes room for him.

original: sadhrīcīnena manasāvivenan tam it sakhāyaṃ kṛṇute samatsu //🔽ya indrāya sunavat somam adya pacāt paktīr uta bhṛjjāti dhānāḥ /
analyzed: sadhrīcīnena manasā a vivenan tam id sakhāyam kṛṇute samatsu  yaḥ indrāya sunavat somam adya pacāt paktīḥ uta bhṛjjāti dhānāḥ
translated: With a mind inclined to concord he makes him a friend in battles.🔽He who today presses Soma for Indra, cooks the food, and roasts the grains,

original: prati manāyor ucathāni haryan tasmin dadhad vṛṣaṇaṃ śuṣmam indraḥ //
analyzed: prati manāyoḥ ucathāni haryan tasmin dadhat vṛṣaṇam śuṣmam indraḥ
translated: rejoicing in the words of the two who are attentive, Indra places strength and power in him.

original: yadā samaryaṃ vy aced ṛghāvā dīrghaṃ yad ājim abhy akhyad aryaḥ /
analyzed: yadā samaryam vi acet ṛghāvā dīrgham yat ājim abhī akhyat aryaḥ
translated: When the two adversaries have divided the battle, when the enemy has attacked the long-lasting battle,

original: acikradad vṛṣaṇam patny acchā duroṇa ā niśitaṃ somasudbhiḥ //🔽bhūyasā vasnam acarat kanīyo 'vikrīto akāniṣam punar yan /
analyzed: acikradat vṛṣaṇam patnī acchā duroṇe ā niśitam soma sudbhiḥ  bhūyasā vasnam acarat kanīyaḥ vikrītaḥ akāniṣam punar yan
translated: the wife has called out to the powerful one, the Soma-pressers have sharpened the weapon in the house.🔽The smaller has gone away with more, when I have not sold it, not bought it back.

original: sa bhūyasā kanīyo nārirecīd dīnā dakṣā vi duhanti pra vāṇam //
analyzed: sa bhūyasā kanīyaḥ nā arirecīt dīnāḥ dakṣāḥ vi duhanti pra vāṇam
translated: The smaller has gone away with more than the larger, the poor skillful ones milk the arrow.

original: ka imaṃ daśabhir mamendraṃ krīṇāti dhenubhiḥ /
analyzed: kaḥ imam daśabhiḥ mama indram krīṇāti dhenubhiḥ
translated: Who will buy this Indra of mine for ten milch cows?

original: yadā vṛtrāṇi jaṅghanad athainam me punar dadat //
analyzed: yadā vṛtrāṇi jaṅghanat atha enam me punar dadat
translated: When he has smashed the enemies, then will he give him back to me.

original: nū ṣṭuta indra nū gṛṇāna iṣaṃ jaritre nadyo na pīpeḥ /
analyzed: nu stutaḥ indra nu gṛṇānaḥ iṣam jaritre nadyaḥ na pīpeḥ
translated: Now, Indra, praised and extolled, do thou grant food to the singer, as the rivers give water.

original: akāri te harivo brahma navyaṃ dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ //
analyzed: akāri te harivas brahma navyam dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ
translated: We will be, O Lord of bays, with our thought, constant worshippers of thee, who hast done this new deed for us.

original: ko adya naryo devakāma uśann indrasya sakhyaṃ jujoṣa /
analyzed: kaḥ adya naryaḥ deva kāmaḥ uśan indrasya sakhyam jujoṣa
translated: What man to-day, longing, devoted to the Gods, is willing to accept the friendship of Indra?

original: ko vā mahe 'vase pāryāya samiddhe agnau sutasoma īṭṭe //
analyzed: kaḥ vā mahe vase pāryāya samiddhe agnau suta somaḥ īṭṭe
translated: Who, in the kindled fire, in the well-offered sacrifice, will invite him to the great help, to the final goal?

original: ko nānāma vacasā somyāya manāyur vā bhavati vasta usrāḥ /
analyzed: kaḥ nānāma vacasā somyāya manāyuḥ vā bhavati vaste usrāḥ
translated: Who will choose for himself the Soma-worthy one with his speech, who will have a long life, and wealth, and sons?

original: ka indrasya yujyaṃ kaḥ sakhitvaṃ ko bhrātraṃ vaṣṭi kavaye ka ūtī //
analyzed: kaḥ indrasya yujyam kaḥ sakhi tvam kaḥ bhrātram vaṣṭi kavaye kaḥ ūtī
translated: Who will choose the union with Indra, the friendship, the brotherhood with the wise one, who will choose the help?

original: ko devānām avo adyā vṛṇīte ka ādityāṃ aditiṃ jyotir īṭṭe /
analyzed: kaḥ devānām avaḥ adyā vṛṇīte kaḥ ādityām aditim jyotiḥ īṭṭe
translated: Who to-day chooses the favour of the Gods? Who invites Aditi, the light of the Âdityas?

original: kasyāśvināv indro agniḥ sutasyāṃśoḥ pibanti manasāvivenam //
analyzed: kasya aśvinau indraḥ agniḥ sutasya aṃśoḥ pibanti manasā a vivenam
translated: For whom do the two Aṣvins, Indra, Agni drink the portion of the pressed Soma with their mind?

original: tasmā agnir bhārataḥ śarma yaṃsaj jyok paśyāt sūryam uccarantam /
analyzed: tasmai agniḥ bhārataḥ śarma yaṃsat jyok paśyāt sūryam uccarantam
translated: To him may Agni, the protector, grant protection, may he long see the rising sun.

original: ya indrāya sunavāmety āha nare naryāya nṛtamāya nṛṇām //
analyzed: yaḥ indrāya sunavāma iti āha nare naryāya nṛtamāya nṛṇām
translated: He who says, 'Let us press for Indra,' to the man, the manly one, the most manly of men,

original: na taṃ jinanti bahavo na dabhrā urv asmā aditiḥ śarma yaṃsat /
analyzed: na tam jinanti bahavaḥ na dabhrāḥ uru asmai aditiḥ śarma yaṃsat
translated: Him the many do not conquer, nor the violent ones. May Aditi grant him wide protection.

original: priyaḥ sukṛt priya indre manāyuḥ priyaḥ suprāvīḥ priyo asya somī //
analyzed: priyaḥ su kṛt priyaḥ indre manāyuḥ priyaḥ su prāvīḥ priyaḥ asya somī
translated: Dear is the good worker, dear to Indra is the long-lived one, dear is the well-sacrificed one, dear is he who has Soma.

original: suprāvyaḥ prāśuṣāḷ eṣa vīraḥ suṣveḥ paktiṃ kṛṇute kevalendraḥ /🔽nāsuṣver āpir na sakhā na jāmir duṣprāvyo 'vahanted avācaḥ //
analyzed: suprāvyaḥ prāśuṣāh eṣa vīraḥ suṣveḥ paktim kṛṇute kevala indraḥ  na a suṣveḥ āpiḥ na sakhā na jāmiḥ duṣprāvyaḥ vahanta id avācaḥ
translated: This hero, well-praised, is to be praised by the good presser; Indra alone makes the good presser's food.🔽The bad presser's friend or kinsman is not to be praised; the ill-praised one should not be served with food.

original: na revatā paṇinā sakhyam indro 'sunvatā sutapāḥ saṃ gṛṇīte /
analyzed: na revatā paṇinā sakhyam indraḥ sunvatā suta pāḥ sam gṛṇīte
translated: Indra does not praise the bountiful one with the niggard, the good drinker with the non-drinker.

original: āsya vedaḥ khidati hanti nagnaṃ vi suṣvaye paktaye kevalo bhūt //
analyzed: ā asya vedaḥ khidati hanti nagnam vi suṣvaye paktaye kevalaḥ bhūt
translated: His knowledge is destroyed; he destroys the naked one. He alone becomes the good presser's food.

original: indram pare 'vare madhyamāsa indraṃ yānto 'vasitāsa indram /
analyzed: indram pare vare madhyamāsaḥ indram yāntaḥ vasitāsaḥ indram
translated: The higher, the lower, and the middle ones, the ones who have gone and the ones who have settled, and Indra,

original: indraṃ kṣiyanta uta yudhyamānā indraṃ naro vājayanto havante //
analyzed: indram kṣiyantaḥ uta yudhyamānāḥ indram naraḥ vājayantaḥ havante
translated: the ones who live and the ones who fight, the men who strive for strength call upon Indra.

original: aham manur abhavaṃ sūryaś cāhaṃ kakṣīvāṃ ṛṣir asmi vipraḥ /
analyzed: aham manuḥ abhavam sūryaḥ ca aham kakṣīvān ṛṣiḥ asmi vipraḥ
translated: I was Manu, and I was Surya, I am Kakshivan, the seer, the priest.

original: ahaṃ kutsam ārjuneyaṃ ny ṛñje 'haṃ kavir uśanā paśyatā mā //
analyzed: aham kutsam ārjuneyam ni ṛñje ham kaviḥ uśanā paśyata mā
translated: I delighted Kutsa and Arjuneya; I am the wise one, Ushanâ; look upon me.

original: aham bhūmim adadām āryāyāhaṃ vṛṣṭiṃ dāśuṣe martyāya /
analyzed: aham bhūmim adadām āryāya aham vṛṣṭim dāśuṣe martyāya
translated: I gave the noble one the earth; I gave rain to the mortal worshipper.

original: aham apo anayaṃ vāvaśānā mama devāso anu ketam āyan //
analyzed: aham apaḥ anayam vāvaśānāḥ mama devāsaḥ anu ketam āyan
translated: I brought the waters, lowing to me; the gods came after my banner.

original: aham puro mandasāno vy airaṃ nava sākaṃ navatīḥ śambarasya /
analyzed: aham puraḥ mandasānaḥ vi airam nava sākam navatīḥ śambarasya
translated: I went forth, rejoicing, to the nine forts of Shambara, and to the nine times nine.

original: śatatamaṃ veśyaṃ sarvatātā divodāsam atithigvaṃ yad āvam //
analyzed: śatatamam veśyam sarvatātā divodāsam atithigvam yat āvam
translated: The hundredth, the most excellent, of all the Tatas of heaven, Divodasa, Atithigva, whom we invoke.

original: pra su ṣa vibhyo maruto vir astu pra śyenaḥ śyenebhya āśupatvā /
analyzed: pra su sa vibhyaḥ marutaḥ viḥ astu pra śyenaḥ śyenebhyaḥ āśu patvā
translated: Let the bird fly forth from the birds, O Maruts, let the falcon fly swiftly from the falcons.

original: acakrayā yat svadhayā suparṇo havyam bharan manave devajuṣṭam //
analyzed: acakrayā yat svadhayā suparṇaḥ havyam bharat manave deva juṣṭam
translated: When the bird, with his own inherent power, not made with wheels, carried the oblation to Manu, dear to the gods.

original: bharad yadi vir ato vevijānaḥ pathoruṇā manojavā asarji /
analyzed: bharat yadi viḥ atas vevijānaḥ pathā uruṇā manaḥ javāḥ asarji
translated: If he, the swift one, carried it from here, he was sent forth on the two wide paths, swift as thought.

original: tūyaṃ yayau madhunā somyenota śravo vivide śyeno atra //
analyzed: tūyam yayau madhunā somyena uta śravaḥ vivide śyenaḥ atra
translated: He went quickly with the sweet Soma juice. Here the falcon found fame.

original: ṛjīpī śyeno dadamāno aṃśum parāvataḥ śakuno mandram madam /
analyzed: ṛjīpī śyenaḥ dadamānaḥ aṃśum parāvataḥ śakunaḥ mandram madam
translated: The strong falcon, giving the stalk, the bird from afar, the pleasant intoxication,

original: somam bharad dādṛhāṇo devāvān divo amuṣmād uttarād ādāya //
analyzed: somam bharat dādṛhāṇaḥ devāvān divaḥ amuṣmāt uttarāt ādāya
translated: carrying the Soma, firm, devoted to the gods, taking it from yonder highest heaven.

original: ādāya śyeno abharat somaṃ sahasraṃ savāṃ ayutaṃ ca sākam /
analyzed: ādāya śyenaḥ abharat somam sahasram savām ayutam ca sākam
translated: The falcon took and brought the Soma, a thousand and ten thousand together.

original: atrā purandhir ajahād arātīr made somasya mūrā amūraḥ //
analyzed: atrā purandhiḥ ajahāt arātīḥ made somasya mūrāḥ a mūraḥ
translated: Here Purandhi left his hostilities, the wise one, the unwise one, in the intoxication of Soma.

original: garbhe nu sann anv eṣām avedam ahaṃ devānāṃ janimāni viśvā /
analyzed: garbhe nu san anu eṣām avedam aham devānām janimāni viśvā
translated: Even while in the womb I knew the universal generations of the gods.

original: śatam mā pura āyasīr arakṣann adha śyeno javasā nir adīyam //
analyzed: śatam mā puraḥ āyasīḥ arakṣan adha śyenaḥ javasā niḥ adīyam
translated: A hundred iron walls protected me. Then the falcon carried me away with his speed.

original: na ghā sa mām apa joṣaṃ jabhārābhīm āsa tvakṣasā vīryeṇa /🔽īrmā purandhir ajahād arātīr uta vātāṃ atarac chūśuvānaḥ //
analyzed: na ghā sa mām apa joṣam jabhāra abhi īm āsa tvakṣasā vīryeṇa  īrmā purandhiḥ ajahāt arātīḥ uta vātām atarat śūśuvānaḥ
translated: He did not hold me back who was eager to go, he was near me with his strength and manly power.🔽Purandhi, the slow one, left the wicked ones, and, shining, he passed through the winds.

original: ava yac chyeno asvanīd adha dyor vi yad yadi vāta ūhuḥ purandhim /
analyzed: ava yat śyenaḥ asvanīt adha dyoḥ vi yat yadi vā atas ūhuḥ purandhim
translated: When the eagle flew down from the sky, when the wind carried Purandhi away,

original: sṛjad yad asmā ava ha kṣipaj jyāṃ kṛśānur astā manasā bhuraṇyan //
analyzed: sṛjat yat asmai ava ha kṣipat jyām kṛśānuḥ astā manasā bhuraṇyan
translated: when the swift one, with his mind restless, let go the string and shot it at him,

original: ṛjipya īm indrāvato na bhujyuṃ śyeno jabhāra bṛhato adhi ṣṇoḥ /🔽antaḥ patat patatry asya parṇam adha yāmani prasitasya tad veḥ //
analyzed: ṛjipyaḥ īm indrāvataḥ na bhujyum śyenaḥ jabhāra bṛhataḥ adhi snoḥ  antar patat patatri asya parṇam adha yāmani prasitasya tat veḥ
translated: the eagle carried off the swift one, who belonged to Indra, from the lofty peak.🔽The bird's wing fell down in his mouth, that was caught in the net, while flying.

original: adha śvetaṃ kalaśaṃ gobhir aktam āpipyānam maghavā śukram andhaḥ /
analyzed: adha śvetam kalaśam gobhiḥ aktam āpipyānam maghavā śukram andhaḥ
translated: Now the bountiful one, with the cows, has filled the white pot, the pure one, the bright one.

original: adhvaryubhiḥ prayatam madhvo agram indro madāya prati dhat pibadhyai śūro madāya prati dhat pibadhyai //
analyzed: adhvaryubhiḥ prayatam madhvaḥ agram indraḥ madāya prati dhat pibadhyai śūraḥ madāya prati dhat pibadhyai
translated: The Adhvaryus have brought the first portion of the sweet drink. Indra, for his joy, let it be placed for him to drink. The hero, for his joy, let it be placed for him to drink.

original: tvā yujā tava tat soma sakhya indro apo manave sasrutas kaḥ /
analyzed: tvā yujā tava tat soma sakhye indraḥ apaḥ manave sasrutaḥ kaḥ
translated: O Soma, that is yours, your friend Indra, for the sake of Manu, has released the waters.

original: ahann ahim ariṇāt sapta sindhūn apāvṛṇod apihiteva khāni //
analyzed: ahan ahim ariṇāt sapta sindhūn apāvṛṇot apihitā iva khāni
translated: He has slain the dragon, has freed the seven rivers, has opened up the closed-up openings.

original: tvā yujā ni khidat sūryasyendraś cakraṃ sahasā sadya indo /
analyzed: tvā yujā ni khidat sūryasya indraḥ cakram sahasā sadyas indo
translated: Indra and Soma, with thee for their ally, have suddenly hurled down the wheel of Sûrya.

original: adhi ṣṇunā bṛhatā vartamānam maho druho apa viśvāyu dhāyi //
analyzed: adhi snunā bṛhatā vartamānam mahaḥ druhaḥ apa viśva āyu dhāyi
translated: Thou, O thou of the lofty car, hast, while moving, protected the great world from the wicked.

original: ahann indro adahad agnir indo purā dasyūn madhyandinād abhīke /
analyzed: ahan indraḥ adahat agniḥ indo purā dasyūn madhyandināt abhīke
translated: Indra hath slain, Soma hath burned the Dasyus before midday in the fight.

original: durge duroṇe kratvā na yātām purū sahasrā śarvā ni barhīt //
analyzed: durge duroṇe kratvā na yātām purū sahasrā śarvā ni barhīt
translated: By wisdom ye have not gone to the hard-to-reach house: with thy bolt thou hast heaped up many thousands.

original: viśvasmāt sīm adhamāṃ indra dasyūn viśo dāsīr akṛṇor apraśastāḥ /
analyzed: viśvasmāt sīm adhamān indra dasyūn viśaḥ dāsīḥ akṛṇoḥ apraśastāḥ
translated: O Indra, thou hast cast down all the Dasyus, the despised tribes of slaves.

original: abādhethām amṛṇataṃ ni śatrūn avindethām apacitiṃ vadhatraiḥ //
analyzed: abādhethām amṛṇatam ni śatrūn avindethām apacitim vadhatraiḥ
translated: Ye have afflicted, ye have slain the foes: ye have found the means of slaying with your weapons.

original: evā satyam maghavānā yuvaṃ tad indraś ca somorvam aśvyaṃ goḥ /
analyzed: eva satyam maghavānā yuvam tat indraḥ ca soma ūrvam aśvyam goḥ
translated: This is the truth, O ye bountiful, ye two, Indra and Soma, have obtained the horse and the cow.

original: ādardṛtam apihitāny aśnā riricathuḥ kṣāś cit tatṛdānā //🔽ā na stuta upa vājebhir ūtī indra yāhi haribhir mandasānaḥ /
analyzed: ādardṛtam apihitāni aśnā riricathuḥ kṣāḥ cit tatṛdānā  ā naḥ stutaḥ upa vājebhiḥ ūtī indra yāhi haribhiḥ mandasānaḥ
translated: Ye have burst open the closed food: ye have filled the regions, and have satisfied the people.🔽Come hither, praised with songs, O Indra, with thy Bay Steeds, rejoicing, to the feast.

original: tiraś cid aryaḥ savanā purūṇy āṅgūṣebhir gṛṇānaḥ satyarādhāḥ //
analyzed: tiras cit aryaḥ savanā purūṇi āṅgūṣebhiḥ gṛṇānaḥ satya rādhāḥ
translated: Thou hast passed by many a foeman's offerings, praised with our hymns, O thou who grantest boons.

original: ā hi ṣmā yāti naryaś cikitvān hūyamānaḥ sotṛbhir upa yajñam /
analyzed: ā hi sma yāti naryaḥ cikitvān hūyamānaḥ sotṛbhiḥ upa yajñam
translated: Hither comes the man who knows, invited, to the sacrifice, urged on by the pressers.

original: svaśvo yo abhīrur manyamānaḥ suṣvāṇebhir madati saṃ ha vīraiḥ //
analyzed: su aśvaḥ yaḥ abhīruḥ manyamānaḥ suṣvāṇebhiḥ madati sam ha vīraiḥ
translated: He who has good horses, who is fearless, rejoices with his good sons and his heroes.

original: śrāvayed asya karṇā vājayadhyai juṣṭām anu pra diśam mandayadhyai /
analyzed: śrāvayet asya karṇā vājayadhyai juṣṭām anu pra diśam mandayadhyai
translated: He should make his ears hear for the sake of victory, and make him joyful according to the desired direction.

original: udvāvṛṣāṇo rādhase tuviṣmān karan na indraḥ sutīrthābhayaṃ ca //
analyzed: udvāvṛṣāṇaḥ rādhase tuviṣmān karat naḥ indraḥ su tīrthā abhayam ca
translated: Pouring out, powerful for the sake of generosity, Indra makes for us good fords and safety.

original: acchā yo gantā nādhamānam ūtī itthā vipraṃ havamānaṃ gṛṇantam /
analyzed: acchā yaḥ gantā nādhamānam ūtī itthā vipram havamānam gṛṇantam
translated: He who will come to the one who worships, here to the praising sage who calls,

original: upa tmani dadhāno dhury āśūn sahasrāṇi śatāni vajrabāhuḥ //
analyzed: upa tmani dadhānaḥ dhuri āśūn sahasrāṇi śatāni vajra bāhuḥ
translated: Bearing the swift horses in his own self, with a hundred arms like thunderbolts.

original: tvotāso maghavann indra viprā vayaṃ te syāma sūrayo gṛṇantaḥ /
analyzed: tvotāsaḥ maghavan indra viprāḥ vayam te syāma sūrayaḥ gṛṇantaḥ
translated: We, O Indra, the wealthy, O bountiful one, are your priests, O Maghavan, praising you.

original: bhejānāso bṛhaddivasya rāya ākāyyasya dāvane purukṣoḥ //
analyzed: bhejānāsaḥ bṛhat divasya rāyaḥ ākāyyasya dāvane purukṣoḥ
translated: Having obtained the wealth of the great-minded one, the giver of what is to be desired, O you of much food.

original: nakir indra tvad uttaro na jyāyāṃ asti vṛtrahan /
analyzed: nakir indra tvat uttaraḥ na jyāyām asti vṛtrahan
translated: There is none, O Indra, higher than you, O Vrtra-killer, there is none greater.

original: nakir evā yathā tvam //
analyzed: nakir evā yathā tvam
translated: There is none, indeed, like you.

original: satrā te anu kṛṣṭayo viśvā cakreva vāvṛtuḥ /
analyzed: satrā te anu kṛṣṭayaḥ viśvā cakrā iva vāvṛtuḥ
translated: All the peoples have turned to you, as if to a wheel, in every season.

original: satrā mahāṃ asi śrutaḥ //
analyzed: satrā mahān asi śrutaḥ
translated: You are always great, O renowned one.

original: viśve caned anā tvā devāsa indra yuyudhuḥ /
analyzed: viśve cana id anā tvā devāsaḥ indra yuyudhuḥ
translated: All the gods, indeed, O Indra, have fought with you,

original: yad ahā naktam ātiraḥ //
analyzed: yat ahā naktam ātiraḥ
translated: When you stretched out at night.

original: yatrota bādhitebhyaś cakraṃ kutsāya yudhyate /
analyzed: yatra uta bādhitebhyaḥ cakram kutsāya yudhyate
translated: Where the wheel of Kutsa is set in motion for the oppressed, for the sake of battle,

original: muṣāya indra sūryam //
analyzed: muṣāya indra sūryam
translated: O Indra, thou hast stolen the sun.

original: yatra devāṃ ṛghāyato viśvāṃ ayudhya eka it /
analyzed: yatra devān ṛghāyataḥ viśvān ayudhyaḥ ekaḥ id
translated: Where thou, alone, O Indra, hast fought with the impetuous gods, all the (other) gods,

original: tvam indra vanūṃr ahan //
analyzed: tvam indra vanūn ahan
translated: There thou, O Indra, hast slain the Vanūs.

original: yatrota martyāya kam ariṇā indra sūryam /
analyzed: yatra uta martyāya kam ariṇāḥ indra sūryam
translated: Where thou, O Indra, hast given the sun to the mortal man, to the one who is without an enemy,

original: prāvaḥ śacībhir etaśam //
analyzed: prāvaḥ śacībhiḥ etaśam
translated: Thou hast helped Etaṣa with thy powers.

original: kim ād utāsi vṛtrahan maghavan manyumattamaḥ /
analyzed: kim āt uta asi vṛtrahan maghavan manyumattamaḥ
translated: What, then, O Vṛtra-slayer, art thou, O bountiful one, the most wrathful?

original: atrāha dānum ātiraḥ //
analyzed: atra aha dānum ātiraḥ
translated: Here thou hast overcome the Dānu.

original: etad ghed uta vīryam indra cakartha pauṃsyam /
analyzed: etat gha id uta vīryam indra cakartha pauṃsyam
translated: This, indeed, O Indra, is the manly deed of heroism which thou hast done,

original: striyaṃ yad durhaṇāyuvaṃ vadhīr duhitaraṃ divaḥ //
analyzed: striyam yat durhaṇāyuvam vadhīḥ duhitaram divaḥ
translated: That thou hast slain the daughter of the sky, the woman who was difficult to subdue.

original: divaś cid ghā duhitaram mahān mahīyamānām /
analyzed: divaḥ cit gha duhitaram mahān mahīyamānām
translated: Even from the daughter of the sky, the great one, the one who is highly exalted,

original: uṣāsam indra sam piṇak //
analyzed: uṣāsam indra sam piṇak
translated: The dawn, O Indra, thou hast crushed.

original: apoṣā anasaḥ sarat sampiṣṭād aha bibhyuṣī /
analyzed: apoṣā anasaḥ sarat sampiṣṭāt aha bibhyuṣī
translated: The dawn has fled from the crushed axle, from the crushed one, in fear,

original: ni yat sīṃ śiśnathad vṛṣā //
analyzed: ni yat sīm śiśnathat vṛṣā
translated: When the bull has shattered it.

original: etad asyā anaḥ śaye susampiṣṭaṃ vipāśy ā /
analyzed: etat asyāḥ anaḥ śaye su sampiṣṭam vipāśi ā
translated: This is her axle, lying here, well-crushed, looking around,

original: sasāra sīm parāvataḥ //🔽uta sindhuṃ vibālyaṃ vitasthānām adhi kṣami /🔽pari ṣṭhā indra māyayā //
analyzed: sasāra sīm parāvataḥ  uta sindhum vibālyam vitasthānām adhi kṣami  pari stha indra māyayā
translated: She has fled far away.🔽And the Sindhu, the one with the torn bank, on the level ground,🔽Thou hast surrounded, O Indra, with thy magic power.

original: uta śuṣṇasya dhṛṣṇuyā pra mṛkṣo abhi vedanam /
analyzed: uta śuṣṇasya dhṛṣṇuyā pra mṛkṣaḥ abhi vedanam
translated: And the daring of Ṣushṇa, the piercing, thou hast rubbed away,

original: puro yad asya sampiṇak //
analyzed: puraḥ yat asya sampiṇak
translated: When thou hast crushed his forts.

original: uta dāsaṃ kaulitaram bṛhataḥ parvatād adhi /
analyzed: uta dāsam kaulitaram bṛhataḥ parvatāt adhi
translated: And the Dāsa Kaulita, from the lofty mountain,

original: avāhann indra śambaram //
analyzed: avāhan indra śambaram
translated: O Indra, thou didst bring down Sambara.

original: uta dāsasya varcinaḥ sahasrāṇi śatāvadhīḥ /
analyzed: uta dāsasya varcinaḥ sahasrāṇi śatā avadhīḥ
translated: And the Dāsa Varchin, a hundred times a thousand,

original: adhi pañca pradhīṃr iva //
analyzed: adhi pañca pradhīn iva
translated: As if upon five peaks.

original: uta tyam putram agruvaḥ parāvṛktaṃ śatakratuḥ /
analyzed: uta tyam putram agruvaḥ parāvṛktam śatakratuḥ
translated: And that son of the barren woman, Parāvṛkta, Śatakratu,

original: uktheṣv indra ābhajat //
analyzed: uktheṣu indraḥ ābhajat
translated: Indra, hath allotted to the lauds.

original: uta tyā turvaśāyadū asnātārā śacīpatiḥ /
analyzed: uta tyā turvaśa yadū a snātārā śacīpatiḥ
translated: And those two who were bathing, the sons of Turvaga, whom the powerful Indra,

original: indro vidvāṃ apārayat //
analyzed: indraḥ vidvān apārayat
translated: The wise one, delivered.

original: uta tyā sadya āryā sarayor indra pārataḥ /
analyzed: uta tyā sadyas āryā sarayoḥ indra pāratas
translated: And those two Ārya brothers, O Indra, from the two rivers,

original: arṇācitrarathāvadhīḥ //
analyzed: arṇā citraratha avadhīḥ
translated: From the farther bank, thou didst slay Arṇā and Citraratha.

original: anu dvā jahitā nayo 'ndhaṃ śroṇaṃ ca vṛtrahan /
analyzed: anu dvā jahitā nayaḥ ndham śroṇam ca vṛtrahan
translated: The two blind men, O Vṛtra-slayer, whom thou didst slay,

original: na tat te sumnam aṣṭave //
analyzed: na tat te sumnam aṣṭave
translated: That favour of thine is not to be surpassed.

original: śatam aśmanmayīnām purām indro vy āsyat /
analyzed: śatam aśmanmayīnām purām indraḥ vi āsyat
translated: A hundred forts of stone, O Indra, thou didst open,

original: divodāsāya dāśuṣe //
analyzed: divodāsāya dāśuṣe
translated: For Divodāsa, the worshipper.

original: asvāpayad dabhītaye sahasrā triṃśataṃ hathaiḥ /
analyzed: asvāpayat dabhītaye sahasrā triṃśatam hathaiḥ
translated: Thou didst cause to sleep, with thy hand, for Dabhīti, thirty thousand,

original: dāsānām indro māyayā //
analyzed: dāsānām indraḥ māyayā
translated: The Dāsas, O Indra, with thy magic power.

original: sa ghed utāsi vṛtrahan samāna indra gopatiḥ /
analyzed: sa gha id uta asi vṛtrahan samānaḥ indra go patiḥ
translated: Thou, O Vrtra-slayer, art indeed such, O Indra, the common lord of the cows,

original: yas tā viśvāni cicyuṣe //
analyzed: yaḥ tā viśvāni cicyuṣe
translated: Who hast all these desires.

original: uta nūnaṃ yad indriyaṃ kariṣyā indra pauṃsyam /
analyzed: uta nūnam yat indriyam kariṣyāḥ indra pauṃsyam
translated: And now, O Indra, what manly power we shall perform,

original: adyā nakiṣ ṭad ā minat //
analyzed: adyā nakir tat ā minat
translated: No one shall diminish that to-day.

original: vāmaṃvāmaṃ ta ādure devo dadātv aryamā /
analyzed: vāmam vāmam te ādure devaḥ dadātu aryamā
translated: May the God Aryaman grant us the best, the best in his abode.

original: vāmam pūṣā vāmam bhago vāmaṃ devaḥ karūḷatī //
analyzed: vāmam pūṣā vāmam bhagaḥ vāmam devaḥ karūḍatī
translated: May Pusan, may Bhaga, may the God grant us the best.

original: kayā naś citra ā bhuvad ūtī sadāvṛdhaḥ sakhā /
analyzed: kayā naḥ citraḥ ā bhuvat ūtī sadāvṛdhaḥ sakhā
translated: By what wondrous help, O thou who ever givest increase, wilt thou come to us,

original: kayā śaciṣṭhayā vṛtā //🔽kas tvā satyo madānām maṃhiṣṭho matsad andhasaḥ /
analyzed: kayā śaciṣṭhayā vṛtā  kaḥ tvā satyaḥ madānām maṃhiṣṭhaḥ matsat andhasaḥ
translated: By what most mighty company?🔽What true, most liberal gladdener of thee, O God, in the juice,

original: dṛḷhā cid āruje vasu //
analyzed: dṛḍhā cit āruje vasu
translated: Will burst open even the firm treasures?

original: abhī ṣu ṇaḥ sakhīnām avitā jaritṝṇām /
analyzed: abhī su naḥ sakhīnām avitā jaritṝṇām
translated: Be thou the protector of our friends, the helper of our worshippers,

original: śatam bhavāsy ūtibhiḥ //
analyzed: śatam bhavāsi ūtibhiḥ
translated: Be thou a hundredfold with thy aids.

original: abhī na ā vavṛtsva cakraṃ na vṛttam arvataḥ /
analyzed: abhi naḥ ā vavṛtsva cakram na vṛttam arvataḥ
translated: Turn thou unto us, as a car to be driven turns to the course,

original: niyudbhiś carṣaṇīnām //
analyzed: niyudbhiḥ carṣaṇīnām
translated: With the reins of the people.

original: pravatā hi kratūnām ā hā padeva gacchasi /
analyzed: pravatā hi kratūnām ā ha padā iva gacchasi
translated: For by the paths of sacrifices thou goest as it were to thy place,

original: abhakṣi sūrye sacā //
analyzed: abhakṣi sūrye sacā
translated: To eat with the sun.

original: saṃ yat ta indra manyavaḥ saṃ cakrāṇi dadhanvire /
analyzed: sam yat te indra manyavaḥ sam cakrāṇi dadhanvire
translated: When thy thoughts, O Indra, and thy wheels have been set in motion,

original: adha tve adha sūrye //
analyzed: adha tve adha sūrye
translated: Then art thou with us, then with the sun.

original: uta smā hi tvām āhur in maghavānaṃ śacīpate /
analyzed: uta smā hi tvām āhuḥ id maghavānam śacīpate
translated: Even now they call thee, O Maghavan, O Lord of power,

original: dātāram avidīdhayum //
analyzed: dātāram avidīdhayum
translated: The giver who delights in the worshipper.

original: uta smā sadya it pari śaśamānāya sunvate /
analyzed: uta smā sadyas id pari śaśamānāya sunvate
translated: Even now thou givest abundant wealth to the man who presses Soma,

original: purū cin maṃhase vasu //🔽nahi ṣmā te śataṃ cana rādho varanta āmuraḥ /
analyzed: purū cit maṃhase vasu  nahi sma te śatam cana rādhaḥ varante āmuraḥ
translated: Who is eager to win thee.🔽For a hundred times, O thou who hast no foe, they do not obtain thy bounty,

original: na cyautnāni kariṣyataḥ //
