analyzed: na cyautnāni kariṣyataḥ
translated: Nor thy deeds of power.

original: asmāṃ avantu te śatam asmān sahasram ūtayaḥ /🔽asmān viśvā abhiṣṭayaḥ //
analyzed: asmān avantu te śatam asmān sahasram ūtayaḥ  asmān viśvāḥ abhiṣṭayaḥ
translated: May a hundred of your aids, may a thousand aids protect us.🔽May all your aids protect us.

original: asmāṃ ihā vṛṇīṣva sakhyāya svastaye /
analyzed: asmān iha ā vṛṇīṣva sakhyāya svastaye
translated: Choose us here for friendship and well-being.

original: maho rāye divitmate //🔽asmāṃ aviḍḍhi viśvahendra rāyā parīṇasā /
analyzed: mahaḥ rāye divitmate  asmām aviḍḍhi viśvahā indra rāyā parīṇasā
translated: For great heavenly riches.🔽O Indra, favour us with all aids and with abundant wealth.

original: asmān viśvābhir ūtibhiḥ //
analyzed: asmān viśvābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ
translated: With all your aids.

original: asmabhyaṃ tāṃ apā vṛdhi vrajāṃ asteva gomataḥ /
analyzed: asmabhyam tām apa ā vṛdhi vrajām astā iva gomataḥ
translated: Grant us those herds of cattle, as with a staff,

original: navābhir indrotibhiḥ //
analyzed: navābhiḥ indra ūtibhiḥ
translated: With your new aids, O Indra.

original: asmākaṃ dhṛṣṇuyā ratho dyumāṃ indrānapacyutaḥ /
analyzed: asmākam dhṛṣṇuyā rathaḥ dyumān indra an apacyutaḥ
translated: Our chariot, powerful, unshaken, shall conquer through our daring, O Indra,

original: gavyur aśvayur īyate //
analyzed: gavyuḥ aśvayuḥ īyate
translated: Bringing kine and horses.

original: asmākam uttamaṃ kṛdhi śravo deveṣu sūrya /
analyzed: asmākam uttamam kṛdhi śravaḥ deveṣu sūrya
translated: Make our glory the highest among the gods, O Surya,

original: varṣiṣṭhaṃ dyām ivopari //
analyzed: varṣiṣṭham dyām iva upari
translated: The highest, as the sky above.

original: ā tū na indra vṛtrahann asmākam ardham ā gahi /
analyzed: ā tu naḥ indra vṛtrahan asmākam ardham ā gahi
translated: Come now to us, O Indra, slayer of Vrtra, come to our side,

original: mahān mahībhir ūtibhiḥ //🔽bhṛmiś cid ghāsi tūtujir ā citra citriṇīṣv ā /
analyzed: mahān mahībhiḥ ūtibhiḥ  bhṛmiḥ cit gha asi tūtujiḥ ā citra citriṇīṣu ā
translated: Great with mighty aids.

original: citraṃ kṛṇoṣy ūtaye //🔽dabhrebhiś cic chaśīyāṃsaṃ haṃsi vrādhantam ojasā /
analyzed: citram kṛṇoṣi ūtaye  dabhrebhiḥ cit śaśīyāṃsam haṃsi vrādhantam ojasā
translated: Even the greedy one thou helpest, the swift one, O wondrous one, in wondrous battles.

original: sakhibhir ye tve sacā //🔽vayam indra tve sacā vayaṃ tvābhi nonumaḥ /
analyzed: sakhibhiḥ ye tve sacā  vayam indra tve sacā vayam tvā abhi nonumaḥ
translated: Thou dost wondrous things for help.🔽Even the more feeble one thou smitest with thy feeble ones, the stronger with thy strength,🔽He with whom thou, O Indra, art well pleased.🔽We, O Indra, with thee, we, O Indra, with thee, we invoke thee.

original: asmāṃasmāṃ id ud ava //
analyzed: asmān asmān id ud ava
translated: Lift us up, O Indra, from this place.

original: sa naś citrābhir adrivo 'navadyābhir ūtibhiḥ /
analyzed: sa naḥ citrābhiḥ adrivas navadyābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ
translated: Come to us, O bountiful one, with your wondrous, irreproachable aids,

original: anādhṛṣṭābhir ā gahi //
analyzed: anādhṛṣṭābhiḥ ā gahi
translated: With your unassailable ones.

original: bhūyāmo ṣu tvāvataḥ sakhāya indra gomataḥ /
analyzed: bhūyāma u su tvāvataḥ sakhāyaḥ indra gomataḥ
translated: May we be the most prosperous friends of you, O Indra, who possesses cattle.

original: yujo vājāya ghṛṣvaye //
analyzed: yujaḥ vājāya ghṛṣvaye
translated: Be yoked for the enjoyment of strength.

original: tvaṃ hy eka īśiṣa indra vājasya gomataḥ /
analyzed: tvam hi ekaḥ īśiṣe indra vājasya gomataḥ
translated: For you alone are the lord, O Indra, of the wealth in cattle.

original: sa no yandhi mahīm iṣam //
analyzed: sa naḥ yandhi mahīm iṣam
translated: Therefore, grant us abundant food.

original: na tvā varante anyathā yad ditsasi stuto magham /
analyzed: na tvā varante anyathā yat ditsasi stutaḥ magham
translated: They do not restrain you in any other way, when you wish to give wealth when praised,

original: stotṛbhya indra girvaṇaḥ //
analyzed: stotṛbhyaḥ indra girvaṇaḥ
translated: To the praisers, O Indra, lover of song.

original: abhi tvā gotamā girānūṣata pra dāvane /
analyzed: abhi tvā gotamāḥ girā anūṣata pra dāvane
translated: The Gotamas sing to you with songs, to give (you),

original: indra vājāya ghṛṣvaye //
analyzed: indra vājāya ghṛṣvaye
translated: O Indra, for the enjoyment of strength.

original: pra te vocāma vīryā yā mandasāna ārujaḥ /
analyzed: pra te vocāma vīryā yāḥ mandasānaḥ ārujaḥ
translated: We proclaim your deeds, which you have done while rejoicing,

original: puro dāsīr abhītya //
analyzed: puraḥ dāsīḥ abhītya
translated: Having overcome the forts of the Dasyus.

original: tā te gṛṇanti vedhaso yāni cakartha pauṃsyā /
analyzed: tā te gṛṇanti vedhasaḥ yāni cakartha pauṃsyā
translated: The wise ones sing of those manly deeds of yours,

original: suteṣv indra girvaṇaḥ //
analyzed: suteṣu indra girvaṇaḥ
translated: Which you have done, O Indra, lover of song, at the Soma-pressings.

original: avīvṛdhanta gotamā indra tve stomavāhasaḥ /
analyzed: avīvṛdhanta gotamāḥ indra tve stoma vāhasaḥ
translated: The Gotamas have increased you, O Indra, for the sake of praise.

original: aiṣu dhā vīravad yaśaḥ //
analyzed: ā eṣu dhāḥ vīravat yaśaḥ
translated: Bestow on them fame that is full of heroes.

original: yac cid dhi śaśvatām asīndra sādhāraṇas tvam /
analyzed: yat cit hi śaśvatām asi indra sādhāraṇaḥ tvam
translated: Whatever you are of the eternal ones, O Indra, you are common to all.

original: taṃ tvā vayaṃ havāmahe //
analyzed: tam tvā vayam havāmahe
translated: We invoke you for that (purpose).

original: arvācīno vaso bhavāsme su matsvāndhasaḥ /
analyzed: arvācīnaḥ vaso bhava asme su matsva andhasaḥ
translated: Be inclined towards us, O Vasu, rejoice in our libations,

original: somānām indra somapāḥ //
analyzed: somānām indra soma pāḥ
translated: O Indra, you who drink Soma among the pressed Soma juices.

original: asmākaṃ tvā matīnām ā stoma indra yacchatu /🔽arvāg ā vartayā harī //
analyzed: asmākam tvā matīnām ā stomaḥ indra yacchatu  arvāk ā vartaya harī
translated: Let our hymns, O Indra, be acceptable to thee.🔽Turn hither thy two bay steeds.

original: puroḷāśaṃ ca no ghaso joṣayāse giraś ca naḥ /
analyzed: puroḷāśam ca naḥ ghasaḥ joṣayāse giraḥ ca naḥ
translated: Accept our sacrificial cake and our praises,

original: vadhūyur iva yoṣaṇām //
analyzed: vadhūyuḥ iva yoṣaṇām
translated: As a bridegroom receives a young wife.

original: sahasraṃ vyatīnāṃ yuktānām indram īmahe /
analyzed: sahasram vyatīnām yuktānām indram īmahe
translated: We invoke Indra, the thousand-powered, the well-yoked,

original: śataṃ somasya khāryaḥ //🔽sahasrā te śatā vayaṃ gavām ā cyāvayāmasi /
analyzed: śatam somasya khāryaḥ  sahasrā te śatā vayam gavām ā cyāvayāmasi
translated: The hundred-barrelled Soma.🔽We cause to flow for thee a thousand, a hundred

original: asmatrā rādha etu te //
analyzed: asmatrā rādhaḥ etu te
translated: Of cows, here may thy bounty come to us.

original: daśa te kalaśānāṃ hiraṇyānām adhīmahi /
analyzed: daśa te kalaśānām hiraṇyānām adhīmahi
translated: We will place ten of thy golden jars

original: bhūridā asi vṛtrahan //
analyzed: bhūri dāḥ asi vṛtrahan
translated: For thee, O Vritra-slayer, thou art the giver of much.🔽Give us much, O giver of much, bring us much,

original: bhūridā bhūri dehi no mā dabhram bhūry ā bhara /
analyzed: bhūri dāḥ bhūri dehi naḥ mā dabhram bhūri ā bhara
translated: Bring us much that is not small.

original: bhūri ghed indra ditsasi //
analyzed: bhūri gha id indra ditsasi
translated: For thou, O Indra, art wont to give much.

original: bhūridā hy asi śrutaḥ purutrā śūra vṛtrahan /
analyzed: bhūri dāḥ hi asi śrutaḥ purutrā śūra vṛtrahan
translated: Thou art famed as the giver of much, O hero, O Vritra-slayer,

original: ā no bhajasva rādhasi //🔽pra te babhrū vicakṣaṇa śaṃsāmi goṣaṇo napāt /
analyzed: ā naḥ bhajasva rādhasi  pra te babhrū vicakṣaṇa śaṃsāmi goṣaṇaḥ napāt
translated: Do thou allot to us a share in thy bounty.🔽O thou of the tawny steeds, O thou of great insight, I praise thee, O son of Sudhanvan,

original: mābhyāṃ gā anu śiśrathaḥ //
analyzed: mā ābhyām gāḥ anu śiśrathaḥ
translated: Do not withhold from us the two (cows) which we follow.

original: kanīnakeva vidradhe nave drupade arbhake /
analyzed: kanīnakā iva vidradhe nave drupade arbhake
translated: Like two young children, like two new earthen vessels,

original: babhrū yāmeṣu śobhete //
analyzed: babhrū yāmeṣu śobhete
translated: The tawny ones shine in their courses.

original: aram ma usrayāmṇe 'ram anusrayāmṇe /
analyzed: aram me usra yāmṇe ram an usra yāmṇe
translated: Easy for the one who goes with the dawn, easy for the one who follows the dawn,

original: babhrū yāmeṣv asridhā //
analyzed: babhrū yāmeṣu asridhā
translated: The tawny ones shine in their courses.

original: pra ṛbhubhyo dūtam iva vācam iṣya upastire śvaitarīṃ dhenum īḷe /
analyzed: pra ṛbhubhyaḥ dūtam iva vācam iṣye upastire śvaitarīm dhenum īḍe
translated: I send forth a message to the Rbhus as a messenger, I offer a white cow to Upastir.

original: ye vātajūtās taraṇibhir evaiḥ pari dyāṃ sadyo apaso babhūvuḥ //
analyzed: ye vāta jūtāḥ taraṇibhiḥ evaiḥ pari dyām sadyas apasaḥ babhūvuḥ
translated: Who, driven by the wind, with swift steeds, in a moment have become the attendants of the sky.

original: yadāram akrann ṛbhavaḥ pitṛbhyām pariviṣṭī veṣaṇā daṃsanābhiḥ /
analyzed: yadā aram akran ṛbhavaḥ pitṛbhyām pariviṣṭī veṣaṇā daṃsanābhiḥ
translated: When the Rbhus did this for their parents, with gifts, with offerings, with deeds of strength,

original: ād id devānām upa sakhyam āyan dhīrāsaḥ puṣṭim avahan manāyai //
analyzed: āt id devānām upa sakhyam āyan dhīrāsaḥ puṣṭim avahan manāyai
translated: They entered the friendship of the gods, the wise ones brought prosperity for the sake of the mind.

original: punar ye cakruḥ pitarā yuvānā sanā yūpeva jaraṇā śayānā /
analyzed: punar ye cakruḥ pitarā yuvānā sanā yūpā iva jaraṇā śayānā
translated: Those who made their parents young again, who made them lie down like a worn-out sacrificial post,

original: te vājo vibhvāṃ ṛbhur indravanto madhupsaraso no 'vantu yajñam //
analyzed: te vājaḥ vibhvā ṛbhuḥ indravantaḥ madhu psarasaḥ naḥ vantu yajñam
translated: May that strength, that all-embracing Rbhukṣan, accompanied by Indra, delight in our sacrifice, whose food is honey.

original: yat saṃvatsam ṛbhavo gām arakṣan yat saṃvatsam ṛbhavo mā apiṃśan /
analyzed: yat saṃvatsam ṛbhavaḥ gām arakṣan yat saṃvatsam ṛbhavaḥ māḥ apiṃśan
translated: For a year the Rbhus guarded the cow, for a year the Rbhus nourished me,

original: yat saṃvatsam abharan bhāso asyās tābhiḥ śamībhir amṛtatvam āśuḥ //
analyzed: yat saṃvatsam abharan bhāsaḥ asyāḥ tābhiḥ śamībhiḥ amṛta tvam āśuḥ
translated: For a year they bore the light of this (cow); by those acts of kindness they attained immortality.

original: jyeṣṭha āha camasā dvā kareti kanīyān trīn kṛṇavāmety āha /
analyzed: jyeṣṭhaḥ āha camasā dvā karā iti kanīyān trīn kṛṇavāma iti āha
translated: The eldest says, Let us make two cups; the youngest says, Let us make three.

original: kaniṣṭha āha caturas kareti tvaṣṭa ṛbhavas tat panayad vaco vaḥ //
analyzed: kaniṣṭhaḥ āha caturaḥ kara iti tvaṣṭa ṛbhavaḥ tat panayat vacaḥ vaḥ
translated: The youngest says, Let us make four; Tvaṣṭar, O Rbhus, fulfilled that promise of yours.

original: satyam ūcur nara evā hi cakrur anu svadhām ṛbhavo jagmur etām /
analyzed: satyam ūcuḥ naraḥ evā hi cakruḥ anu svadhām ṛbhavaḥ jagmuḥ etām
translated: They spoke the truth, the men indeed did it; the Rbhus went according to their nature to this (cow).

original: vibhrājamānāṃś camasāṃ ahevāvenat tvaṣṭā caturo dadṛśvān //
analyzed: vibhrājamānān camasān aha iva avenat tvaṣṭā caturaḥ dadṛśvān
translated: And the four shining Chamasas which Aheva saw.

original: dvādaśa dyūn yad agohyasyātithye raṇann ṛbhavaḥ sasantaḥ /
analyzed: dvādaśa dyūn yat agohyasya ātithye raṇan ṛbhavaḥ sasantaḥ
translated: When the Rbhus, united, rejoiced for twelve days at the hospitality of Agobhya,

original: sukṣetrākṛṇvann anayanta sindhūn dhanvātiṣṭhann oṣadhīr nimnam āpaḥ //
analyzed: su kṣetrā akṛṇvan anayanta sindhūn dhanva atiṣṭhan oṣadhīḥ nimnam āpaḥ
translated: They made good fields, they led the rivers, they placed the plants in the desert, the waters in the low ground.

original: rathaṃ ye cakruḥ suvṛtaṃ nareṣṭhāṃ ye dhenuṃ viśvajuvaṃ viśvarūpām /
analyzed: ratham ye cakruḥ suvṛtam nareṣṭhām ye dhenum viśva juvam viśva rūpām
translated: They who made the chariot with the good wheels, the yoke for the men, the cow with universal form and universal use,

original: ta ā takṣantv ṛbhavo rayiṃ naḥ svavasaḥ svapasaḥ suhastāḥ //
analyzed: te ā takṣantu ṛbhavaḥ rayim naḥ su avasaḥ su apasaḥ su hastāḥ
translated: May the Rbhus fashion for us wealth, of their own will, of their own accord, with good hands.

original: apo hy eṣām ajuṣanta devā abhi kratvā manasā dīdhyānāḥ /
analyzed: apaḥ hi eṣām ajuṣanta devāḥ abhi kratvā manasā dīdhyānāḥ
translated: For the gods have rejoiced in their waters, reflecting with their mind and thought.

original: vājo devānām abhavat sukarmendrasya ṛbhukṣā varuṇasya vibhvā //
analyzed: vājaḥ devānām abhavat sukarmā indrasya ṛbhukṣāḥ varuṇasya vibhvā
translated: The treasure of the gods has become well-made, the Rbhukṣan of Indra, the Vibhvan of Varuṇa.

original: ye harī medhayokthā madanta indrāya cakruḥ suyujā ye aśvā /
analyzed: ye harī medhayā ukthā madantaḥ indrāya cakruḥ su yujā ye aśvā
translated: Those two bay horses who rejoice in the hymns and praises for Indra, those well-yoked horses,

original: te rāyas poṣaṃ draviṇāny asme dhatta ṛbhavaḥ kṣemayanto na mitram //
analyzed: te rāyaḥ poṣam draviṇāni asme dhatta ṛbhavaḥ kṣemayantaḥ na mitram
translated: May they bestow upon us increase of wealth and goods, the Rbhus, making us secure as a friend.

original: idāhnaḥ pītim uta vo madaṃ dhur na ṛte śrāntasya sakhyāya devāḥ /
analyzed: idā ahnaḥ pītim uta vaḥ madam dhuḥ na ṛte śrāntasya sakhyāya devāḥ
translated: We have prepared for you the drink of this day and the joy, O gods, not without toil for friendship.

original: te nūnam asme ṛbhavo vasūni tṛtīye asmin savane dadhāta //
analyzed: te nūnam asme ṛbhavaḥ vasūni tṛtīye asmin savane dadhāta
translated: Now, O Rbhus, bestow upon us treasures in this third libation.

original: ṛbhur vibhvā vāja indro no acchemaṃ yajñaṃ ratnadheyopa yāta /
analyzed: ṛbhuḥ vibhvā vājaḥ indraḥ naḥ acchā imam yajñam ratna dheyā upa yāta
translated: R̥ibhu, Vibhvan, Vâja, Indra come to this our sacrifice, ye givers of treasure.

original: idā hi vo dhiṣaṇā devy ahnām adhāt pītiṃ sam madā agmatā vaḥ //
analyzed: idā hi vaḥ dhiṣaṇā devī ahnām adhāt pītim sam madāḥ agmata vaḥ
translated: For now hath the Goddess Dhishaṇa set for you the drinking of the days: let your delights approach you.

original: vidānāso janmano vājaratnā uta ṛtubhir ṛbhavo mādayadhvam /
analyzed: vidānāsaḥ janmanaḥ vāja ratnāḥ uta ṛtubhiḥ ṛbhavaḥ mādayadhvam
translated: Ye R̥ibhus, finders out of life, treasure of strength, rejoice you also with the seasons.

original: saṃ vo madā agmata sam purandhiḥ suvīrām asme rayim erayadhvam //
analyzed: sam vaḥ madāḥ agmata sam purandhiḥ su vīrām asme rayim erayadhvam
translated: Let your delights come nigh to you: let Purandhi send us wealth in brave men.

original: ayaṃ vo yajña ṛbhavo 'kāri yam ā manuṣvat pradivo dadhidhve /
analyzed: ayam vaḥ yajñaḥ ṛbhavaḥ kāri yam ā manuṣvat pradivaḥ dadhidhve
translated: This sacrifice, O R̥ibhus, hath been made for you, which ye, like Manu, have accepted.

original: pra vo 'cchā jujuṣāṇāso asthur abhūta viśve agriyota vājāḥ //🔽abhūd u vo vidhate ratnadheyam idā naro dāśuṣe martyāya /
analyzed: pra vaḥ chā jujuṣāṇāsaḥ asthuḥ abhūta viśve agriyā uta vājāḥ  abhūt u vaḥ vidhate ratna dheyam idā naraḥ dāśuṣe martyāya
translated: Your eager ones have come to us: all treasures have been gained by you, O Vâjas.🔽To him who offers, to the mortal man, hath been given your treasure, O ye R̥ibhus.

original: pibata vājā ṛbhavo dade vo mahi tṛtīyaṃ savanam madāya //
analyzed: pibata vājāḥ ṛbhavaḥ dade vaḥ mahi tṛtīyam savanam madāya
translated: Drink, O Vâjas, I have given you: the great third draught is for your joy.

original: ā vājā yātopa na ṛbhukṣā maho naro draviṇaso gṛṇānāḥ /🔽ā vaḥ pītayo 'bhipitve ahnām imā astaṃ navasva iva gman //
analyzed: ā vājāḥ yātā upa naḥ ṛbhukṣāḥ mahaḥ naraḥ draviṇasaḥ gṛṇānāḥ  ā vaḥ pītayaḥ bhipitve ahnām imāḥ astam nava svaḥ iva gman
translated: Come, O ye Vâjas, come to us, O ye who long for R̥ibhu, ye great men, ye treasures, who are praised.🔽Your gladdening drinks at the close of day have come to us, as to fresh grass, O ye who have nine abodes.

original: ā napātaḥ śavaso yātanopemaṃ yajñaṃ namasā hūyamānāḥ /
analyzed: ā napātaḥ śavasaḥ yātana upa imam yajñam namasā hūyamānāḥ
translated: Come hither, O ye Sons of Strength, to this our sacrifice, invoked with reverence.

original: sajoṣasaḥ sūrayo yasya ca stha madhvaḥ pāta ratnadhā indravantaḥ //
analyzed: sajoṣasaḥ sūrayaḥ yasya ca stha madhvaḥ pāta ratna dhāḥ indravantaḥ
translated: Whose, O Sages, ye are of one accord, drink ye the sweet juice, ye possessors of treasure, with Indra.

original: sajoṣā indra varuṇena somaṃ sajoṣāḥ pāhi girvaṇo marudbhiḥ /🔽agrepābhir ṛtupābhiḥ sajoṣā gnāspatnībhī ratnadhābhiḥ sajoṣāḥ //
analyzed: sajoṣāḥ indra varuṇena somam sajoṣāḥ pāhi girvaṇaḥ marudbhiḥ  agre pābhiḥ ṛtu pābhiḥ sajoṣāḥ gnāspatnībhiḥ ratna dhābhiḥ sajoṣāḥ
translated: O Indra, be of one accord with Varuna in drinking the Soma; be of one accord, O lover of song, with the Maruts in drinking.🔽Be of one accord with the foremost, with those who guard the seasons, be of one accord with the wives of the lords of the people, the bestowers of treasure.

original: sajoṣasa ādityair mādayadhvaṃ sajoṣasa ṛbhavaḥ parvatebhiḥ /
analyzed: sajoṣasaḥ ādityaiḥ mādayadhvam sajoṣasaḥ ṛbhavaḥ parvatebhiḥ
translated: Be of one accord, O Âdityas, in rejoicing; be of one accord, O Rkvans, with the mountains.

original: sajoṣaso daivyenā savitrā sajoṣasaḥ sindhubhī ratnadhebhiḥ //🔽ye aśvinā ye pitarā ya ūtī dhenuṃ tatakṣur ṛbhavo ye aśvā /
analyzed: sajoṣasaḥ daivyena savitrā sajoṣasaḥ sindhubhiḥ ratna dhebhiḥ  ye aśvinā ye pitarā ye ūtī dhenum tatakṣuḥ ṛbhavaḥ ye aśvā
translated: Be of one accord with the divine Savitar; be of one accord with the treasure-giving Sindhu.🔽Ye who are the two Asvins, the two parents, the helpers, who are the Rkvans, who are the horses, who have fashioned the cow, the Rkvans who are the horses.

original: ye aṃsatrā ya ṛdhag rodasī ye vibhvo naraḥ svapatyāni cakruḥ //
analyzed: ye aṃsatrā ye ṛdhak rodasī ye vibhvaḥ naraḥ su apatyāni cakruḥ
translated: Ye who are the two shoulders, who are the two extended worlds, who are the two all-pervading men, who have made their own habitations.

original: ye gomantaṃ vājavantaṃ suvīraṃ rayiṃ dhattha vasumantam purukṣum /
analyzed: ye gomantam vājavantam su vīram rayim dhattha vasumantam purukṣum
translated: Ye who bestow wealth, with cattle, with strength, with good heroes, with riches, with much food,

original: te agrepā ṛbhavo mandasānā asme dhatta ye ca rātiṃ gṛṇanti //
analyzed: te agre pāḥ ṛbhavaḥ mandasānāḥ asme dhatta ye ca rātim gṛṇanti
translated: Those foremost Rkvans, rejoicing, bestow upon us, who give gifts and sing praises.

original: nāpābhūta na vo 'tītṛṣāmāniḥśastā ṛbhavo yajñe asmin /
analyzed: na apābhūta na vaḥ tītṛṣāma a niḥśastāḥ ṛbhavaḥ yajñe asmin
translated: We have not been neglected, we have not been disappointed, O Rkvans, we have not been rejected in this sacrifice.

original: sam indreṇa madatha sam marudbhiḥ saṃ rājabhī ratnadheyāya devāḥ //
analyzed: sam indreṇa madatha sam marudbhiḥ sam rājabhiḥ ratna dheyāya devāḥ
translated: Rejoice together with Indra, together with the Maruts, together with the Kings, O Gods, for the bestowal of treasures.

original: ihopa yāta śavaso napātaḥ saudhanvanā ṛbhavo māpa bhūta /
analyzed: iha upa yāta śavasaḥ napātaḥ saudhanvanāḥ ṛbhavaḥ mā apa bhūta
translated: Come hither, O ye sons of strength, ye R̥ibhus, come to us, O ye of Sudhanvan's race.

original: asmin hi vaḥ savane ratnadheyaṃ gamantv indram anu vo madāsaḥ //
analyzed: asmin hi vaḥ savane ratna dheyam gamantu indram anu vaḥ madāsaḥ
translated: For this libation is the time to give you treasure: let your delights go forth to meet with Indra.

original: āgann ṛbhūṇām iha ratnadheyam abhūt somasya suṣutasya pītiḥ /🔽sukṛtyayā yat svapasyayā caṃ ekaṃ vicakra camasaṃ caturdhā //
analyzed: āgan ṛbhūṇām iha ratna dheyam abhūt somasya suṣutasya pītiḥ  su kṛtyayā yat su apasyayā cam ekam vicakra camasam caturdhā
translated: The R̥ibhus' treasure-giving gift hath come: the draught of Soma well expressed is ready.🔽When by your skill and wisdom ye have fashioned the single cup in four parts, O R̥ibhus.

original: vy akṛṇota camasaṃ caturdhā sakhe vi śikṣety abravīta /
analyzed: vi akṛṇota camasam caturdhā sakhe vi śikṣa iti abravīta
translated: Ye have divided the one cup into four parts: to his friend thus hath one spoken.

original: athaita vājā amṛtasya panthāṃ gaṇaṃ devānām ṛbhavaḥ suhastāḥ //
analyzed: atha eta vājāḥ amṛtasya panthām gaṇam devānām ṛbhavaḥ su hastāḥ
translated: Now, O ye R̥ibhus, ye who find the path of immortality, ye Gods, ye skilful Ones,

original: kimmayaḥ svic camasa eṣa āsa yaṃ kāvyena caturo vicakra /
analyzed: kimmayaḥ svid camasaḥ eṣaḥ āsa yam kāvyena caturaḥ vicakra
translated: Of what was this one cup composed which ye have fashioned by your wisdom into four?

original: athā sunudhvaṃ savanam madāya pāta ṛbhavo madhunaḥ somyasya //
analyzed: athā sunudhvam savanam madāya pāta ṛbhavaḥ madhunaḥ somyasya
translated: Now press the juice for gladdening drink: drink ye, O R̥ibhus, of the sweet Soma juice.

original: śacyākarta pitarā yuvānā śacyākarta camasaṃ devapānam /
analyzed: śacyā akarta pitarā yuvānā śacyā akarta camasam deva pānam
translated: Ye have made the youthful parents strong: ye have made the cup which Gods shall drink.

original: śacyā harī dhanutarāv ataṣṭendravāhāv ṛbhavo vājaratnāḥ //
analyzed: śacyā harī dhanutarau ataṣṭa indra vāhau ṛbhavaḥ vāja ratnāḥ
translated: Ye have fashioned with your skill the two strong Bays, treasure-winning, bearing Indra, R̥ibhus.🔽He who at the libation of the days, O ye mighty R̥ibhus, presses out for you

original: yo vaḥ sunoty abhipitve ahnāṃ tīvraṃ vājāsaḥ savanam madāya /
analyzed: yaḥ vaḥ sunoti abhipitve ahnām tīvram vājāsaḥ savanam madāya
translated: The strong juice for your gladdening drink,

original: tasmai rayim ṛbhavaḥ sarvavīram ā takṣata vṛṣaṇo mandasānāḥ //
analyzed: tasmai rayim ṛbhavaḥ sarva vīram ā takṣata vṛṣaṇaḥ mandasānāḥ
translated: For him, O Rbhukṣaṇas, ye mighty ones, rejoicing, fashion wealth with all heroic sons.

original: prātaḥ sutam apibo haryaśva mādhyandinaṃ savanaṃ kevalaṃ te /
analyzed: prātar sutam apibaḥ hari aśva mādhyandinam savanam kevalam te
translated: O thou of tawny steeds, thou drankest the morning juice, the midday libation is thine only.

original: sam ṛbhubhiḥ pibasva ratnadhebhiḥ sakhīṃr yāṃ indra cakṛṣe sukṛtyā //
analyzed: sam ṛbhubhiḥ pibasva ratna dhebhiḥ sakhīn yām indra cakṛṣe su kṛtyā
translated: With the Rbhukṣaṇas, the givers of treasure, drink thou, O Indra, the friends whom thou hast made by good deeds.

original: ye devāso abhavatā sukṛtyā śyenā ived adhi divi niṣeda /
analyzed: ye devāsaḥ abhavata su kṛtyā śyenāḥ iva id adhi divi niṣeda
translated: Ye Gods who have become by good deeds, ye who have sat in heaven like hawks,

original: te ratnaṃ dhāta śavaso napātaḥ saudhanvanā abhavatāmṛtāsaḥ //
analyzed: te ratnam dhāta śavasaḥ napātaḥ saudhanvanāḥ abhavata amṛtāsaḥ
translated: Ye, O sons of strength, have become immortal, ye Rbhukṣaṇas, the givers of treasure.

original: yat tṛtīyaṃ savanaṃ ratnadheyam akṛṇudhvaṃ svapasyā suhastāḥ /
analyzed: yat tṛtīyam savanam ratna dheyam akṛṇudhvam su apasyā su hastāḥ
translated: The third libation, the gift of treasure, which ye have made, ye who are self-luminous, ye whose hands are fair,

original: tad ṛbhavaḥ pariṣiktaṃ va etat sam madebhir indriyebhiḥ pibadhvam //
analyzed: tat ṛbhavaḥ pariṣiktam vaḥ etat sam madebhiḥ indriyebhiḥ pibadhvam
translated: That, O Rbhukṣaṇas, is poured forth for you: drink ye thereof with your joys and your powers.

original: anaśvo jāto anabhīśur ukthyo rathas tricakraḥ pari vartate rajaḥ /
analyzed: an aśvaḥ jātaḥ an abhīśuḥ ukthyaḥ rathaḥ tri cakraḥ pari vartate rajaḥ
translated: The chariot, born without a horse, without a pole, worthy of praise, with three wheels, moves round the region.

original: mahat tad vo devyasya pravācanaṃ dyām ṛbhavaḥ pṛthivīṃ yac ca puṣyatha //
analyzed: mahat tat vaḥ devyasya pravācanam dyām ṛbhavaḥ pṛthivīm yat ca puṣyatha
translated: That is your great deed, O ye Gods, to be proclaimed, that ye, O Rbhukṣaṇas, support heaven and earth.

original: rathaṃ ye cakruḥ suvṛtaṃ sucetaso 'vihvarantam manasas pari dhyayā /
analyzed: ratham ye cakruḥ suvṛtam su cetasaḥ vihvarantam manasaḥ pari dhyayā
translated: They who have made the well-constructed, well-fashioned chariot, which never staggers, by the thought of the mind,

original: tāṃ ū nv asya savanasya pītaya ā vo vājā ṛbhavo vedayāmasi //
analyzed: tām u nu asya savanasya pītaye ā vaḥ vājāḥ ṛbhavaḥ vedayāmasi
translated: Those are indeed to be drunk at this libation. We announce to you, O Vāja and Ribhu, the wealth.

original: tad vo vājā ṛbhavaḥ supravācanaṃ deveṣu vibhvo abhavan mahitvanam /
analyzed: tat vaḥ vājāḥ ṛbhavaḥ su pravācanam deveṣu vibhvaḥ abhavat mahitvanam
translated: That, O Vāja and Ribhu, your great power, O Vibhus, has become well-praised among the gods.

original: jivrī yat santā pitarā sanājurā punar yuvānā carathāya takṣatha //
analyzed: jivrī yat santā pitarā sanā jurā punar yuvānā carathāya takṣatha
translated: When you, O young ones, have made the old parents, who are long-lived, young again for the sake of wandering about.

original: ekaṃ vi cakra camasaṃ caturvayaṃ niś carmaṇo gām ariṇīta dhītibhiḥ /
analyzed: ekam vi cakra camasam caturvayam niḥ carmaṇaḥ gām ariṇīta dhītibhiḥ
translated: You have made the one four-fold sacrificial ladle, and with thoughts you have brought the cow out of the skin.

original: athā deveṣv amṛtatvam ānaśa śruṣṭī vājā ṛbhavas tad va ukthyam //
analyzed: athā deveṣu amṛta tvam ānaśa śruṣṭī vājāḥ ṛbhavaḥ tat vaḥ ukthyam
translated: Then you have obtained immortality among the gods, O Vāja and Ribhu, that is to be praised by you.

original: ṛbhuto rayiḥ prathamaśravastamo vājaśrutāso yam ajījanan naraḥ /
analyzed: ṛbhutaḥ rayiḥ prathama śravastamaḥ vāja śrutāsaḥ yam ajījanat naraḥ
translated: The wealth of the Ribhus, the most famous in the beginning, which the men, famous for strength, have produced,

original: vibhvataṣṭo vidatheṣu pravācyo yaṃ devāso 'vathā sa vicarṣaṇiḥ //
analyzed: vibhva taṣṭaḥ vidatheṣu pravācyaḥ yam devāsaḥ vathā sa vicarṣaṇiḥ
translated: The one fashioned by the Vibhus, to be proclaimed in the assemblies, whom the gods have helped, he is very active.

original: sa vājy arvā sa ṛṣir vacasyayā sa śūro astā pṛtanāsu duṣṭaraḥ /🔽sa rāyas poṣaṃ sa suvīryaṃ dadhe yaṃ vājo vibhvāṃ ṛbhavo yam āviṣuḥ //
analyzed: sa vājī arvā saḥ ṛṣiḥ vacasyayā sa śūraḥ astā pṛtanāsu duṣṭaraḥ  sa rāyaḥ poṣam sa su vīryam dadhe yam vājaḥ vibhvā ṛbhavaḥ yam āviṣuḥ
translated: He is the strong one, the seer with his speech, the hero who is hard to overcome in battles.🔽He has taken hold of the increase of wealth, and of good heroism, whom Vāja, the Vibhus, and the Ribhus have favored.

original: śreṣṭhaṃ vaḥ peśo adhi dhāyi darśataṃ stomo vājā ṛbhavas taṃ jujuṣṭana /
analyzed: śreṣṭham vaḥ peśaḥ adhi dhāyi darśatam stomaḥ vājāḥ ṛbhavaḥ tam jujuṣṭana
translated: The most beautiful ornament has been placed upon you, O Vāja and Ribhu, the praise, which you should enjoy.

original: dhīrāso hi ṣṭhā kavayo vipaścitas tān va enā brahmaṇā vedayāmasi //
analyzed: dhīrāsaḥ hi stha kavayaḥ vipaścitaḥ tān vaḥ enā brahmaṇā vedayāmasi
translated: For ye, O ye wise, are the wise, the thoughtful ones; we know you well by this our holy prayer.

original: yūyam asmabhyaṃ dhiṣaṇābhyas pari vidvāṃso viśvā naryāṇi bhojanā /
analyzed: yūyam asmabhyam dhiṣaṇābhyaḥ pari vidvāṃsaḥ viśvā naryāṇi bhojanā
translated: Ye who are skilled in all manly deeds, in all the ways of life, for us,

original: dyumantaṃ vājaṃ vṛṣaśuṣmam uttamam ā no rayim ṛbhavas takṣatā vayaḥ //🔽iha prajām iha rayiṃ rarāṇā iha śravo vīravat takṣatā naḥ /🔽yena vayaṃ citayemāty anyān taṃ vājaṃ citram ṛbhavo dadā naḥ //
analyzed: dyumantam vājam vṛṣa śuṣmam uttamam ā naḥ rayim ṛbhavaḥ takṣata vayaḥ  iha prajām iha rayim rarāṇāḥ iha śravaḥ vīravat takṣata naḥ  yena vayam citayema ati anyān tam vājam citram ṛbhavaḥ dada naḥ
translated: Form ye for us, O ye R̥ibhus, wealth in the shape of splendid food, of strength most excellent, and vigorous.🔽Bestowing here on us offspring and riches, here form ye for us fame that shall be glorious.🔽Bestow on us that strength, O ye R̥ibhus, that shall be wonderful, whereby we may surpass all other men.

original: upa no vājā adhvaram ṛbhukṣā devā yāta pathibhir devayānaiḥ /
analyzed: upa naḥ vājāḥ adhvaram ṛbhukṣāḥ devāḥ yāta pathibhiḥ deva yānaiḥ
translated: Come to our sacrifice, O ye who seek for strength, O ye who long for food, O ye who love the sacrifice, O ye who love the sacrifice.

original: yathā yajñam manuṣo vikṣv āsu dadhidhve raṇvāḥ sudineṣv ahnām //🔽te vo hṛde manase santu yajñā juṣṭāso adya ghṛtanirṇijo guḥ /
analyzed: yathā yajñam manuṣaḥ vikṣu āsu dadhidhve raṇvāḥ sudineṣu ahnām  te vaḥ hṛde manase santu yajñāḥ juṣṭāsaḥ adya ghṛta nirṇijaḥ guḥ
translated: That in all homes of men the sacrifice may be performed, ye who are kind, in the fair days of the year.🔽Let your sacrifices be in your heart and in your mind, acceptable to-day, anointed with ghee.

original: pra vaḥ sutāso harayanta pūrṇāḥ kratve dakṣāya harṣayanta pītāḥ //
analyzed: pra vaḥ sutāsaḥ harayanta pūrṇāḥ kratve dakṣāya harṣayanta pītāḥ
translated: Let your full juices, O ye tawny ones, be carried to the sacrifice, gladdening you when they are drunk for strength and power.

original: tryudāyaṃ devahitaṃ yathā va stomo vājā ṛbhukṣaṇo dade vaḥ /
analyzed: tri udāyam deva hitam yathā vaḥ stomaḥ vājāḥ ṛbhukṣaṇaḥ dade vaḥ
translated: As ye have given me the hymn, O ye who seek for strength, O ye who long for food, O ye who love the sacrifice, O ye who love the sacrifice,

original: juhve manuṣvad uparāsu vikṣu yuṣme sacā bṛhaddiveṣu somam //
analyzed: juhve manuṣvat uparāsu vikṣu yuṣme sacā bṛhaddiveṣu somam
translated: I offer it, as Manu did, among the lower folk, with you, O ye of lofty heaven, the Soma.

original: pīvoaśvāḥ śucadrathā hi bhūtāyaḥśiprā vājinaḥ suniṣkāḥ /
analyzed: pīvaḥ aśvāḥ śucat rathāḥ hi bhūta ayaḥ śiprāḥ vājinaḥ su niṣkāḥ
translated: The fat-horsed, the bright-wheeled, the mighty, the gold-armed, the well-equipped,

original: indrasya sūno śavaso napāto 'nu vaś cety agriyam madāya //
analyzed: indrasya sūno śavasaḥ napātaḥ nu vaḥ ceti agriyam madāya
translated: The sons of Indra, the descendants of power, we invoke for the highest joy.

original: ṛbhum ṛbhukṣaṇo rayiṃ vāje vājintamaṃ yujam /
analyzed: ṛbhum ṛbhukṣaṇaḥ rayim vāje vājintamam yujam
translated: The Rbhukṣaṇa, the Rbhunṛmṇa, the wealth, the most powerful in battle, the yoked one,

original: indrasvantaṃ havāmahe sadāsātamam aśvinam //🔽sed ṛbhavo yam avatha yūyam indraś ca martyam /
analyzed: indrasvantam havāmahe sadā sātamam aśvinam  sa id ṛbhavaḥ yam avatha yūyam indraḥ ca martyam
translated: We invoke the one who possesses Indra, the most excellent in horses, the one who is always victorious.🔽The Rbhus, whom you and Indra help, that mortal,

original: sa dhībhir astu sanitā medhasātā so arvatā //
analyzed: sa dhībhiḥ astu sanitā medha sātā saḥ arvatā
translated: May he be the winner through his thoughts, through his wisdom, and through his horse.

original: vi no vājā ṛbhukṣaṇaḥ pathaś citana yaṣṭave /
analyzed: vi naḥ vājāḥ ṛbhukṣaṇaḥ pathaḥ citana yaṣṭave
translated: O Vājas, Rbhukṣaṇas, open for us the paths to sacrifice,

original: asmabhyaṃ sūraya stutā viśvā āśās tarīṣaṇi //
analyzed: asmabhyam sūrayaḥ stutāḥ viśvāḥ āśāḥ tarīṣaṇi
translated: For us the lords, praised by the Asvins, to conquer all the quarters.

original: taṃ no vājā ṛbhukṣaṇa indra nāsatyā rayim /
analyzed: tam naḥ vājāḥ ṛbhukṣaṇaḥ indra nāsatyā rayim
translated: O Vājas, Rbhukṣaṇas, O Indra, Nāsatyas, that wealth

original: sam aśvaṃ carṣaṇibhya ā puru śasta maghattaye //
analyzed: sam aśvam carṣaṇibhyaḥ ā puru śasta maghattaye
translated: To the men, the horse, for great praise and for lordship.

original: uto hi vāṃ dātrā santi pūrvā yā pūrubhyas trasadasyur nitośe /🔽kṣetrāsāṃ dadathur urvarāsāṃ ghanaṃ dasyubhyo abhibhūtim ugram //
analyzed: uta u hi vām dātrā santi pūrvā yā pūrubhyaḥ trasadasyuḥ nitośe  kṣetrāsām dadathuḥ urvarāsām ghanam dasyubhyaḥ abhibhūtim ugram
translated: For you have earlier gifts than those which Trasadasyu bestowed on the Purus.🔽You gave them the fields and the tilled lands, the strong, overwhelming power over the Dasyus.

original: uta vājinam puruniṣṣidhvānaṃ dadhikrām u dadathur viśvakṛṣṭim /
analyzed: uta vājinam puru niṣṣidhvānam dadhikrām u dadathuḥ viśvakṛṣṭim
translated: And the powerful one, the repeller of many, Dadhikrāvan, you gave to all the cultivators.

original: ṛjipyaṃ śyenam pruṣitapsum āśuṃ carkṛtyam aryo nṛpatiṃ na śūram //
analyzed: ṛjipyam śyenam pruṣitapsum āśum carkṛtyam aryaḥ nṛpatim na śūram
translated: The swift hawk, the impetuous, the active, the impetuous, the hero, the lord of men.

original: yaṃ sīm anu pravateva dravantaṃ viśvaḥ pūrur madati harṣamāṇaḥ /
analyzed: yam sīm anu pravatā iva dravantam viśvaḥ pūruḥ madati harṣamāṇaḥ
translated: Whom all the people rejoice in, as he rushes on like a torrent, exulting in his joy,

original: paḍbhir gṛdhyantam medhayuṃ na śūraṃ rathaturaṃ vātam iva dhrajantam //🔽yaḥ smārundhāno gadhyā samatsu sanutaraś carati goṣu gacchan /
analyzed: paḍbhiḥ gṛdhyantam medhayum na śūram ratha turam vātam iva dhrajantam  yaḥ sma ārundhānaḥ gadhyā samatsu sanutaraḥ carati goṣu gacchan
translated: The impetuous one, eager for the sacrifice, like a hero, a charioteer, rushing like the wind.🔽He who, being restrained, moves about in the battles, passing through the cows, the most distant one.

original: āvirṛjīko vidathā nicikyat tiro aratim pary āpa āyoḥ //
analyzed: āvirṛjīkaḥ vidathā nicikyat tiras aratim pari āpaḥ āyoḥ
translated: The resplendent one, examining the sacrifices, passing over the enemy, he has come to the light of the king.

original: uta smainaṃ vastramathiṃ na tāyum anu krośanti kṣitayo bhareṣu /
analyzed: uta smā enam vastramathim na tāyum anu krośanti kṣitayaḥ bhareṣu
translated: And in him they shout, like the one who shakes the garment, the clans in the battles.

original: nīcāyamānaṃ jasuriṃ na śyenaṃ śravaś cācchā paśumac ca yūtham //
analyzed: nīcāyamānam jasurim na śyenam śravaḥ ca acchā paśumat ca yūtham
translated: The one who is bent down, the swift one, like a hawk, the glory and the herd with cattle.

original: uta smāsu prathamaḥ sariṣyan ni veveti śreṇibhī rathānām /
analyzed: uta smāsu prathamaḥ sariṣyan ni veveti śreṇibhiḥ rathānām
translated: And he, the first to start among us, moves along with the rows of chariots.

original: srajaṃ kṛṇvāno janyo na śubhvā reṇuṃ rerihat kiraṇaṃ dadaśvān //
analyzed: srajam kṛṇvānaḥ janyaḥ na śubhvā reṇum rerihat kiraṇam dadaśvān
translated: Making a garland, like a beautiful one, licking the dust, giving the reins.

original: uta sya vājī sahurir ṛtāvā śuśrūṣamāṇas tanvā samarye /
analyzed: uta sya vājī sahuriḥ ṛtāvā śuśrūṣamāṇaḥ tanvā samarye
translated: And he, the strong one, the truthful one, the obedient one, with his body in the battle,

original: turaṃ yatīṣu turayann ṛjipyo 'dhi bhruvoḥ kirate reṇum ṛñjan //
analyzed: turam yatīṣu turayan ṛjipyaḥ dhi bhruvoḥ kirate reṇum ṛñjan
translated: Rushing among the swift ones, the impetuous one, rubbing the dust on his brows, striving.

original: uta smāsya tanyator iva dyor ṛghāyato abhiyujo bhayante /
analyzed: uta sma asya tanyatoḥ iva dyoḥ ṛghāyataḥ abhiyujaḥ bhayante
translated: And his enemies are afraid of him, as of the roaring of the cloud, when he is ready to strike.

original: yadā sahasram abhi ṣīm ayodhīd durvartuḥ smā bhavati bhīma ṛñjan //
analyzed: yadā sahasram abhi sīm ayodhīt durvartuḥ smā bhavati bhīmaḥ ṛñjan
translated: When he has fought with a thousand, he becomes hard to bear, terrible, eager to smite.

original: uta smāsya panayanti janā jūtiṃ kṛṣṭipro abhibhūtim āśoḥ /
analyzed: uta sma asya panayanti janāḥ jūtim kṛṣṭipraḥ abhibhūtim āśoḥ
translated: And the people praise his speed, the lords of the people, his overwhelming might.

original: utainam āhuḥ samithe viyantaḥ parā dadhikrā asarat sahasraiḥ //
analyzed: uta enam āhuḥ samithe viyantaḥ parā dadhikrāḥ asarat sahasraiḥ
translated: And they call him, when they are defeated in battle, Dadhikrâvan, who has gone away with thousands.

original: ā dadhikrāḥ śavasā pañca kṛṣṭīḥ sūrya iva jyotiṣāpas tatāna /
analyzed: ā dadhikrāḥ śavasā pañca kṛṣṭīḥ sūryaḥ iva jyotiṣā apaḥ tatāna
translated: Dadhikrâvan, with his might, hath extended over the five peoples, as Sûrya with his light over the waters.

original: sahasrasāḥ śatasā vājy arvā pṛṇaktu madhvā sam imā vacāṃsi //
analyzed: sahasra sāḥ śata sāḥ vājī arvā pṛṇaktu madhvā sam imā vacāṃsi
translated: May the strong steed, winning a thousand and a hundred, fill with sweetness these my words.

original: āśuṃ dadhikrāṃ tam u nu ṣṭavāma divas pṛthivyā uta carkirāma /
analyzed: āśum dadhikrām tam u nu stavāma divaḥ pṛthivyāḥ uta carkirāma
translated: Let us praise that swift Dadhikrâvan, and let us extol him of heaven and earth.

original: ucchantīr mām uṣasaḥ sūdayantv ati viśvāni duritāni parṣan //🔽mahaś carkarmy arvataḥ kratuprā dadhikrāvṇaḥ puruvārasya vṛṣṇaḥ /🔽yam pūrubhyo dīdivāṃsaṃ nāgniṃ dadathur mitrāvaruṇā taturim //
analyzed: ucchantīḥ mām uṣasaḥ sūdayantu ati viśvāni duritāni parṣan  mahaḥ carkarmi arvataḥ kratu prāḥ dadhikrāvṇaḥ puru vārasya vṛṣṇaḥ  yam pūrubhyaḥ dīdivāṃsam nā agnim dadathuḥ mitrāvaruṇā taturim
translated: May the rising dawns make me ready, and may I pass beyond all evils.🔽I will praise the great steed, the strong, the mighty Dadhikrâvan,🔽Whom, shining like a fire, ye have given to the many, O Mitra and Varuna, the swift one.

original: yo aśvasya dadhikrāvṇo akārīt samiddhe agnā uṣaso vyuṣṭau /
analyzed: yaḥ aśvasya dadhikrāvṇaḥ akārīt samiddhe agnau uṣasaḥ vyuṣṭau
translated: He who hath done the deed of Dadhikrâvan the steed, at the kindling of the fire, at the rising of the dawn,

original: anāgasaṃ tam aditiḥ kṛṇotu sa mitreṇa varuṇenā sajoṣāḥ //
analyzed: anāgasam tam aditiḥ kṛṇotu sa mitreṇa varuṇena sajoṣāḥ
translated: May Aditi make him free from sin, he who is of one mind with Mitra and Varuna.

original: dadhikrāvṇa iṣa ūrjo maho yad amanmahi marutāṃ nāma bhadram /
analyzed: dadhikrāvṇaḥ iṣaḥ ūrjaḥ mahaḥ yat amanmahi marutām nāma bhadram
translated: When we have thought of Dadhikravan's great food and strength, the Maruts' auspicious name,

original: svastaye varuṇam mitram agniṃ havāmaha indraṃ vajrabāhum //
analyzed: svastaye varuṇam mitram agnim havāmahe indram vajra bāhum
translated: For our welfare we invoke Varuna, Mitra, Agni, Indra with the thunderbolt in his arm.

original: indram ived ubhaye vi hvayanta udīrāṇā yajñam upaprayantaḥ /
analyzed: indram iva id ubhaye vi hvayante udīrāṇāḥ yajñam upaprayantaḥ
translated: As they call to Indra, both sides, rising, approaching the sacrifice,

original: dadhikrām u sūdanam martyāya dadathur mitrāvaruṇā no aśvam //
analyzed: dadhikrām u sūdanam martyāya dadathuḥ mitrāvaruṇā naḥ aśvam
translated: Dadhikravan, the cook, have granted us the horse for the mortal, O Mitra and Varuna.

original: dadhikrāvṇo akāriṣaṃ jiṣṇor aśvasya vājinaḥ /
analyzed: dadhikrāvṇaḥ akāriṣam jiṣṇoḥ aśvasya vājinaḥ
translated: I have sung the praise of Dadhikravan, the victorious, the strong horse.

original: surabhi no mukhā karat pra ṇa āyūṃṣi tāriṣat //
analyzed: surabhi naḥ mukhā karat pra naḥ āyūṃṣi tāriṣat
translated: May he make our mouths fragrant, and may he lead our lives to a long life.

original: dadhikrāvṇa id u nu carkirāma viśvā in mām uṣasaḥ sūdayantu /
analyzed: dadhikrāvṇaḥ id u nu carkirāma viśvāḥ id mām uṣasaḥ sūdayantu
translated: Of Dadhikravan indeed we should think, may all the dawns make me ready.

original: apām agner uṣasaḥ sūryasya bṛhaspater āṅgirasasya jiṣṇoḥ //🔽satvā bhariṣo gaviṣo duvanyasac chravasyād iṣa uṣasas turaṇyasat /
analyzed: apām agneḥ uṣasaḥ sūryasya bṛhaspateḥ āṅgirasasya jiṣṇoḥ  satvā bhariṣaḥ gaviṣaḥ duvanyasad śravasyāt iṣaḥ uṣasaḥ turaṇyasad
translated: Of the waters, of Agni, of the dawns, of the sun, of Brihaspati, the son of Angiras, the victorious.🔽The strong, the bearer of burdens, the seeker of cattle, the eager one, the famous, the swift one of the dawns.

original: satyo dravo dravaraḥ pataṅgaro dadhikrāveṣam ūrjaṃ svar janat //
analyzed: satyaḥ dravaḥ dravaraḥ pataṅgaraḥ dadhikrāvā iṣam ūrjam svar janat
translated: The true, the swift, the swift one, the flying one, Dadhikravan has produced the strength, the heavenly world.

original: uta smāsya dravatas turaṇyataḥ parṇaṃ na ver anu vāti pragardhinaḥ /🔽śyenasyeva dhrajato aṅkasam pari dadhikrāvṇaḥ sahorjā taritrataḥ //
analyzed: uta sma asya dravataḥ turaṇyataḥ parṇam na veḥ anu vāti pragardhinaḥ  śyenasya iva dhrajataḥ aṅkasam pari dadhikrāvṇaḥ saha ūrjā taritrataḥ
translated: And his swift-moving one blows after him like a leaf, greedy for the food,🔽As he moves along like a hawk, around the mark, Dadhikrāvan's strength, which is to be crossed over.

original: uta sya vājī kṣipaṇiṃ turaṇyati grīvāyām baddho apikakṣa āsani /
analyzed: uta sya vājī kṣipaṇim turaṇyati grīvāyām baddhaḥ apikakṣe āsani
translated: And his strong horse hurries him who is to be carried, bound by the neck, in the yoke, in the pole.

original: kratuṃ dadhikrā anu saṃtavītvat pathām aṅkāṃsy anv āpanīphaṇat //🔽haṃsaḥ śuciṣad vasur antarikṣasad dhotā vediṣad atithir duroṇasat /
analyzed: kratum dadhikrāḥ anu saṃtavītvat pathām aṅkāṃsi anu āpanīphaṇat  haṃsaḥ śuci sad vasuḥ antarikṣa sad hotā vedi sad atithiḥ duroṇa sad
translated: Dadhikrāvan has made him go along with his will, he has guided the paths, he has guided the marks.🔽The swan, sitting in the pure (sky), the treasure, sitting in the atmosphere, the priest, sitting on the altar, the guest, sitting in the house,

original: nṛṣad varasad ṛtasad vyomasad abjā gojā ṛtajā adrijā ṛtam //🔽indrā ko vāṃ varuṇā sumnam āpa stomo haviṣmāṃ amṛto na hotā /🔽yo vāṃ hṛdi kratumāṃ asmad uktaḥ pasparśad indrāvaruṇā namasvān //
analyzed: nṛṣad vara sad ṛta sad vyoma sad ap jāḥ go jāḥ ṛta jāḥ adri jāḥ ṛtam  indrā kaḥ vām varuṇā sumnam āpa stomaḥ haviṣmān amṛtaḥ na hotā  yaḥ vām hṛdi kratumān asmat uktaḥ pasparśat indrāvaruṇāḥ namasvān
translated: Sitting among men, sitting in the best (place), sitting in truth, sitting in the sky, born from the water, born from the cow, born from truth, born from the mountain, (he is) truth.🔽O Indra and Varuṇa, who has come to your favour, the worshipper, bringing oblations, like an immortal priest,🔽Who, full of thought in your heart, has spoken to you, has touched you, O Indra and Varuṇa, with homage.

original: indrā ha yo varuṇā cakra āpī devau martaḥ sakhyāya prayasvān /
analyzed: indrā ha yaḥ varuṇā cakre āpī devau martaḥ sakhyāya prayasvān
translated: He who, O Indra and Varuṇa, the mortal, full of power, has made you his allies, the two gods,

original: sa hanti vṛtrā samitheṣu śatrūn avobhir vā mahadbhiḥ sa pra śṛṇve //
analyzed: sa hanti vṛtrā samitheṣu śatrūn avobhiḥ vā mahadbhiḥ sa pra śṛṇve
translated: He slays the Vr̥itras in the battles, the enemies, he hears with the great aids.

original: indrā ha ratnaṃ varuṇā dheṣṭhetthā nṛbhyaḥ śaśamānebhyas tā /
analyzed: indrā ha ratnam varuṇā dheṣṭhā itthā nṛbhyaḥ śaśamānebhyaḥ tā
translated: Indra and Varuna are the best bestowers of treasure to men who long for it.

original: yadī sakhāyā sakhyāya somaiḥ sutebhiḥ suprayasā mādayaite //
analyzed: yadī sakhāyā sakhyāya somaiḥ sutebhiḥ su prayasā mādayaite
translated: If you, as friends, for friendship, with the pressed Soma and good companionship, delight yourselves.

original: indrā yuvaṃ varuṇā didyum asminn ojiṣṭham ugrā ni vadhiṣṭaṃ vajram /
analyzed: indrā yuvam varuṇā didyum asmin ojiṣṭham ugrā ni vadhiṣṭam vajram
translated: O Indra and Varuna, in this thunderbolt, be most powerful, O mighty ones, hurl your strongest bolt.

original: yo no durevo vṛkatir dabhītis tasmin mimāthām abhibhūty ojaḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ durevaḥ vṛkatiḥ dabhītiḥ tasmin mimāthām abhibhūti ojaḥ
translated: Against him who would injure us from afar, who would crush us like a wolf, against him direct your overwhelming strength.

original: indrā yuvaṃ varuṇā bhūtam asyā dhiyaḥ pretārā vṛṣabheva dhenoḥ /
analyzed: indrā yuvam varuṇā bhūtam asyāḥ dhiyaḥ pretārā vṛṣabhā iva dhenoḥ
translated: O Indra and Varuna, be ye the furtherers of this our thought, as steers of a cow.

original: sā no duhīyad yavaseva gatvī sahasradhārā payasā mahī gauḥ //
analyzed: sā naḥ duhīyat yavasā iva gatvī sahasra dhārā payasā mahī gauḥ
translated: May it yield to us, like a cow when it has gone to the pasture, the great cow with a thousand streams of milk.

original: toke hite tanaya urvarāsu sūro dṛśīke vṛṣaṇaś ca pauṃsye /
analyzed: toke hite tanaye urvarāsu sūraḥ dṛśīke vṛṣaṇaḥ ca pauṃsye
translated: In the birth of offspring, in the fields, in the sight of the sun, and in the strength of the bulls,

original: indrā no atra varuṇā syātām avobhir dasmā paritakmyāyām //
analyzed: indrā naḥ atra varuṇā syātām avobhiḥ dasmā paritakmyāyām
translated: O Indra and Varuna, be ye here with your favours, in the conflict with the wicked.

original: yuvām id dhy avase pūrvyāya pari prabhūtī gaviṣaḥ svāpī /
analyzed: yuvām id hi avase pūrvyāya pari prabhūtī gaviṣaḥ svāpī
translated: For you, indeed, are the ancient ones for help, the most bountiful, the most powerful, the most wealthy.

original: vṛṇīmahe sakhyāya priyāya śūrā maṃhiṣṭhā pitareva śambhū //
analyzed: vṛṇīmahe sakhyāya priyāya śūrā maṃhiṣṭhā pitarā iva śambhū
translated: We choose you as most liberal heroes for love and friendship, as auspicious as a father.

original: tā vāṃ dhiyo 'vase vājayantīr ājiṃ na jagmur yuvayūḥ sudānū /
analyzed: tāḥ vām dhiyaḥ vase vājayantīḥ ājim na jagmuḥ yuvayūḥ sudānū
translated: Your thoughts, which bring strength, have come to us for help, as to a race, O bountiful ones.

original: śriye na gāva upa somam asthur indraṃ giro varuṇam me manīṣāḥ //
analyzed: śriye na gāvaḥ upa somam asthuḥ indram giraḥ varuṇam me manīṣāḥ
translated: The cows have come to Soma for glory, my thoughts to Indra, to Varuṇa, my songs.

original: imā indraṃ varuṇam me manīṣā agmann upa draviṇam icchamānāḥ /
analyzed: imāḥ indram varuṇam me manīṣāḥ agman upa draviṇam icchamānāḥ
translated: These thoughts of mine have come to Indra, to Varuṇa, seeking wealth.

original: upem asthur joṣṭāra iva vasvo raghvīr iva śravaso bhikṣamāṇāḥ //🔽aśvyasya tmanā rathyasya puṣṭer nityasya rāyaḥ patayaḥ syāma /
analyzed: upa īm asthuḥ joṣṭāraḥ iva vasvaḥ raghvīḥ iva śravasaḥ bhikṣamāṇāḥ  aśvyasya tmanā rathyasya puṣṭeḥ nityasya rāyaḥ patayaḥ syāma
translated: They have come to him, like those who love, like those who seek fame, like those who long for riches.🔽May we be lords of eternal wealth, of wealth that is to be enjoyed by horses and chariots.

original: tā cakrāṇā ūtibhir navyasībhir asmatrā rāyo niyutaḥ sacantām //
analyzed: tā cakrāṇau ūtibhiḥ navyasībhiḥ asmatrā rāyaḥ niyutaḥ sacantām
translated: And may their new aids, their succours, come to us, and their teams attend on riches here.

original: ā no bṛhantā bṛhatībhir ūtī indra yātaṃ varuṇa vājasātau /
analyzed: ā naḥ bṛhantā bṛhatībhiḥ ūtī indra yātam varuṇa vājasātau
translated: Come to us, O ye mighty ones, with mighty aids, O Indra, O Varuṇa, to the winning of strength.

original: yad didyavaḥ pṛtanāsu prakrīḷān tasya vāṃ syāma sanitāra ājeḥ //
analyzed: yat didyavaḥ pṛtanāsu prakrīḍān tasya vām syāma sanitāraḥ ājeḥ
translated: In the battles where the thunderers are eager, may we be the winners of booty, of you two.

original: mama dvitā rāṣṭraṃ kṣatriyasya viśvāyor viśve amṛtā yathā naḥ /
analyzed: mama dvitā rāṣṭram kṣatriyasya viśvāyoḥ viśve amṛtāḥ yathā naḥ
translated: May my kingdom be like the all-supporting heaven, O ye all immortal ones, of the Kshatriya.

original: kratuṃ sacante varuṇasya devā rājāmi kṛṣṭer upamasya vavreḥ //
analyzed: kratum sacante varuṇasya devāḥ rājāmi kṛṣṭeḥ upamasya vavreḥ
translated: The gods attend on the will of Varuṇa, I rule over the people, over the choice of the plough.

original: ahaṃ rājā varuṇo mahyaṃ tāny asuryāṇi prathamā dhārayanta /
analyzed: aham rājā varuṇaḥ mahyam tāni asuryāṇi prathamā dhārayanta
translated: I am king Varuṇa, to me those heavenly (powers) first gave allegiance.

original: kratuṃ sacante varuṇasya devā rājāmi kṛṣṭer upamasya vavreḥ //
analyzed: kratum sacante varuṇasya devāḥ rājāmi kṛṣṭeḥ upamasya vavreḥ
translated: The gods attend on the will of Varuṇa, I rule over the people, over the choice of the plough.

original: aham indro varuṇas te mahitvorvī gabhīre rajasī sumeke /🔽tvaṣṭeva viśvā bhuvanāni vidvān sam airayaṃ rodasī dhārayaṃ ca //
analyzed: aham indraḥ varuṇaḥ te mahitvā urvī gabhīre rajasī sumeke  tvaṣṭā iva viśvā bhuvanāni vidvān sam airayam rodasī dhārayam ca
translated: I am Indra, I am Varuna, with your greatness, the two deep and well-formed realms of the sky.🔽Knowing all things like Tvastr, I have brought together the two worlds and support them.

original: aham apo apinvam ukṣamāṇā dhārayaṃ divaṃ sadana ṛtasya /
analyzed: aham apaḥ apinvam ukṣamāṇāḥ dhārayam divam sadane ṛtasya
translated: I have caused the waters to flow, pouring forth, I support the sky, the seat of truth.

original: ṛtena putro aditer ṛtāvota tridhātu prathayad vi bhūma //
analyzed: ṛtena putraḥ aditeḥ ṛtāvā uta tri dhātu prathayat vi bhūma
translated: By truth, the son of Aditi, by truth, I have extended the three-fold world.

original: māṃ naraḥ svaśvā vājayanto māṃ vṛtāḥ samaraṇe havante /
analyzed: mām naraḥ su aśvāḥ vājayantaḥ mām vṛtāḥ samaraṇe havante
translated: Men with good horses, striving for strength, call on me, I who am surrounded, in the battle.

original: kṛṇomy ājim maghavāham indra iyarmi reṇum abhibhūtyojāḥ //🔽ahaṃ tā viśvā cakaraṃ nakir mā daivyaṃ saho varate apratītam /
analyzed: kṛṇomi ājim maghavā aham indraḥ iyarmi reṇum abhibhūti ojāḥ  aham tā viśvā cakaram nakir mā daivyam sahaḥ varate apratītam
translated: I make the racecourse, I, Indra, the bearer of wealth, I stir up the dust, with power that overcomes.🔽I have done all these things. No one can resist my divine strength.

original: yan mā somāso mamadan yad ukthobhe bhayete rajasī apāre //
analyzed: yat mā somāsaḥ mamadan yat ukthā ubhe bhayete rajasī apāre
translated: When the Soma-pressers have made me joyful, and the hymns, both the boundless realms of the sky tremble.

original: viduṣ ṭe viśvā bhuvanāni tasya tā pra bravīṣi varuṇāya vedhaḥ /
analyzed: viduḥ te viśvā bhuvanāni tasya tā pra bravīṣi varuṇāya vedhaḥ
translated: You know all these things, O wise one, you proclaim them to Varuna.

original: tvaṃ vṛtrāṇi śṛṇviṣe jaghanvān tvaṃ vṛtāṃ ariṇā indra sindhūn //
analyzed: tvam vṛtrāṇi śṛṇviṣe jaghanvān tvam vṛtām ariṇāḥ indra sindhūn
translated: You hear the Vrtras, you who have struck down the Vrtra, you have crossed the rivers, O Indra.

original: asmākam atra pitaras ta āsan sapta ṛṣayo daurgahe badhyamāne /
analyzed: asmākam atra pitaraḥ te āsan sapta ṛṣayaḥ daurgahe badhyamāne
translated: Our fathers were there, the seven Rishis, when the difficult task was being performed.

original: ta āyajanta trasadasyum asyā indraṃ na vṛtraturam ardhadevam //
analyzed: te āyajanta trasadasyum asyāḥ indram na vṛtra turam ardha devam
translated: They worshipped Trasadasyu, the son of this (king), Indra, the half-divine one who conquers Vrtra.

original: purukutsānī hi vām adāśad dhavyebhir indrāvaruṇā namobhiḥ /
analyzed: purukutsānī hi vām adāśat havyebhiḥ indrāvaruṇā namobhiḥ
translated: Purukutsa's son has served you, O Indra and Varuna, with offerings and salutations.

original: athā rājānaṃ trasadasyum asyā vṛtrahaṇaṃ dadathur ardhadevam //
analyzed: athā rājānam trasadasyum asyāḥ vṛtra haṇam dadathuḥ ardha devam
translated: Then you have given the king Trasadasyu, the son of this (king), the half-divine one who slays Vrtra.

original: rāyā vayaṃ sasavāṃso madema havyena devā yavasena gāvaḥ /
analyzed: rāyā vayam sasavāṃsaḥ madema havyena devāḥ yavasena gāvaḥ
translated: Through wealth may we rejoice together, O gods, through oblations, cows through pasture.

original: tāṃ dhenum indrāvaruṇā yuvaṃ no viśvāhā dhattam anapasphurantīm //🔽ka u śravat katamo yajñiyānāṃ vandāru devaḥ katamo juṣāte /🔽kasyemāṃ devīm amṛteṣu preṣṭhāṃ hṛdi śreṣāma suṣṭutiṃ suhavyām //
analyzed: tām dhenum indrāvaruṇāḥ yuvam naḥ viśvāhā dhattam an apasphurantīm  kaḥ u śravat katamaḥ yajñiyānām vandāru devaḥ katamaḥ juṣāte  kasya imām devīm amṛteṣu preṣṭhām hṛdi śreṣāma suṣṭutim su havyām
translated: That cow, O Indra and Varuna, grant to us, always flowing with milk, never failing.🔽Who is famous? Which of the worthy of sacrifice? Which god is the most delightful? Which one accepts?🔽Whose is this divine one, most beloved among the immortals? In whose heart do we place the most acceptable praise?

original: ko mṛḷāti katama āgamiṣṭho devānām u katamaḥ śambhaviṣṭhaḥ /
analyzed: kaḥ mṛḍāti katamaḥ āgamiṣṭhaḥ devānām u katamaḥ śambhaviṣṭhaḥ
translated: Who is the most merciful? Who is the most accessible? Which of the gods is the most auspicious?

original: rathaṃ kam āhur dravadaśvam āśuṃ yaṃ sūryasya duhitāvṛṇīta //
analyzed: ratham kam āhuḥ dravat aśvam āśum yam sūryasya duhitā avṛṇīta
translated: Which chariot do they call swift, drawn by swift horses, which the daughter of the sun has chosen?

original: makṣū hi ṣmā gacchatha īvato dyūn indro na śaktim paritakmyāyām /
analyzed: makṣū hi sma gacchathaḥ īvataḥ dyūn indraḥ na śaktim paritakmyāyām
translated: For you two go quickly to the distant heavens, like Indra to the battle of Pari-takmanya.

original: diva ājātā divyā suparṇā kayā śacīnām bhavathaḥ śaciṣṭhā //
analyzed: divaḥ ājātā divyā suparṇā kayā śacīnām bhavathaḥ śaciṣṭhā
translated: Born from the sky, divine, of good wings, by what power are you the most powerful of the powerful?

original: kā vām bhūd upamātiḥ kayā na āśvinā gamatho hūyamānā /
analyzed: kā vām bhūt upamātiḥ kayā naḥ āśvinā gamathaḥ hūyamānā
translated: What is your most excellent help? By what means, O Aśvins, do you come when invoked?

original: ko vām mahaś cit tyajaso abhīka uruṣyatam mādhvī dasrā na ūtī //
analyzed: kaḥ vām mahaḥ cit tyajasaḥ abhīke uruṣyatam mādhvī dasrā naḥ ūtī
translated: Who of you two, O ye wondrous, sweet to the honey-loving one, will protect us from the most terrible danger?

original: uru vāṃ rathaḥ pari nakṣati dyām ā yat samudrād abhi vartate vām /🔽madhvā mādhvī madhu vām pruṣāyan yat sīṃ vām pṛkṣo bhurajanta pakvāḥ //
analyzed: uru vām rathaḥ pari nakṣati dyām ā yat samudrāt abhi vartate vām  madhvā mādhvī madhu vām pruṣāyan yat sīm vām pṛkṣaḥ bhurajanta pakvāḥ
translated: Wide is your chariot-path that goes round the sky, when it comes to you from the ocean.🔽O ye sweet to the honey-loving one, sprinkling you with honey, when your raw food is being cooked.

original: sindhur ha vāṃ rasayā siñcad aśvān ghṛṇā vayo 'ruṣāsaḥ pari gman /
analyzed: sindhuḥ ha vām rasayā siñcat aśvān ghṛṇāḥ vayaḥ ruṣāsaḥ pari gman
translated: The river, O ye two, with its stream, shall sprinkle your horses, with ghee your ruddy wings, going round the earth.

original: tad ū ṣu vām ajiraṃ ceti yānaṃ yena patī bhavathaḥ sūryāyāḥ //
analyzed: tat u su vām ajiram ceti yānam yena patī bhavathaḥ sūryāyāḥ
translated: That swift chariot of yours, by which ye become the lords of Sūryā, that we invoke.

original: iheha yad vāṃ samanā papṛkṣe seyam asme sumatir vājaratnā /
analyzed: iha iha yat vām samanā sā iyam asme sumatiḥ vāja ratnā
translated: Here, here, what I desire to obtain from you both, this favour of yours, rich in treasure, is for us.

original: uruṣyataṃ jaritāraṃ yuvaṃ ha śritaḥ kāmo nāsatyā yuvadrik //
analyzed: uruṣyatam jaritāram yuvam ha śritaḥ kāmaḥ nāsatyā yuvadrik
translated: Protect ye both the singer, O ye two Nāsatyas, the desire that has come to you for help.

original: taṃ vāṃ rathaṃ vayam adyā huvema pṛthujrayam aśvinā saṃgatiṃ goḥ /
analyzed: tam vām ratham vayam adya ā huvema pṛthujrayam aśvinā saṃgatim goḥ
translated: We will invoke that chariot of yours today, O Aśvins, which is wide-moving, the meeting-place of the cow,

original: yaḥ sūryāṃ vahati vandhurāyur girvāhasam purutamaṃ vasūyum //
analyzed: yaḥ sūryām vahati vandhurāyuḥ gir vāhasam purutamam vasūyum
translated: Which carries Sūryā, the friend, the life, the bearer of songs, the most abundant, the possessor of wealth.

original: yuvaṃ śriyam aśvinā devatā tāṃ divo napātā vanathaḥ śacībhiḥ /
analyzed: yuvam śriyam aśvinā devatā tām divaḥ napātā vanathaḥ śacībhiḥ
translated: That glory, O Aśvins, ye two, O ye who pour rain from the sky, bestow by your powers.

original: yuvor vapur abhi pṛkṣaḥ sacante vahanti yat kakuhāso rathe vām //
analyzed: yuvoḥ vapuḥ abhi pṛkṣaḥ sacante vahanti yat kakuhāsaḥ rathe vām
translated: The drops attend on your form, which the humpbacked ones bear on your chariot.

original: ko vām adyā karate rātahavya ūtaye vā sutapeyāya vārkaiḥ /
analyzed: kaḥ vām adyā karate rāta havyaḥ ūtaye vā suta peyāya vā arkaiḥ
translated: Who will bring you today, O you to whom oblations are offered, for help or to drink the Soma, with praises?

original: ṛtasya vā vanuṣe pūrvyāya namo yemāno aśvinā vavartat //
analyzed: ṛtasya vā vanuṣe pūrvyāya namaḥ yemānaḥ aśvinā vavartat
translated: Or to the ancient observance of truth, the homage offered, O Aśvins, has turned to you.

original: hiraṇyayena purubhū rathenemaṃ yajñaṃ nāsatyopa yātam /
analyzed: hiraṇyayena puru bhū rathena imam yajñam nāsatyā upa yātam
translated: With your golden chariot, O you who are worshipped by many, come to this sacrifice, O Nāsatyas.

original: pibātha in madhunaḥ somyasya dadhatho ratnaṃ vidhate janāya //
analyzed: pibāthaḥ id madhunaḥ somyasya dadhathaḥ ratnam vidhate janāya
translated: Drink this sweet Soma juice, and bestow wealth on the one who offers sacrifices to you.

original: ā no yātaṃ divo acchā pṛthivyā hiraṇyayena suvṛtā rathena /
analyzed: ā naḥ yātam divaḥ acchā pṛthivyāḥ hiraṇyayena suvṛtā rathena
translated: Come to us from heaven and from the earth, with your golden well-constructed chariot.

original: mā vām anye ni yaman devayantaḥ saṃ yad dade nābhiḥ pūrvyā vām //
analyzed: mā vām anye ni yaman devayantaḥ sam yat dade nābhiḥ pūrvyā vām
translated: Let not others who worship the gods obstruct you, for the ancient navel of you two has been given to me.

original: nū no rayim puruvīram bṛhantaṃ dasrā mimāthām ubhayeṣv asme /
analyzed: nu naḥ rayim puru vīram bṛhantam dasrā mimāthām ubhayeṣu asme
translated: Now, O wonder-workers, fashion for us great wealth with many heroes, for both of us.

original: naro yad vām aśvinā stomam āvan sadhastutim ājamīḷhāso agman //🔽iheha yad vāṃ samanā papṛkṣe seyam asme sumatir vājaratnā /
analyzed: naraḥ yat vām aśvinā stomam āvan sadhastutim ājamīḍhāsaḥ agman  iha iha yat vām samanā sā iyam asme sumatiḥ vāja ratnā
translated: When the men, O Aśvins, have come to your praise, to the assembly, to the contest, O you who are to be invoked.🔽Here, here, I have sought you with my mind. This favor of yours, rich in wealth, is for us.

original: uruṣyataṃ jaritāraṃ yuvaṃ ha śritaḥ kāmo nāsatyā yuvadrik //
analyzed: uruṣyatam jaritāram yuvam ha śritaḥ kāmaḥ nāsatyā yuvadrik
translated: Protect the one who praises you, O you two, for the desire that has come to you, O Nāsatyas, is great.

original: eṣa sya bhānur ud iyarti yujyate rathaḥ parijmā divo asya sānavi /
analyzed: eṣa sya bhānuḥ ud iyarti yujyate rathaḥ parijmā divaḥ asya sānavi
translated: This his light rises, the chariot is yoked, the courser on the ridge of heaven.

original: pṛkṣāso asmin mithunā adhi trayo dṛtis turīyo madhuno vi rapśate //
analyzed: pṛkṣāsaḥ asmin mithunāḥ adhi trayaḥ dṛtiḥ turīyaḥ madhunaḥ vi rapśate
translated: Three pairs of oxen are on this (car), the fourth is a leathern bag which bursts with honey.

original: ud vām pṛkṣāso madhumanta īrate rathā aśvāsa uṣaso vyuṣṭiṣu /
analyzed: ud vām pṛkṣāsaḥ madhumantaḥ īrate rathāḥ aśvāsaḥ uṣasaḥ vyuṣṭiṣu
translated: Your oxen, rich in honey, move forward, the chariots, the horses, at the rising of the dawn.

original: aporṇuvantas tama ā parīvṛtaṃ svar ṇa śukraṃ tanvanta ā rajaḥ //🔽madhvaḥ pibatam madhupebhir āsabhir uta priyam madhune yuñjāthāṃ ratham /
analyzed: aporṇuvantaḥ tamaḥ ā parīvṛtam svar na śukram tanvantaḥ ā rajaḥ  madhvaḥ pibatam madhupebhiḥ āsabhiḥ uta priyam madhune yuñjāthām ratham
translated: Uncovering the darkness which surrounds it, you spread out the bright light in the sky.🔽Drink the sweet drink with your beaks which are sweet, and yoke your dear chariot with the sweet drink.

original: ā vartanim madhunā jinvathas patho dṛtiṃ vahethe madhumantam aśvinā //
analyzed: ā vartanim madhunā jinvathaḥ pathaḥ dṛtim vahethe madhumantam aśvinā
translated: You quicken the paths with the sweet drink to the track, and carry the sweet-filled leathern bag, O Asvins.

original: haṃsāso ye vām madhumanto asridho hiraṇyaparṇā uhuva uṣarbudhaḥ /🔽udapruto mandino mandinispṛśo madhvo na makṣaḥ savanāni gacchathaḥ //
analyzed: haṃsāsaḥ ye vām madhumantaḥ asridhaḥ hiraṇya parṇāḥ uhuve uṣarbudhaḥ  uda prutaḥ mandinaḥ mandi nispṛśaḥ madhvaḥ na makṣaḥ savanāni gacchathaḥ
translated: The swans which are yours, sweet, unsoiled, with golden wings, swift to rise at dawn,🔽swift, moving in the water, you go to the libations as bees to the honey.

original: svadhvarāso madhumanto agnaya usrā jarante prati vastor aśvinā /
analyzed: su adhvarāsaḥ madhumantaḥ agnayaḥ usrāḥ jarante prati vastoḥ aśvinā
translated: The hearths are rich in honey, the dawns sing to you, O Asvins, at the break of day.

original: yan niktahastas taraṇir vicakṣaṇaḥ somaṃ suṣāva madhumantam adribhiḥ //
analyzed: yat nikta hastaḥ taraṇiḥ vicakṣaṇaḥ somam suṣāva madhumantam adribhiḥ
translated: When the dexterous, swift, discerning one, with his hands anointed, pressed out the sweet Soma with stones.

original: ākenipāso ahabhir davidhvataḥ svar ṇa śukraṃ tanvanta ā rajaḥ /🔽sūraś cid aśvān yuyujāna īyate viśvāṃ anu svadhayā cetathas pathaḥ //
analyzed: ākenipāsaḥ ahabhiḥ davidhvataḥ svar na śukram tanvantaḥ ā rajaḥ  sūraḥ cit aśvān yuyujānaḥ īyate viśvān anu svadhayā cetathaḥ pathaḥ
translated: The swift ones, with the day-makers, have spread out the bright light in the sky.🔽Even the sun, yoking his horses, moves along, you two, by your own nature, mark out all the paths.

original: pra vām avocam aśvinā dhiyandhā rathaḥ svaśvo ajaro yo asti /
analyzed: pra vām avocam aśvinā dhiyandhāḥ rathaḥ su aśvaḥ ajaraḥ yaḥ asti
translated: I have proclaimed to you, O Aśvins, the thought-guided chariot, which is swift-moving, with good horses, and is undecaying,

original: yena sadyaḥ pari rajāṃsi yātho haviṣmantaṃ taraṇim bhojam accha //
analyzed: yena sadyas pari rajāṃsi yāthaḥ haviṣmantam taraṇim bhojam accha
translated: By which you quickly traverse the realms, to the swift one who offers oblations, to the one who gives food.

original: agram pibā madhūnāṃ sutaṃ vāyo diviṣṭiṣu /
analyzed: agram pibā madhūnām sutam vāyo diviṣṭiṣu
translated: Drink first of the sweet juices pressed, O Vayu, in the sky-reaching sacrifices.

original: tvaṃ hi pūrvapā asi //
analyzed: tvam hi pūrva pāḥ asi
translated: For you are the first drinker.

original: śatenā no abhiṣṭibhir niyutvāṃ indrasārathiḥ /
analyzed: śatena ā naḥ abhiṣṭibhiḥ niyutvān indra sārathiḥ
translated: With a hundred protections, O you who have a thousand, O Indra's charioteer,

original: vāyo sutasya tṛmpatam //
analyzed: vāyo sutasya tṛmpatam
translated: O Vayu, be satisfied with the Soma juice.

original: ā vāṃ sahasraṃ haraya indravāyū abhi prayaḥ /
analyzed: ā vām sahasram harayaḥ indra vāyū abhi prayaḥ
translated: May a thousand tawny horses bring you, O Indra and Vayu, to the offering.

original: vahantu somapītaye //
analyzed: vahantu soma pītaye
translated: Carry us to the drinking of Soma.

original: rathaṃ hiraṇyavandhuram indravāyū svadhvaram /
analyzed: ratham hiraṇya vandhuram indra vāyū su adhvaram
translated: The chariot with a golden seat, O Indra and Vayu, which is well-constructed,

original: ā hi sthātho divispṛśam //
analyzed: ā hi sthāthaḥ divispṛśam
translated: Do you two ascend, which touches the sky.

original: rathena pṛthupājasā dāśvāṃsam upa gacchatam /
analyzed: rathena pṛthu pājasā dāśvāṃsam upa gacchatam
translated: With a chariot of wide splendor, do you two approach the one who offers.

original: indravāyū ihā gatam //
analyzed: indra vāyū iha ā gatam
translated: O Indra and Vayu, come hither.

original: indravāyū ayaṃ sutas taṃ devebhiḥ sajoṣasā /
analyzed: indra vāyū ayam sutaḥ tam devebhiḥ sajoṣasā
translated: O Indra and Vayu, this Soma is pressed; drink it in accord with the gods

original: pibataṃ dāśuṣo gṛhe //
analyzed: pibatam dāśuṣaḥ gṛhe
translated: In the house of the one who offers.

original: iha prayāṇam astu vām indravāyū vimocanam /
analyzed: iha prayāṇam astu vām indra vāyū vimocanam
translated: Here be your starting-point, O Indra and Vayu, for setting free,

original: iha vāṃ somapītaye //
analyzed: iha vām soma pītaye
translated: Here for your drinking of the Soma.

original: vāyo śukro ayāmi te madhvo agraṃ diviṣṭiṣu /
analyzed: vāyo śukraḥ ayāmi te madhvaḥ agram diviṣṭiṣu
translated: O Vayu, I send up to thee the bright, the sweet, the first in the sacrifices in heaven.

original: ā yāhi somapītaye spārho deva niyutvatā //🔽indraś ca vāyav eṣāṃ somānām pītim arhathaḥ /
analyzed: ā yāhi soma pītaye spārhaḥ deva niyutvatā  indraḥ ca vāyo eṣām somānām pītim arhathaḥ
translated: Come hither to drink the Soma, O God, desired, with thy team.🔽O Indra and Vayu, ye are worthy to drink of these Soma-juices.

original: yuvāṃ hi yantīndavo nimnam āpo na sadhryak //
analyzed: yuvām hi yanti indavaḥ nimnam āpaḥ na sadhryak
translated: For the drops of Soma come to you, as the waters to the low-lying place, together.

original: vāyav indraś ca śuṣmiṇā sarathaṃ śavasas patī /
analyzed: vāyo indraḥ ca śuṣmiṇā sa ratham śavasaḥ patī
translated: O Vayu and Indra, ye mighty ones, lords of strength, with your chariot,

original: niyutvantā na ūtaya ā yātaṃ somapītaye //🔽yā vāṃ santi puruspṛho niyuto dāśuṣe narā /🔽asme tā yajñavāhasendravāyū ni yacchatam //
analyzed: niyutvantā naḥ ūtaye ā yātam soma pītaye  yāḥ vām santi puruspṛhaḥ niyutaḥ dāśuṣe narā  asme tā yajña vāhasā indra vāyū ni yacchatam
translated: With your teams, O ye two, come to the drinking of the Soma, for our help.🔽O ye two, O Indra and Vayu, who have many teams, for the worshipper,🔽Bestow on us those (teams), O ye who carry the sacrifice.

original: vihi hotrā avītā vipo na rāyo aryaḥ /
analyzed: vihi hotrāḥ a vītāḥ vipaḥ na rāyaḥ aryaḥ
translated: Open the sacrifices, O ye two, the wealth of the pious, the goods of the enemy.

original: vāyav ā candreṇa rathena yāhi sutasya pītaye //
analyzed: vāyo ā candreṇa rathena yāhi sutasya pītaye
translated: O Vayu, come with thy bright chariot to drink the pressed (Soma).

original: niryuvāṇo aśastīr niyutvāṃ indrasārathiḥ /
analyzed: niryuvāṇaḥ aśastīḥ niyutvān indra sārathiḥ
translated: Freeing from blame, O thou with a team, with Indra as thy charioteer,

original: vāyav ā candreṇa rathena yāhi sutasya pītaye //🔽anu kṛṣṇe vasudhitī yemāte viśvapeśasā /
analyzed: vāyo ā candreṇa rathena yāhi sutasya pītaye  anu kṛṣṇe vasu dhitī yemāte viśva peśasā
translated: O Vayu, come with thy bright chariot to drink the pressed (Soma).🔽Following the two dark (cows), the supporters of wealth, which are spread out in every way,

original: vāyav ā candreṇa rathena yāhi sutasya pītaye //
analyzed: vāyo ā candreṇa rathena yāhi sutasya pītaye
translated: O Vayu, come with thy bright chariot to drink the pressed (Soma).

original: vahantu tvā manoyujo yuktāso navatir nava /
analyzed: vahantu tvā manaḥ yujaḥ yuktāsaḥ navatiḥ nava
translated: Let the yoked ones, yoked by mind, carry you, ninety-nine.

original: vāyav ā candreṇa rathena yāhi sutasya pītaye //
analyzed: vāyo ā candreṇa rathena yāhi sutasya pītaye
translated: O Vayu, come with the chariot of the moon to drink the Soma.

original: vāyo śataṃ harīṇāṃ yuvasva poṣyāṇām /
analyzed: vāyo śatam harīṇām yuvasva poṣyāṇām
translated: O Vayu, yoke thy hundred tawny, nourishing horses.

original: uta vā te sahasriṇo ratha ā yātu pājasā //
analyzed: uta vā te sahasriṇaḥ rathaḥ ā yātu pājasā
translated: Or may thy thousand-spoked chariot come with speed.

original: idaṃ vām āsye haviḥ priyam indrābṛhaspatī /
analyzed: idam vām āsye haviḥ priyam indrābṛhaspatī
translated: This oblation is dear in your mouth, O Indra and Brihaspati,

original: uktham madaś ca śasyate //
analyzed: uktham madaḥ ca śasyate
translated: The hymn and the intoxicating drink are praised.

original: ayaṃ vām pari ṣicyate soma indrābṛhaspatī /
analyzed: ayam vām pari sicyate somaḥ indrābṛhaspatī
translated: This Soma is poured around for you, O Indra and Brihaspati,

original: cārur madāya pītaye //
analyzed: cāruḥ madāya pītaye
translated: Delightful for drinking.

original: ā na indrābṛhaspatī gṛham indraś ca gacchatam /
analyzed: ā naḥ indrābṛhaspatī gṛham indraḥ ca gacchatam
translated: O Indra and Brihaspati, come to our house, O Indra,

original: somapā somapītaye //
analyzed: soma pā soma pītaye
translated: To drink the Soma, O you who drink Soma.

original: asme indrābṛhaspatī rayiṃ dhattaṃ śatagvinam /
analyzed: asme indrābṛhaspatī rayim dhattam śatagvinam
translated: O Indra and Brihaspati, bestow upon us wealth of a hundred kinds,

original: aśvāvantaṃ sahasriṇam //
analyzed: aśvāvantam sahasriṇam
translated: With horses, in thousands.

original: indrābṛhaspatī vayaṃ sute gīrbhir havāmahe /
analyzed: indrābṛhaspatī vayam sute gīrbhiḥ havāmahe
translated: O Indra and Brihaspati, we invoke you with songs at the pressing,

original: asya somasya pītaye //
analyzed: asya somasya pītaye
translated: To drink this Soma.

original: somam indrābṛhaspatī pibataṃ dāśuṣo gṛhe /
analyzed: somam indrābṛhaspatī pibatam dāśuṣaḥ gṛhe
translated: O Indra and Brihaspati, drink the Soma in the house of the worshipper,

original: mādayethāṃ tadokasā //
analyzed: mādayethām tad okasā
translated: To delight you, to that abode.

original: yas tastambha sahasā vi jmo antān bṛhaspatis triṣadhastho raveṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ tastambha sahasā vi jmaḥ antān bṛhaspatiḥ triṣadhasthaḥ raveṇa
translated: He who with might hath propped apart the ends of earth, Brihaspati, the three-times-seven-fold with his roar,

original: tam pratnāsa ṛṣayo dīdhyānāḥ puro viprā dadhire mandrajihvam //
analyzed: tam pratnāsaḥ ṛṣayaḥ dīdhyānāḥ puras viprāḥ dadhire mandra jihvam
translated: The ancient Rishis, meditating, the priests have placed him in the front, the gladdener of the tongue.

original: dhunetayaḥ supraketam madanto bṛhaspate abhi ye nas tatasre /🔽pṛṣantaṃ sṛpram adabdham ūrvam bṛhaspate rakṣatād asya yonim //
analyzed: dhunetayaḥ su praketam madantaḥ bṛhaspate abhi ye naḥ tatasre  pṛṣantam sṛpram adabdham ūrvam bṛhaspate rakṣatāt asya yonim
translated: Those who have assailed us, O Brihaspati, the joyful ones, the well-known ones, the movers,🔽The moist, the all-pervading, the fearless womb, O Brihaspati, protect his birthplace.

original: bṛhaspate yā paramā parāvad ata ā ta ṛtaspṛśo ni ṣeduḥ /
analyzed: bṛhaspate yā paramā parāvat atas ā te ṛta spṛśaḥ ni seduḥ
translated: O Brihaspati, those who have reached the highest, the most distant, the touchers of truth, have sat down.

original: tubhyaṃ khātā avatā adridugdhā madhva ścotanty abhito virapśam //
analyzed: tubhyam khātāḥ avatāḥ adri dugdhāḥ madhvaḥ ścotanti abhitas virapśam
translated: For thee, dug out, pressed out by the stone, the honey-dripping ones flow around the boneless one.

original: bṛhaspatiḥ prathamaṃ jāyamāno maho jyotiṣaḥ parame vyoman /
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ prathamam jāyamānaḥ mahaḥ jyotiṣaḥ parame vyoman
translated: Brihaspati, being born first, in the highest firmament of the great light,

original: saptāsyas tuvijāto raveṇa vi saptaraśmir adhamat tamāṃsi //
analyzed: sapta āsyaḥ tuvi jātaḥ raveṇa vi sapta raśmiḥ adhamat tamāṃsi
translated: The seven-mouthed one, the mighty one, with his radiance, with seven rays, has dispelled the darkness.

original: sa suṣṭubhā sa ṛkvatā gaṇena valaṃ ruroja phaligaṃ raveṇa /
analyzed: sa suṣṭubhā saḥ ṛkvatā gaṇena valam ruroja phaligam raveṇa
translated: He, with the well-praised one, with the Rik-chanting one, with the troop, has shattered Vala and Fligi with his radiance.

original: bṛhaspatir usriyā havyasūdaḥ kanikradad vāvaśatīr ud ājat //
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ usriyāḥ havyasūdaḥ kanikradat vāvaśatīḥ ud ājat
translated: Brihaspati, the invoker of the gods, has risen up with the lowing, the loudly-lowing, the milch cows.

original: evā pitre viśvadevāya vṛṣṇe yajñair vidhema namasā havirbhiḥ /
analyzed: eva pitre viśva devāya vṛṣṇe yajñaiḥ vidhema namasā havirbhiḥ
translated: Thus let us worship with sacrifice, with homage, with oblations, to the father, to the all-god, to the mighty one.

original: bṛhaspate suprajā vīravanto vayaṃ syāma patayo rayīṇām //
analyzed: bṛhaspate su prajāḥ vīravantaḥ vayam syāma patayaḥ rayīṇām
translated: O Brihaspati, may we be prosperous, having good offspring, possessing heroes, lords of wealth.

original: sa id rājā pratijanyāni viśvā śuṣmeṇa tasthāv abhi vīryeṇa /
analyzed: saḥ id rājā pratijanyāni viśvā śuṣmeṇa tasthau abhi vīryeṇa
translated: He is the king of all the people, by his strength, by his heroism he has stood firm.

original: bṛhaspatiṃ yaḥ subhṛtam bibharti valgūyati vandate pūrvabhājam //
analyzed: bṛhaspatim yaḥ su bhṛtam bibharti valgūyati vandate pūrvabhājam
translated: He who supports the well-nourished Brihaspati, who praises and worships him who has the first share.

original: sa it kṣeti sudhita okasi sve tasmā iḷā pinvate viśvadānīm /
analyzed: saḥ id kṣeti sudhite okasi sve tasmai iḷā pinvate viśvadānīm
translated: He dwells happily in his own well-ordered abode; for him the oblation swells at all times.

original: tasmai viśaḥ svayam evā namante yasmin brahmā rājani pūrva eti //
analyzed: tasmai viśaḥ svayam evā namante yasmin brahmā rājani pūrvaḥ eti
translated: To him the people bow of their own accord, in whom the Brahman priest goes forth as the first.

original: apratīto jayati saṃ dhanāni pratijanyāny uta yā sajanyā /
analyzed: apratītaḥ jayati sam dhanāni pratijanyāni uta yā sajanyā
translated: He who is not despised wins the battles and the spoils of war, and those of the people.

original: avasyave yo varivaḥ kṛṇoti brahmaṇe rājā tam avanti devāḥ //
analyzed: avasyave yaḥ varivaḥ kṛṇoti brahmaṇe rājā tam avanti devāḥ
translated: The gods favor the king who makes room for the needy, for the Brahman priest.

original: indraś ca somam pibatam bṛhaspate 'smin yajñe mandasānā vṛṣaṇvasū /
analyzed: indraḥ ca somam pibatam bṛhaspate smin yajñe mandasānā vṛṣaṇvasū
translated: O Indra and Brihaspati, drink the Soma in this sacrifice, being gladdened, O ye of abundant wealth.

original: ā vāṃ viśantv indavaḥ svābhuvo 'sme rayiṃ sarvavīraṃ ni yacchatam //🔽bṛhaspata indra vardhataṃ naḥ sacā sā vāṃ sumatir bhūtv asme /
analyzed: ā vām viśantu indavaḥ su ābhuvaḥ sme rayim sarva vīram ni yacchatam  bṛhaspate indra vardhatam naḥ sacā sā vām sumatiḥ bhūtu asme
translated: Let your own-moving drops enter into you; bestow upon us wealth with all heroes.🔽O Brihaspati and Indra, prosper us together; may your favor be with us.

original: aviṣṭaṃ dhiyo jigṛtam purandhīr jajastam aryo vanuṣām arātīḥ //
analyzed: aviṣṭam dhiyaḥ jigṛtam purandhīḥ jajastam aryaḥ vanuṣām arātīḥ
translated: Inspire our thoughts, O ye of great wisdom; destroy the evil designs of our enemies.

original: idam u tyat purutamam purastāj jyotis tamaso vayunāvad asthāt /
analyzed: idam u tyad purutamam purastāt jyotiḥ tamasaḥ vayunāvat asthāt
translated: This light hath shone forth, the most ancient, out of the darkness,

original: nūnaṃ divo duhitaro vibhātīr gātuṃ kṛṇavann uṣaso janāya //
analyzed: nūnam divaḥ duhitaraḥ vibhātīḥ gātum kṛṇavan uṣasaḥ janāya
translated: Surely the daughters of the sky, the shining ones, have made a way for the people to the dawns.

original: asthur u citrā uṣasaḥ purastān mitā iva svaravo 'dhvareṣu /🔽vy ū vrajasya tamaso dvārocchantīr avrañ chucayaḥ pāvakāḥ //🔽ucchantīr adya citayanta bhojān rādhodeyāyoṣaso maghonīḥ /
analyzed: asthuḥ u citrāḥ uṣasaḥ purastāt mitāḥ iva svaravaḥ dhvareṣu  vi ū vrajasya tamasaḥ dvārā ucchantīḥ avram śucayaḥ pāvakāḥ  ucchantīḥ adya citayanta bhojān rādhaḥ deyāya uṣasaḥ maghonīḥ
translated: The wondrous dawns have stood forth in front, like posts measured out at the sacrifices.🔽The pure, purifying ones have gone forth, the doors of the cowpen from the darkness, shining.🔽Shining today, the bountiful dawns, rich in gifts, are preparing the food for the one who brings the gift.

original: acitre antaḥ paṇayaḥ sasantv abudhyamānās tamaso vimadhye //
analyzed: acitre antar paṇayaḥ sasantu a budhyamānāḥ tamasaḥ vimadhye
translated: Let the merchants be in the indistinct middle of the night, asleep, in the midst of darkness.

original: kuvit sa devīḥ sanayo navo vā yāmo babhūyād uṣaso vo adya /
analyzed: kuvid sa devīḥ sanayaḥ navaḥ vā yāmaḥ babhūyāt uṣasaḥ vaḥ adya
translated: Has he become a new or old messenger for you, O goddesses, this day, O dawns?

original: yenā navagve aṅgire daśagve saptāsye revatī revad ūṣa //
analyzed: yena navagve aṅgire daśagve sapta āsye revatī revat ūṣa
translated: By whom to Navagva, Angiras, Dasagva, Saptasya, the prosperous ones, O prosperous dawns.

original: yūyaṃ hi devīr ṛtayugbhir aśvaiḥ pariprayātha bhuvanāni sadyaḥ /
analyzed: yūyam hi devīḥ ṛta yugbhiḥ aśvaiḥ pariprayātha bhuvanāni sadyas
translated: For you, indeed, O goddesses, with your yoke-fellow horses, go around the worlds in a moment.

original: prabodhayantīr uṣasaḥ sasantaṃ dvipāc catuṣpāc carathāya jīvam //
analyzed: prabodhayantīḥ uṣasaḥ sasantam dvipād catuṣpād carathāya jīvam
translated: The dawns, waking up the existing, biped and quadruped, for the sake of movement and life.

original: kva svid āsāṃ katamā purāṇī yayā vidhānā vidadhur ṛbhūṇām /
analyzed: kva svid āsām katamā purāṇī yayā vidhānā vidadhuḥ ṛbhūṇām
translated: Where, indeed, are those, which of them is the oldest, by which the Rbhus have established the ordinances?

original: śubhaṃ yac chubhrā uṣasaś caranti na vi jñāyante sadṛśīr ajuryāḥ //
analyzed: śubham yat śubhrāḥ uṣasaḥ caranti na vi jñāyante sadṛśīḥ ajuryāḥ
translated: The auspicious thing that the auspicious dawns do, they are not known to be similar, without old age.

original: tā ghā tā bhadrā uṣasaḥ purāsur abhiṣṭidyumnā ṛtajātasatyāḥ /
analyzed: tāḥ gha tāḥ bhadrāḥ uṣasaḥ purā āsuḥ abhiṣṭi dyumnāḥ ṛta jāta satyāḥ
translated: Those are the auspicious dawns of old, the glory-giving, truth-born, true ones.

original: yāsv ījānaḥ śaśamāna ukthai stuvañ chaṃsan draviṇaṃ sadya āpa //
