analyzed: yāsu ījānaḥ śaśamānaḥ ukthaiḥ stuvam chaṃsan draviṇam sadyas āpa
translated: In which the worshipper, striving, with hymns, praising, singing, quickly obtains wealth.

original: tā ā caranti samanā purastāt samānataḥ samanā paprathānāḥ /
analyzed: tāḥ ā caranti samanā purastāt samānatas samanā paprathānāḥ
translated: They come together in the east, in unison, from the same place, spreading in unison.

original: ṛtasya devīḥ sadaso budhānā gavāṃ na sargā uṣaso jarante //🔽tā in nv eva samanā samānīr amītavarṇā uṣasaś caranti /
analyzed: ṛtasya devīḥ sadasaḥ budhānāḥ gavām na sargāḥ uṣasaḥ jarante  tāḥ id nu eva samanā samānīḥ amīta varṇāḥ uṣasaḥ caranti
translated: The goddesses of truth, the finders of the seat, the dawns sing like the streams of milk.🔽These very dawns come together, of the same hue, of the same color, moving in unison.

original: gūhantīr abhvam asitaṃ ruśadbhiḥ śukrās tanūbhiḥ śucayo rucānāḥ //
analyzed: gūhantīḥ abhvam asitam ruśadbhiḥ śukrāḥ tanūbhiḥ śucayaḥ rucānāḥ
translated: Concealing the fearful darkness with the ruddy ones, the bright ones, shining with pure bodies.

original: rayiṃ divo duhitaro vibhātīḥ prajāvantaṃ yacchatāsmāsu devīḥ /
analyzed: rayim divaḥ duhitaraḥ vibhātīḥ prajāvantam yacchata asmāsu devīḥ
translated: O daughters of heaven, the shining ones, grant us wealth with offspring, O goddesses.

original: syonād ā vaḥ pratibudhyamānāḥ suvīryasya patayaḥ syāma //🔽tad vo divo duhitaro vibhātīr upa bruva uṣaso yajñaketuḥ /
analyzed: syonāt ā vaḥ pratibudhyamānāḥ su vīryasya patayaḥ syāma  tat vaḥ divaḥ duhitaraḥ vibhātīḥ upa bruve uṣasaḥ yajña ketuḥ
translated: May we be the lords of good heroism, O you who are being awakened from the auspicious.🔽To you, O daughters of heaven, the shining ones, I address this, O dawns, the banner of the sacrifice.

original: vayaṃ syāma yaśaso janeṣu tad dyauś ca dhattām pṛthivī ca devī //
analyzed: vayam syāma yaśasaḥ janeṣu tat dyauḥ ca dhattām pṛthivī ca devī
translated: May we be famous among the people, may Dyaus and the goddess Earth grant this.

original: prati ṣyā sūnarī janī vyucchantī pari svasuḥ /
analyzed: prati syā sūnarī janī vyucchantī pari svasuḥ
translated: The beautiful young woman, the daughter, rising, around her sister,

original: divo adarśi duhitā //
analyzed: divaḥ adarśi duhitā
translated: The daughter of heaven is seen.

original: aśveva citrāruṣī mātā gavām ṛtāvarī /
analyzed: aśvā iva citrā aruṣī mātā gavām ṛtāvarī
translated: Like a horse, the wondrous mother of the cows, the one who brings truth,

original: sakhābhūd aśvinor uṣāḥ //
analyzed: sakhā abhūt aśvinoḥ uṣāḥ
translated: Has become the friend of the Ashvins, Dawn.

original: uta sakhāsy aśvinor uta mātā gavām asi /
analyzed: uta sakhā asi aśvinoḥ uta mātā gavām asi
translated: And you are the friend of the Ashvins, and the mother of the cows,

original: utoṣo vasva īśiṣe //
analyzed: uta uṣaḥ vasvaḥ īśiṣe
translated: And, O Dawn, you rule over wealth.

original: yāvayaddveṣasaṃ tvā cikitvit sūnṛtāvari /
analyzed: yāvayat dveṣasam tvā cikitvit sūnṛtāvari
translated: We have remembered you, O you who remove hatred, with our thoughts, O you who bring good things,

original: prati stomair abhutsmahi //🔽prati bhadrā adṛkṣata gavāṃ sargā na raśmayaḥ /
analyzed: prati stomaiḥ abhutsmahi  prati bhadrāḥ adṛkṣata gavām sargāḥ na raśmayaḥ
translated: With our praises.🔽The auspicious ones have been seen, the streams of milk, like rays,

original: oṣā aprā uru jrayaḥ //
analyzed: oṣāḥ aprāḥ uru jrayaḥ
translated: Dawn has spread out her vast path.

original: āpapruṣī vibhāvari vy āvar jyotiṣā tamaḥ /
analyzed: āpapruṣī vibhāvari vi āvaḥ jyotiṣā tamaḥ
translated: The one who rains, the one who shines, has dispelled the darkness with her light,

original: uṣo anu svadhām ava //🔽ā dyāṃ tanoṣi raśmibhir āntarikṣam uru priyam /
analyzed: uṣaḥ anu svadhām ava  ā dyām tanoṣi raśmibhiḥ ā antarikṣam uru priyam
translated: Dawn has come according to her own nature.🔽You extend the sky with your rays, the vast and beloved atmosphere,

original: uṣaḥ śukreṇa śociṣā //
analyzed: uṣaḥ śukreṇa śociṣā
translated: Dawn with your bright radiance.

original: tad devasya savitur vāryam mahad vṛṇīmahe asurasya pracetasaḥ /
analyzed: tat devasya savituḥ vāryam mahat vṛṇīmahe asurasya pracetasaḥ
translated: That is the great and excellent deed of Savitar the God, the Asura, the wise one,

original: chardir yena dāśuṣe yacchati tmanā tan no mahāṃ ud ayān devo aktubhiḥ //🔽divo dhartā bhuvanasya prajāpatiḥ piśaṅgaṃ drāpim prati muñcate kaviḥ /
analyzed: chardiḥ yena dāśuṣe yacchati tmanā tat naḥ mahān ud ayān devaḥ aktubhiḥ  divaḥ dhartā bhuvanasya prajāpatiḥ piśaṅgam drāpim prati muñcate kaviḥ
translated: By which he grants to the worshipper his own bounty. May that great God exalt us with his rays.🔽The supporter of the sky, the lord of the world, the creator, the wise one, throws off the tawny robe.

original: vicakṣaṇaḥ prathayann āpṛṇann urv ajījanat savitā sumnam ukthyam //
analyzed: vicakṣaṇaḥ prathayan āpṛṇan uru ajījanat savitā sumnam ukthyam
translated: The all-seeing one, extending and filling the vast expanse, Savitar has generated the praiseworthy bliss.

original: āprā rajāṃsi divyāni pārthivā ślokaṃ devaḥ kṛṇute svāya dharmaṇe /🔽pra bāhū asrāk savitā savīmani niveśayan prasuvann aktubhir jagat //
analyzed: āprāḥ rajāṃsi divyāni pārthivā ślokam devaḥ kṛṇute svāya dharmaṇe  pra bāhū asrāk savitā savīmani niveśayan prasuvan aktubhiḥ jagat
translated: He hath filled the heavenly and earthly spaces. The God Savitar creates the hymn for his own worship.🔽He hath stretched forth his arms in the act of creation, establishing the world, quickening it with his rays.

original: adābhyo bhuvanāni pracākaśad vratāni devaḥ savitābhi rakṣate /
analyzed: adābhyaḥ bhuvanāni pracākaśat vratāni devaḥ savitā abhi rakṣate
translated: The infallible God Savitar hath looked on the worlds. The God Savitar guardeth his own ordinances.

original: prāsrāg bāhū bhuvanasya prajābhyo dhṛtavrato maho ajmasya rājati //
analyzed: prāsrāk bāhū bhuvanasya prajābhyaḥ dhṛtavrataḥ mahaḥ ajmasya rājati
translated: He hath stretched forth his arms to the people of the world. He who keepeth his own ordinances, ruleth over the great people.

original: trir antarikṣaṃ savitā mahitvanā trī rajāṃsi paribhus trīṇi rocanā /
analyzed: tris antarikṣam savitā mahitvanā trī rajāṃsi paribhuḥ trīṇi rocanā
translated: Savitar hath thrice filled the atmosphere with his greatness, three regions, three lights.

original: tisro divaḥ pṛthivīs tisra invati tribhir vratair abhi no rakṣati tmanā //
analyzed: tisraḥ divaḥ pṛthivīḥ tisraḥ invati tribhiḥ vrataiḥ abhi naḥ rakṣati tmanā
translated: He impelleth three heavens and three earths with his three ordinances. He guardeth us with his own three ordinances.

original: bṛhatsumnaḥ prasavītā niveśano jagata sthātur ubhayasya yo vaśī /🔽sa no devaḥ savitā śarma yacchatv asme kṣayāya trivarūtham aṃhasaḥ //🔽āgan deva ṛtubhir vardhatu kṣayaṃ dadhātu naḥ savitā suprajām iṣam /
analyzed: bṛhat sumnaḥ prasavītā niveśanaḥ jagataḥ sthātuḥ ubhayasya yaḥ vaśī  sa naḥ devaḥ savitā śarma yacchatu asme kṣayāya tri varūtham aṃhasaḥ  āgan devaḥ ṛtubhiḥ vardhatu kṣayam dadhātu naḥ savitā su prajām iṣam
translated: He who is the lord of both the moving and the unmoving world, the impeller, the establisher, the bestower of great bliss,🔽may that God Savitar grant us protection, a threefold refuge from affliction, for our abode.🔽The God Savitar hath come with the seasons. Let him increase our substance. Let Savitar grant us food with good offspring.

original: sa naḥ kṣapābhir ahabhiś ca jinvatu prajāvantaṃ rayim asme sam invatu //
analyzed: sa naḥ kṣapābhiḥ ahabhiḥ ca jinvatu prajāvantam rayim asme sam invatu
translated: Let him quicken us with the nights and days. Let him impel to us wealth with offspring.

original: abhūd devaḥ savitā vandyo nu na idānīm ahna upavācyo nṛbhiḥ /
analyzed: abhūt devaḥ savitā vandyaḥ nu naḥ idānīm ahnaḥ upavācyaḥ nṛbhiḥ
translated: Savitar, the God, was to be worshipped in the days of old, and now must be invoked by men in the day.

original: vi yo ratnā bhajati mānavebhyaḥ śreṣṭhaṃ no atra draviṇaṃ yathā dadhat //
analyzed: vi yaḥ ratnā bhajati mānavebhyaḥ śreṣṭham naḥ atra draviṇam yathā dadhat
translated: He who allots to men their treasures, grant us here the best and noblest wealth.

original: devebhyo hi prathamaṃ yajñiyebhyo 'mṛtatvaṃ suvasi bhāgam uttamam /
analyzed: devebhyaḥ hi prathamam yajñiyebhyaḥ mṛta tvam suvasi bhāgam uttamam
translated: For to the Gods first, to the Gods who claim our worship, he allots immortal life, the highest share.

original: ād id dāmānaṃ savitar vy ūrṇuṣe 'nūcīnā jīvitā mānuṣebhyaḥ //
analyzed: āt id dāmānam savitar vi ūrṇuṣe nūcīnā jīvitā mānuṣebhyaḥ
translated: Then, O Savitar, thou sendest forth the gift of life to men, one after another, to the sons of men.

original: acittī yac cakṛmā daivye jane dīnair dakṣaiḥ prabhūtī pūruṣatvatā /
analyzed: acittī yat cakṛma daivye jane dīnaiḥ dakṣaiḥ prabhūtī pūruṣatvatā
translated: When we have sinned against the host of Gods, we, the poor, the feeble, the many, the men,

original: deveṣu ca savitar mānuṣeṣu ca tvaṃ no atra suvatād anāgasaḥ //
analyzed: deveṣu ca savitar mānuṣeṣu ca tvam naḥ atra suvatāt anāgasaḥ
translated: In the Gods, O Savitar, and among men, do thou make us here free from sin and guilt.

original: na pramiye savitur daivyasya tad yathā viśvam bhuvanaṃ dhārayiṣyati /🔽yat pṛthivyā varimann ā svaṅgurir varṣman divaḥ suvati satyam asya tat //
analyzed: na pramiye savituḥ daivyasya tat yathā viśvam bhuvanam dhārayiṣyati  yat pṛthivyāḥ variman ā su aṅguriḥ varṣman divaḥ suvati satyam asya tat
translated: Not to be despised is the divine Savitar, since he will rule over the whole world.🔽What time the mighty one, the far-extending one, the wide one, the high one, the true one, rules over the wide room of earth and the height of heaven, that is his truth.

original: indrajyeṣṭhān bṛhadbhyaḥ parvatebhyaḥ kṣayāṃ ebhyaḥ suvasi pastyāvataḥ /
analyzed: indra jyeṣṭhān bṛhadbhyaḥ parvatebhyaḥ kṣayām ebhyaḥ suvasi pastyāvataḥ
translated: From the mountains, the highest, the great, the firm, from these abodes, O thou who art to be praised in the house, thou sendest forth.

original: yathāyathā patayanto viyemira evaiva tasthuḥ savitaḥ savāya te //
analyzed: yathā yathā patayantaḥ viyemire eva eva tasthuḥ savitar savāya te
translated: As they, the flying ones, are scattered in different directions, so they have stood still, O Savitar, for thy worship.

original: ye te trir ahan savitaḥ savāso divedive saubhagam āsuvanti /
analyzed: ye te tris ahan savitar savāsaḥ dive dive saubhagam āsuvanti
translated: Those who, O Savitar, thrice a day, with their garments, send down prosperity day by day,

original: indro dyāvāpṛthivī sindhur adbhir ādityair no aditiḥ śarma yaṃsat //
analyzed: indraḥ dyāvāpṛthivī sindhuḥ adbhiḥ ādityaiḥ naḥ aditiḥ śarma yaṃsat
translated: May Indra, Heaven and Earth, the sea with the waters, and Aditi with the Adityas, grant us protection.

original: ko vas trātā vasavaḥ ko varūtā dyāvābhūmī adite trāsīthāṃ naḥ /
analyzed: kaḥ vaḥ trātā vasavaḥ kaḥ varūtā dyāvābhūmī adite trāsīthām naḥ
translated: Who is your protector, O Vasus? Who your defender? O Heaven and Earth, O Aditi, protect us.

original: sahīyaso varuṇa mitra martāt ko vo 'dhvare varivo dhāti devāḥ //
analyzed: sahīyasaḥ varuṇa mitra martāt kaḥ vaḥ dhvare varivaḥ dhāti devāḥ
translated: More powerful than mortal man, O Varuṇa and Mitra, who among you, O gods, bestows favour in our sacrifice?

original: pra ye dhāmāni pūrvyāṇy arcān vi yad ucchān viyotāro amūrāḥ /🔽vidhātāro vi te dadhur ajasrā ṛtadhītayo rurucanta dasmāḥ //
analyzed: pra ye dhāmāni pūrvyāṇi arcān vi yat ucchān viyotāraḥ amūrāḥ  vidhātāraḥ vi te ajasrāḥ ṛta dhītayaḥ rurucanta dasmāḥ
translated: Those who, with their ancient abodes, with their hymns, have risen up, the unerring inspirers,🔽The all-pervading ones have established your eternal ordinances. The wondrous ones shine forth, the worshippers of holy order.

original: pra pastyām aditiṃ sindhum arkaiḥ svastim īḷe sakhyāya devīm /
analyzed: pra pastyām aditim sindhum arkaiḥ svastim īḍe sakhyāya devīm
translated: I praise Aditi, the protectress, the river, in the dwelling, with hymns, the goddess, for friendship.

original: ubhe yathā no ahanī nipāta uṣāsānaktā karatām adabdhe //
analyzed: ubhe yathā naḥ ahanī nipātaḥ uṣāsānaktā karatām adabdhe
translated: May the two days, as it were, for us, the morning and night, the infallible ones, bring (us) good fortune.

original: vy aryamā varuṇaś ceti panthām iṣas patiḥ suvitaṃ gātum agniḥ /
analyzed: vi aryamā varuṇaḥ ceti panthām iṣaḥ patiḥ suvitam gātum agniḥ
translated: Aryaman and Varuna have opened the path. The lord of food, Agni, has made the way easy.

original: indrāviṣṇū nṛvad u ṣu stavānā śarma no yantam amavad varūtham //
analyzed: indrāviṣṇū nṛvat u su stavānā śarma naḥ yantam amavat varūtham
translated: Indra and Vishnu, when praised like men, may they come to us for protection, for shelter, free from sin.

original: ā parvatasya marutām avāṃsi devasya trātur avri bhagasya /
analyzed: ā parvatasya marutām avāṃsi devasya trātuḥ avri bhagasya
translated: The sides of the mountain, the Maruts, the protection of the god Trita, the favour of Bhaga,

original: pāt patir janyād aṃhaso no mitro mitriyād uta na uruṣyet //
analyzed: pāt patiḥ janyāt aṃhasaḥ naḥ mitraḥ mitriyāt uta naḥ uruṣyet
translated: May the Lord of the house protect us from the kinsman's woe, and Mitra from the friend's. May he preserve us.

original: nū rodasī ahinā budhnyena stuvīta devī apyebhir iṣṭaiḥ /
analyzed: nu rodasī ahinā budhnyena stuvīta devī apyebhiḥ iṣṭaiḥ
translated: Now let the two worlds, the divine, be praised with these, the desired, the worshipped, with the deep-voiced serpent.

original: samudraṃ na saṃcaraṇe saniṣyavo gharmasvaraso nadyo apa vran //
analyzed: samudram na saṃcaraṇe saniṣyavaḥ gharma svarasaḥ nadyaḥ apa vran
translated: Like rivers seeking the ocean, the place of meeting, the warm-voiced, have flowed to the ocean.

original: devair no devy aditir ni pātu devas trātā trāyatām aprayucchan /
analyzed: devaiḥ naḥ devī aditiḥ ni pātu devaḥ trātā trāyatām aprayucchan
translated: May the Goddess Aditi, the Goddess with the Gods, protect us. May the God, the protector, protect us, the watchful.

original: nahi mitrasya varuṇasya dhāsim arhāmasi pramiyaṃ sānv agneḥ //
analyzed: nahi mitrasya varuṇasya dhāsim arhāmasi pramiyam sānū agneḥ
translated: For we are not worthy of the favour, the love, of Mitra, Varuna, and Agni.

original: agnir īśe vasavyasyāgnir mahaḥ saubhagasya /
analyzed: agniḥ īśe vasavyasya agniḥ mahaḥ saubhagasya
translated: Agni is the lord of wealth, Agni of great good fortune.

original: tāny asmabhyaṃ rāsate //
analyzed: tāni asmabhyam rāsate
translated: May he grant us those things.

original: uṣo maghony ā vaha sūnṛte vāryā puru /🔽asmabhyaṃ vājinīvati //
analyzed: uṣaḥ maghoni ā vaha sūnṛte vāryā puru  asmabhyam vājinīvati
translated: O Ushas, bring us riches, O bountiful one, many good things.🔽To us, O you who are rich in treasures.

original: tat su naḥ savitā bhago varuṇo mitro aryamā /
analyzed: tat su naḥ savitā bhagaḥ varuṇaḥ mitraḥ aryamā
translated: May that Savitar, Bhaga, Varuna, Mitra, Aryaman,

original: indro no rādhasā gamat //🔽mahī dyāvāpṛthivī iha jyeṣṭhe rucā bhavatāṃ śucayadbhir arkaiḥ /
analyzed: indraḥ naḥ rādhasā gamat  mahī dyāvāpṛthivī iha jyeṣṭhe rucā bhavatām śocayadbhiḥ arkaiḥ
translated: May Indra come to us with bounty.🔽O great Dyaus and Prithivī, be here the most excellent with your shining lights.

original: yat sīṃ variṣṭhe bṛhatī viminvan ruvad dhokṣā paprathānebhir evaiḥ //
analyzed: yat sīm variṣṭhe bṛhatī viminvan ruvat dhokṣā paprathānebhiḥ evaiḥ
translated: When you, the most spacious, the great, are set in motion, the roaring bull moves with these spreading ones.

original: devī devebhir yajate yajatrair aminatī tasthatur ukṣamāṇe /
analyzed: devī devebhiḥ yajate yajatraiḥ a minatī tasthatuḥ ukṣamāṇe
translated: The Goddess, with the Gods, the worshippers, not transgressing, stands at the two pouring ones.

original: ṛtāvarī adruhā devaputre yajñasya netrī śucayadbhir arkaiḥ //
analyzed: ṛtāvarī adruhā deva putre yajñasya netrī śucayadbhiḥ arkaiḥ
translated: The truthful one, free from guile, the daughter of the gods, the leader of the sacrifice, with her pure rays.

original: sa it svapā bhuvaneṣv āsa ya ime dyāvāpṛthivī jajāna /
analyzed: saḥ id su apāḥ bhuvaneṣu āsa yaḥ ime dyāvāpṛthivī jajāna
translated: He who created these two worlds, the heaven and the earth, is indeed the self-moving one in the worlds.

original: urvī gabhīre rajasī sumeke avaṃśe dhīraḥ śacyā sam airat //
analyzed: urvī gabhīre rajasī sumeke a vaṃśe dhīraḥ śacyā sam airat
translated: The wise one, with his power, has united the two vast, deep, well-formed spaces in the two halves.

original: nū rodasī bṛhadbhir no varūthaiḥ patnīvadbhir iṣayantī sajoṣāḥ /
analyzed: nu rodasī bṛhadbhiḥ naḥ varūthaiḥ patnīvadbhiḥ iṣayantī sajoṣāḥ
translated: Now the two worlds, with their great protections, like two wives, bestowing food, in accord,

original: urūcī viśve yajate ni pātaṃ dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ //
analyzed: urūcī viśve yajate ni pātam dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ
translated: May we be, with our thought, ever-victorious, the charioteers of the two vast ones who sacrifice to all.

original: pra vām mahi dyavī abhy upastutim bharāmahe /
analyzed: pra vām mahi abhī upastutim bharāmahe
translated: We bring to you, O you two great ones, the praise that is due to you,

original: śucī upa praśastaye //🔽punāne tanvā mithaḥ svena dakṣeṇa rājathaḥ /
analyzed: śucī upa praśastaye  punāne tanvā mithas svena dakṣeṇa rājathaḥ
translated: The pure ones, for the sake of praise.🔽Purifying yourselves mutually with your own power, you two rule.

original: ūhyāthe sanād ṛtam //
analyzed: ūhyāthe sanāt ṛtam
translated: You two carry the eternal truth from of old.

original: mahī mitrasya sādhathas tarantī pipratī ṛtam /
analyzed: mahī mitrasya sādhathaḥ tarantī pipratī ṛtam
translated: You two accomplish the great deed of Mitra, crossing over and fulfilling the truth.

original: pari yajñaṃ ni ṣedathuḥ //🔽kṣetrasya patinā vayaṃ hiteneva jayāmasi /🔽gām aśvam poṣayitnv ā sa no mṛḷātīdṛśe //
analyzed: pari yajñam ni sedathuḥ  kṣetrasya patinā vayam hitena iva jayāmasi  gām aśvam poṣayitnu ā sa naḥ mṛḷāti īdṛśe
translated: You two sit down around the sacrifice.🔽We conquer with the lord of the field, as if with a friend.🔽May he, the nourisher, increase our cattle and horses. May he be gracious to us in this matter.

original: kṣetrasya pate madhumantam ūrmiṃ dhenur iva payo asmāsu dhukṣva /
analyzed: kṣetrasya pate madhumantam ūrmim dhenuḥ iva payaḥ asmāsu dhukṣva
translated: O lord of the field, for us, like a milch cow, milk the sweet wave,

original: madhuścutaṃ ghṛtam iva supūtam ṛtasya naḥ patayo mṛḷayantu //
analyzed: madhuścutam ghṛtam iva su pūtam ṛtasya naḥ patayaḥ mṛḍayantu
translated: The honey-dripping, well-purified ghee, may the lords of truth be gracious to us.

original: madhumatīr oṣadhīr dyāva āpo madhuman no bhavatv antarikṣam /
analyzed: madhumatīḥ oṣadhīḥ dyāvaḥ āpaḥ madhumat naḥ bhavatu antarikṣam
translated: May the plants be rich in honey, the heavens and the waters, may the atmosphere be rich in honey for us.

original: kṣetrasya patir madhumān no astv ariṣyanto anv enaṃ carema //🔽śunaṃ vāhāḥ śunaṃ naraḥ śunaṃ kṛṣatu lāṅgalam /
analyzed: kṣetrasya patiḥ madhumān naḥ astu a riṣyantaḥ anu enam carema  śunam vāhāḥ śunam naraḥ śunam kṛṣatu lāṅgalam
translated: May the lord of the field be rich in honey for us, may we follow him without enmity.🔽Good are the oxen, good are the men, good is the plough that is ploughed.

original: śunaṃ varatrā badhyantāṃ śunam aṣṭrām ud iṅgaya //
analyzed: śunam varatrāḥ badhyantām śunam aṣṭrām ud iṅgaya
translated: Good are the thongs that are bound, good is the ploughshare that is raised.

original: śunāsīrāv imāṃ vācaṃ juṣethāṃ yad divi cakrathuḥ payaḥ /
analyzed: śunāsīrau imām vācam juṣethām yat divi cakrathuḥ payaḥ
translated: O Shunah-shepards, accept this speech of ours, the milk that ye have made in heaven.

original: tenemām upa siñcatam //
analyzed: tena imām upa siñcatam
translated: Therewith do ye sprinkle this (earth) for us.

original: arvācī subhage bhava sīte vandāmahe tvā /
analyzed: arvācī subhage bhava sīte vandāmahe tvā
translated: O Sita, be propitious to us, we worship thee.

original: yathā naḥ subhagāsasi yathā naḥ suphalāsasi //
analyzed: yathā naḥ subhagā asasi yathā naḥ su phalā asasi
translated: That thou mayst be propitious to us, that thou mayst be fruitful for us.

original: indraḥ sītāṃ ni gṛhṇātu tām pūṣānu yacchatu /🔽sā naḥ payasvatī duhām uttarāmuttarāṃ samām //🔽śunaṃ naḥ phālā vi kṛṣantu bhūmiṃ śunaṃ kīnāśā abhi yantu vāhaiḥ /
analyzed: indraḥ sītām ni gṛhṇātu tām pūṣā anu yacchatu  sā naḥ payasvatī duhām uttarām uttarām samām  śunam naḥ phālāḥ vi kṛṣantu bhūmim śunam kīnāśāḥ abhi yantu vāhaiḥ
translated: May Indra seize hold of Sita, may Pusan follow her.🔽May she yield milk for us, may she yield milk for the next and the next year.🔽May the ploughs make good furrows in the ground for us, may the ploughmen go well with their teams.

original: śunam parjanyo madhunā payobhiḥ śunāsīrā śunam asmāsu dhattam //
analyzed: śunam parjanyaḥ madhunā payobhiḥ śunāsīrā śunam asmāsu dhattam
translated: May Parjanya with honey and milk, O Shunah-shepards, bestow good things on us.

original: samudrād ūrmir madhumāṃ ud ārad upāṃśunā sam amṛtatvam ānaṭ /
analyzed: samudrāt ūrmiḥ madhumān ud ārat upāṃśunā sam amṛta tvam ānaṭ
translated: From the ocean the sweet wave hath risen up, and hath attained immortality with the Upamsu.

original: ghṛtasya nāma guhyaṃ yad asti jihvā devānām amṛtasya nābhiḥ //
analyzed: ghṛtasya nāma guhyam yat asti jihvā devānām amṛtasya nābhiḥ
translated: The secret name of ghee, which is, is the tongue, the navel of the immortal gods.

original: vayaṃ nāma pra bravāmā ghṛtasyāsmin yajñe dhārayāmā namobhiḥ /
analyzed: vayam nāma pra bravāma ghṛtasya asmin yajñe dhārayāma namobhiḥ
translated: We proclaim the name of ghee in this sacrifice with offerings and adorations.

original: upa brahmā śṛṇavac chasyamānaṃ catuḥśṛṅgo 'vamīd gaura etat //
analyzed: upa brahmā śṛṇavat śasyamānam catur śṛṅgaḥ vamīt gauraḥ etat
translated: Let the Brahman hear what is being praised: the bull hath brought forth this with four horns.

original: catvāri śṛṅgā trayo asya pādā dve śīrṣe sapta hastāso asya /
analyzed: catvāri śṛṅgā trayaḥ asya pādāḥ dve śīrṣe sapta hastāsaḥ asya
translated: It hath four horns, three are its feet, two its heads, and seven its hands.

original: tridhā baddho vṛṣabho roravīti maho devo martyāṃ ā viveśa //
analyzed: tridhā baddhaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ roravīti mahaḥ devaḥ martyān ā viveśa
translated: Bound in three places, the bull bel lows: the great god hath entered into men.

original: tridhā hitam paṇibhir guhyamānaṃ gavi devāso ghṛtam anv avindan /
analyzed: tridhā hitam paṇibhiḥ guhyamānam gavi devāsaḥ ghṛtam anu avindan
translated: The gods found ghee in the cow, divided into three parts, concealed by the Paṇis.

original: indra ekaṃ sūrya ekaṃ jajāna venād ekaṃ svadhayā niṣ ṭatakṣuḥ //
analyzed: indraḥ ekam sūryaḥ ekam jajāna venāt ekam svadhayā niḥ tatakṣuḥ
translated: Indra begat one, the sun one; from Vena they fashioned one by their own power.

original: etā arṣanti hṛdyāt samudrāc chatavrajā ripuṇā nāvacakṣe /
analyzed: etāḥ arṣanti hṛdyāt samudrāt śata vrajāḥ ripuṇā na avacakṣe
translated: These flow from the heart, from the ocean, the hundred-streamed, not to be looked at by an enemy.

original: ghṛtasya dhārā abhi cākaśīmi hiraṇyayo vetaso madhya āsām //
analyzed: ghṛtasya dhārāḥ abhi cākaśīmi hiraṇyayaḥ vetasaḥ madhye āsām
translated: I behold the streams of ghee, the reed of gold is in their midst.

original: samyak sravanti sarito na dhenā antar hṛdā manasā pūyamānāḥ /
analyzed: samyak sravanti saritaḥ na dhenāḥ antar hṛdā manasā pūyamānāḥ
translated: They flow together like rivers to the milk, purified in the heart and mind.

original: ete arṣanty ūrmayo ghṛtasya mṛgā iva kṣipaṇor īṣamāṇāḥ //🔽sindhor iva prādhvane śūghanāso vātapramiyaḥ patayanti yahvāḥ /
analyzed: ete arṣanti ūrmayaḥ ghṛtasya mṛgāḥ iva kṣipaṇoḥ īṣamāṇāḥ  sindhoḥ iva prādhvane śūghanāsaḥ vātapramiyaḥ patayanti yahvāḥ
translated: These waves of ghee flow forth, striving like deer for the thrower.🔽Like the Sindhu on its way, the mighty ones, delighted by the wind, the young ones fly.

original: ghṛtasya dhārā aruṣo na vājī kāṣṭhā bhindann ūrmibhiḥ pinvamānaḥ //🔽abhi pravanta samaneva yoṣāḥ kalyāṇyaḥ smayamānāso agnim /
analyzed: ghṛtasya dhārāḥ aruṣaḥ na vājī kāṣṭhāḥ bhindan ūrmibhiḥ pinvamānaḥ  abhi samanā iva yoṣāḥ kalyāṇyaḥ smayamānāsaḥ agnim
translated: The streams of ghee, like a red steed, bursting the dams, swelling with waves.🔽They hasten to Agni, like young women to a gathering, the lovely ones, smiling, full of joy.

original: ghṛtasya dhārāḥ samidho nasanta tā juṣāṇo haryati jātavedāḥ //
analyzed: ghṛtasya dhārāḥ samidhaḥ nasanta tāḥ juṣāṇaḥ haryati jātavedāḥ
translated: The streams of ghee become the kindling sticks. The all-knower, delighted, carries them away.

original: kanyā iva vahatum etavā u añjy añjānā abhi cākaśīmi /
analyzed: kanyāḥ iva vahatum etavai u añjī añjānāḥ abhi cākaśīmi
translated: I see them, as if two maidens, anointed with red ointment, going to the wedding.

original: yatra somaḥ sūyate yatra yajño ghṛtasya dhārā abhi tat pavante //
analyzed: yatra somaḥ sūyate yatra yajñaḥ ghṛtasya dhārāḥ abhi tat pavante
translated: Where the Soma is pressed, where the sacrifice is, the streams of ghee flow over that.

original: abhy arṣata suṣṭutiṃ gavyam ājim asmāsu bhadrā draviṇāni dhatta /
analyzed: abhi arṣata suṣṭutim gavyam ājim asmāsu bhadrā draviṇāni dhatta
translated: Flow to the praise, to the race for cattle. Bestow upon us good and valuable possessions.

original: imaṃ yajñaṃ nayata devatā no ghṛtasya dhārā madhumat pavante //🔽dhāman te viśvam bhuvanam adhi śritam antaḥ samudre hṛdy antar āyuṣi /
analyzed: imam yajñam nayata devatāḥ naḥ ghṛtasya dhārāḥ madhumat pavante  dhāman te viśvam bhuvanam adhi śritam antar samudre hṛdi antar āyuṣi
translated: Lead this sacrifice of ours to the gods. The streams of ghee, full of honey, flow over.🔽In your abode all the world is established, in the heart, in the innermost part of life, in the ocean.

original: apām anīke samithe ya ābhṛtas tam aśyāma madhumantaṃ ta ūrmim //
analyzed: apām anīke samithe yaḥ ābhṛtaḥ tam aśyāma madhumantam te ūrmim
translated: The one who is brought in the front of the waters in the gathering, may we obtain that wave of yours, full of honey.
